Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Bernard O
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a coureous and spontaneous upgrade to the Crystal Club, I could enjoy an outstanding service and care. Great location, convenient rooms.Great ladies.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Cathy M
Reviews.Content: From the time I touched down at Changi Airport and found a driver waiting just for me..to being returned to the airport 2 days later, my stay in Singapore was all about SERVICE! The staff out the front to collect your bags..the reception staff..help with baggage to room.. this place really know how to spoil a visitor. Enjoyed the pool facility, and the room was very good though smallish. Heading out at the start of the rain for the afternoon..I was offered a hotel umbrella to borrow. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A short but pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: theoldone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days on the way to a beach holiday. The hotel was centrally placed for walking to the centre of Singapore. The only downside was that arriving mid morning after a 13 hour flight and half hour transfer our room was not ready and we had to walk around the area in clothing suitable for England - and desperately tired. The hotel has a restaurant attached and we had a very pleasant, if quite expensive breakfast here. There are many other restaurants for evening meals. Everything is about the same price as London. We picked up the hop on hop off bus tour outside the hotel for a day and this was good value. Went up the "Boat hotel" - very good views. Botanical gardens are lovely - and free!

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Dirk F
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and received an unexpected upgrade to the crystal level. I was surprised how well the hotel and the rooms are designed. We felt very comfortable and well taken care of. What we can really recommend is the very nice pool. It is compared to other - more expensive hotels - phantastic. The gym is also well equipped. The Crystal Club is probably the best treat. It is a small yet comfortable area where you can relax with a nice view, a good glass of wine and staff that takes care of you. For those who travel as much I do a wonderful treat! The location is great. For those who love the action and huge selection you are in the right area BUT you will find the quite and cosy places along the Singapore river heading the other direction. Accross the street you will also find a wine bar with a large cheese selection. I will switch from the hotel where I usually stay to the Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pillidge
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the fantastic start to our honeymoon, we stayed here for two nights and were so spoilt! We were upgraded to a gorgeous suite with a lovely and modern bathroom with a fantastic bath! Great pool facilities, fabulous club lounge with views- afternoon tea and evenings drinks canapés served here. It is in a perfect location right in the heart of Singapore.The staff were so helpful and very keen to help with even the smallest things. The only real problem was we didn't want to leave the hotel to explore the rest of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Crystal Club Rooms highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: silvertraveller26
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend the Park Hotel Crystal Club.The room was comfortable and clean, if a little small for an executive suite. Unfortunately the view was not great. However, the staff were friendly and helpful. Can recommend the happy hour - no need to go out for dinner. I even got a cake on my birthday! The hotel is ideally situated near the river. We found we could walk round Singapore from there. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and loved Singapore and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to Club”
Reviews.Author: RichardPWirral
Reviews.Content: Because we booked in advance we were given a free upgrade to a Club double. This is like traveling business class with free evening drinks and light meals. It is a hotel within a hotel with a peaceful private lounge on the 10th floor. The extra facilities offered are very good indeed - a limited amount of free laundry, late check out etc- and on top of that the staff are brilliant and they could not do enough to make our stay very easy, comfortable and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “"Ditto" to most other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Casscruise2 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with most reviews written, it is a nice hotel, we found the staff to be warm and welcoming although some of the concierge staff weren't as knowledgable as others (eg my daughter wanted McDonalds and we were sent in the complete wrong direction)! But we couldn't fault for cleanliness, and the bathroom was fine but the rooms were exactly as others have described SMALL - some of the smallest I have ever stayed in and hence my reason for not rating this hotel more highly. I think for a family of 4 it would almost be impossible - for my daughters and I we pushed the two single beds (and they are only single) together and the 3 of us slept that way - they had said we could have a rollaway (at extra cost) but I have absolutely no idea where it would have been put!!!! They also have a lovely pool area - again wonderfully clean! Would we stay here again?? probably not due to the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, location and service for”
Reviews.Author: Cala084
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for exploring Singapore by foot, by subway or by Taxi. Alert staff who never hesitated to help out and do their best also when they were in the middle of transfering booking system into a new platform they managed to keep up the service level. We got a room for early check in, stored our bags when leaving Singapore a couple of days for other adventures and were greeted with a smile and welcome back on our return. Good breakfast although, as usual, priced a bit too high. Nice atmosphere in the surroundings with winebars and restaurants to last for months. Unfortunately we only had a few days to spare.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: HiHi_0404
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Park hotel for three nights on a recent business trip with colleagues and this is value for money. Even though all rooms are small but perfectly formed and the hotel have a beautiful pool. My comments to this hotel is just simple great. There was always a warm welcome when you walked through their front doors. Not to mention their attention to detail from remembering names to cleaning the rooms. Thanks to all the lovely staff who made me very welcome. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Join the Crystal Club”
Reviews.Author: BarryLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at this hotel and paid extra to have Crystal Club membership which gave us many benefits and extra facilities to use. Worth every penny, the service was exclellent, friendly staff, nothing was too much trouble. Whilst not at the centre of the city, the location is good as it is a pleasant walk along the river to the central attractions. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: REJ2312
Reviews.Content: It would be difficult to imagine a better place to spend the last five days of our six week holiday. From the moment we arrived just before midnight until we packed our bags to leave we were given superb service in a quiet, friendly and unobtrusive manner. If you want to explore the many delights of Singapore, we would not hesitate to recommend the Club class floors at The Park Hotel. Linda and Ralph Jackman

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Park Hotel, Clarke Quay for 3 nights leaving on the 12th of April 2012. Plus - Crystal Club and the attentativeness of the staff, in particular Evelyn, Sue and Alexis. Nothing was too much trouble. They even produced a birthday cake on my wife's birthday and I will not forget the surprises on my wife and my faces when they came out singing happy birthday. - Views from our hotel room over Clarke Quay at night. - Great location for access to Clarke Quay but seemed central to all major shopping centres and attractions. - Over all staff were out to please and went out of their way to assist Negatives - Check-in was impersonal and not informative at all. (This was counted by staff in the Crystal Club) - Towels provided in the rooms need to be updated/renewed. Would defintely stay again

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Park hotel, Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: GregSinagapore
Reviews.Content: I was only staying in Singapore for a couple of days with no time for sight seeing and busy schedule. After a long day I was impressed by the friendly staff and comfortable environment, even at 4 o'clock in the morning. The view from the 10th floor lounge is impressive. I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near to Clarke quay”
Reviews.Author: Silvio75Amberg
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay for 2 days, staff is very friendly and a very good location

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 night's stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan1109
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through our travel agent. We didn't mind the size of the room. It was a Superior room and didn't bother us as we were out most of the time sightseeing. It seems most newer hotels are smaller in size in Singapore. Perhaps, most of the reviewers had not read more about the Size of the room when placing a room booking. The service we encountered from the main reception and breakfast at the restaurant was excellent. We got our room ready at about noon though our flight arrived pretty early in the morning. The swimming pool is always busy but was great. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “More like a basic 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crepes2
Reviews.Content: More Robertson Quay than Clarke Quay. Not what I would expect having stayed at the Park hotel Tokyo. V basic small rooms described as superior. Requested a double but given a twin room. There were dirty socks under the bed. The reception staff were indifferent and rude on several occasions. Its generally noisy - early in the morning the cleaner hoovers the corridor and at all hours there is construction going on. The pool is nice.

Reviews.Title: “short,but sweet”
Reviews.Author: djpeterlewis
Reviews.Content: what limited time [3 days] we had it was clean,tidy and very friendly wont hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bandslondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and had booked a Crystal Club room. The hotel is very convenient for Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay with all the bars, restaurants, etc. The hotel runs a shuttle bus, to the City. The Crystal Club room was well worth the extra money as the breakfast on the 10th floor was excellent, as were the food and drinks, etc. served between 5.30 p.m. and 7.30 p.m. The staff in the Crystal Club were extremely helpful and charming. We had a midnight flight and were able to stay in our room until 6.00 p.m., after which we stayed in the Crystal Club until we left for the airport at 8.30 p.m. The hotel also gave my husband a birthday cake on his birthday, which was a lovely surprise. The swimming pool was a welcome relief after a hot day sightseeing. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay In this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 25-29th Feb 2012 in what was called a superior room, it should have been classed as an inferior room. The room was tiny and would not have been big enough for one person never mind two,I have stayed in a bigger room in a Premier Inn. Having visited Asia on many occasions and Singapore twice before I have never had anything other than excellent hotels so this was extremely disappointing. On the night we arrived we asked for a drink and sat on the seating area outside, the waiter took our order and then returned and told us we would have to wait 15 mins for our order as they were counting up the chits from dinner. Having just spent two weeks before that in Vietnam in wonderful hotels I would recommend that the staff from this hotel went to Vietnam and learned a few tips on customer service. There are many wonderful hotels in Singapore but this is definately NOT one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Club Deluxe”
Reviews.Author: LEXUSGAL
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our normal accommodations to the Club Deluxe at the lovely Park Hotel which is in a fabulous location on Clark Quay. It is near the boat tours of the canal and the wonderful walking areas on both sides of the river. We are on the 9th floor with concierge services which are wonderful with a free full breakfast in the mornings till 10:30AM. Free drinks and appetizers on the 10th floor from 5:30Pm till 8:00 PM. An English Singapore newspaper is in a canvas bag every morning. The rooms extremely clean though a bit small. HD Flat screen and free WIFI or LAN internet services. There are PC's on the 10th floor that a guest can use for free. Lovely, polite, unobtrusive staff who look for ways to assist you and answer questions.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomsBeds
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel Clarke Key is well situated for the Clarke Key and Boat Key areas of the city and within easy walking distance of China town and the major shopping areas. It has a nice pool and the rooms of good size, Unfortuately our tour company booked us on a smoking floor and we could not change it. This was not the hotels fault but I have marked the rooms down because we were not happy.Most people were in fact happy with their rooms. Breakfasts were good and staff helpfull through out

Reviews.Title: “SHOULD HAVE STAYED ON THE PLANE!!!”
Reviews.Author: caneable
Reviews.Content: We had made a previous stopover at Singapore and on that occasion stayed at the Copthorne Kings. I found the Park Hotel Clarke Quay to be a poor choice in comparison. Our room was very small with little space for anything. The overall dimensions of the main room could have been little more than 3m x 2.5m and into that space they'd crammed a double bed, bedside cabinets, a desk and one armchair. In fairness its in very tasteful design and co-ordinates well with the wood panelling. In keeping with this general lack of living space, the wardrobe was only about 75 cm wide and not really up to storing more than a wekend or three day stay's clothing. I don't think it would suffice for a week. We had all our luggage piled around the side of the room, because there was nowhere to store it. In direct contrast to the rest of the room , the bathroom was an extremely generous space, with a good sized shower and sink counter. Our rate included breakfast but I'm afraid to say that the fare was pretty tasteless stuff, so it mattered little that there was plenty of it. Fortunately there's a wide range of restaurants in the immediate vicinity, including excellent restaurants and cheap and cheerful food courts. I found the front desk staff to be quite a dour crowd, making minimal eye contact and showing little interest in guests, although the bell boy staff were evry good and the concierge was an excellent source of suggestion for food and entertainment. There's an excellent free shuttle service into town via the Clarke Quay subway station which seems to run to a very reliable timetable. But those points barely justify the room fee charged. Taking all of this into consideration, I couldn't recommend the Park Hotel Clarke Quay as an option for any kind of visit to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel is ... OK”
Reviews.Author: Roberta V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 'OK" - but has a few problems. Firstly - the rooms are a bit smaller than say at the Novotel for the same price. AND there is a bright light that shines outside EVERY window and you have to draw your blinds tight on every floor to get some sleep - it is most annoying. Also, the food is 'so-so' and very expensive for what it is. More-over the menu is limited. There is no wireless in the rooms so you need to keep your laptop on the desk and can't use it anywhere else in the hotel. I've had on-going problems with the treadmills also in the gym. On the up-side - the staff are very nice and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ladyUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel, very good location at Clarke Quay. Staff were very friendly and very helpful, rooms clean and comfortable just lacking enough space for clothes as no drawers only hanging space but not a major problem. Pool was lovely and had spa facilities, pool staff very friendly would recommend and good value for money in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Laur253
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel in Clarke Quay is very located in Singapore, close to MRT, lots of restaurants and bars, and many local attractions such as Chinatown. The rooms are on the smaller side but comfortable for 2 people. The pool area is large and was not very crowded during the day, with plenty of seating. We did not try the restaurant at the hotel as there is a huge variety nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: dolly070759
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, quiet and clean hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. Handy location for walking to most places and easy walking to underground trains which are very efficient and easy to use. Recommend the "crystal" club as you get the rooms on the top floors and access to the club longe with complimentary internet and refreshenments throughout the day. Breakfast very good but water not available unless you ask specifically for it (no problem for staff to get it for you but you do need to ask.) The bathrooms do have a design flaw, There is a small 'lip/step' into the bathrooms - not too much of a problem in the rooms but this same 2cm step occurs in the bathrooms in the lobby and is so placed directly beneath the door where there is no warning of the step and where you least expect it. Took a tumble coming out of the ladies as my foot caught the step and I hit the wall, hurting my shoulder and grazing my knees. The consierge came running and helped me up and was most concerned and offered to take me into the restaurant to sit and recover but I said I was ok as my husband (bless) was totally oblivious to my fall as he was waiting outside. Didn't stop our days sightseeing. Loved Singapore and this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MorrieX29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights after a fabulous 2 weeks in Vietnam. Singapore is a favourite destination of ours. On arrival we were placed on a smoking floor with no notice until we stepped out of the lift and the smell hit us. I rang reception to be told sorry there was no other equal room available until the next day and that we should have specifically requested non smoking. This is not something we normally have to do and it would be better to assume guests do not smoke rather than the other way round. As we were staying in Singapore for my 50 th birthday celebrations it was quite disappointing. The rooms are tiny, and there are no ledges for cases at all, and not enough floor space to have 2 cases open at once. The position of the hotel is quite convenient and when the new MRT station opens up it will be even better. The young girl on the desk when we checked in could not raise a smile at all and we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for easy access to Singapore centre”
Reviews.Author: cadra
Reviews.Content: We have just completed 5 days at The Park Hotel. This hotel is in a great location for easy access to all the town centre locations. It is very close to the metro, buses and taxis are always available. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful always ready to assist with any issues. We had arranged breakfast as part of our stay and this was good quality and varied, well worth considering. All in all this hotel provided great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: SallyStan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Singapore having 4 nights accommodation at Park Hotel. We were late checking in but because we had a Club Room we had a separate check-in desk and the check-in was seamless. Our room on the 10th floor was virtually opposite the Club Lounge where we could get breakfast from 7.00am to 10.30am and then hot and cold drinks with biscuits throughout the day. Then at 5.30pm to 7.30pm alcoholic beverages were served together with a buffet which was substantial enough for us not to want another meal. After 7.30 we could still get drinks. The staff were all extremely attentive and cheerful. Jessica looked after us most of the time and ensured we got what we wanted. Generally all the staff at the Club Lounge were extremely helpful and gave advice when we asked about what to see and do. The breakfast was a variety of eggs, bacon, toast, croissants and Singapore dishes with tea and coffee flowing. The evening buffet was equally good. The hotel was set 5 minutes walk from Clarke Quay and all the shops around the River. Unfortunately the rooms were quite small and we did a bit of juggling with our suitcases. The Reception desk on the ground floor was busy a lot of the time and the staff didn't seem to cope well when it was busy. I didn't realize until we left that the Club rooms used the reception within the Club Lounge. Finally I think the arrangement to use a room facility to freshen up before you depart needs to change. It is on a first come first served arrangement but a booking system I think is needed. The hotel was fully booked on the day of departure and we had to leave our room by 12.00 noon. I understood we could use a hotel room prior to departure but we couldn't book. When we went to use the room (after my swim) at 5.30 pm we were told there were 2 couples in front of us and we couldn't use the room for an hour (6.30). I said if I had realized there would have been a queue I would have come earlier as we were due to leave the hotel at 7.00 pm which didn't give us much time to shower and change. The manager said he would try and get us in as early as possible (he did manage to get us in at 6.15 but it was still a rush for me). Before we could use the hotel room we decided to go to the Club Lounge for a snack and drink before we changed (my hair was wet so was I and I was fed up with the situation) but decided to make the most of it. However when I got to the Club Lounge I noticed our room was being cleaned at 5.30 pm so we could have had our room later anyway. Very disappointing!I Apart from not getting a late check out I would go back to this hotel again but would only want a Club Room.

Reviews.Title: “A good chice for the clarke quay area.”
Reviews.Author: TommyDevon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of the month. The check in was efficient but not overly friendly. Our room, whilst small - as we had expected from previous reviews, was nice with a view over the pool. It had most of the amenities you could want (except for an ironing board and bath tub) and was clean and well serviced during our stay. The hotel is well situated for the attractions of the Clarke Quay area. Without a doubt the best reason for staying at this hotel is the excellent outdoor swimming pool which comes as a welcome relief on the hot humid days to be had in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Staffing, Services & Location all Very Good Here!”
Reviews.Author: RicknElsie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 3 nts here. Staff were very friendly & helpful throughout our stay. Our room size was adequate and bed very comfortable. No tub in bathroom but the shower more than made up for this. The bathroom size was more than adequate with lots of counter space. Room had a safe which we appreciated. Nice flat screen tv. Complimentary water was provided in the room. Hotel had a small fitness room which was adequate. The fitness center could add a spin bike. Hotel had free WiFi on 2nd floor and lobby. Hotel is well located about a 10 minute walk to Clake Quay. Clarke Quay has a load of restaurants. The River Taxi or River Cruise could be gotten on there as well as the a bus stop for the Hop Off Hop On bus! We purchased a Singapore Pass which included a number of tourist attractions including the Flyer, Hop On Hop Off bus, Ductours. Overall, we would recommend this hotel for a stay here. Cab fair from Changi Airport to our hotel in Clarke Quay was $25 SGD.

Reviews.Title: “Average to Good”
Reviews.Author: LindaMc108
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel in my opinion falls between the average and very good ratings allowed. It is certainly a little above average but falls quite a bit short of very good. My husband and I had a club room and the advantages of this are complimentary soft drinks thoughout the day and hot hors d'oeuvres and alchohol 5 30 until 7 30. Although this seems generous of course it's all reflected in the price of the room. Also we had complimentary two pieces of washing per day per room with restrictions. The rest of the advantages would be for people in Singapore on business. The rooms are very small but the cleaning is of a high standard especially the bathroom which I could find no fault with . On the club floor the staff were very attentive but less so in reception. The park however, is fairly well placed. This is a difficult hotel to review, we paid more than a fair amount for the three night stay we had and for that money I do expect plenty of room and very good service, we certainly didnt get the space although the service was overall quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: ajcph
Reviews.Content: No bathtub and room is small but this is not unexpected for the price we paid for. Pool is very nice and it opens until 11pm. Location is the big pro of this hotel. Just 5min walk from Clarke Quay. This is a great place for nightlife and it doesn't sleep. Con? Hmm. A bit far to walk to the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loobylooWirral
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights at The Park Hotel 28th Feb- 6th Mar 2012. Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel very centrally placed for getting around and shuttle bus was useful. View from room was fantastic and room very comfortable. Swimming pool very good. Would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueboySoutheast
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Park Hotel. The facilities are excellent and the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a five-ten minute walk from Clark Quay MRT depending on your mobility. It is well placed for the CBD and getting around the island. The level of cleanliness is exemplary, the room was a reasonable size for a city hotel. We had no problem stowing our bags in the wardrobe provided. The bathroom facilities are superb with a large walk-in shower. The breakfast was excellent with a wide range of fresh and freshly cooked food to suite all reasonable tastes. The dining area was busy at breakfast but this is a large, busy, well-run establishment. There is also an excellent swimming pool for taking a dip or just relaxing on the sunbeds. Ours was a night time flight and reception also gave us a late check-out time at no extra cost. Several hours after checking out we were even given free use of a room to shower and freshen-up before collecting our luggage which we had stored there. This is an excellent hotel and will certainly stay there when we visit Singapore again. We do not work for the Park Hotel and are not related to any employee!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WallyowlOrpinton
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 3 nights but found the rooms too small . We could hardly move with 2 large and 2 small suitcases. The location of the hotel is great, only 3 minutes walk to Clarke Quay. We only drank in the hotel on one occasion as the prices were excessive:18 Singapore $ for a pint (12 Sing. $ for a half). Only a few chairs in the reception area which makes it difficult to use Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: Diana M
Reviews.Content: We chose Park Hotel Clarke Quay again for its location. A cheap taxi ride to Orchard Road, ChinaTown, Tiong Bahru Market, etc for our shopping. Excellent Undercover parking at the front for taxis and pick up by friends. And an underground carpark for friends and relatives who came for a longer visit at the hotel (they had free parking what a bonus!). Although the room was small, it was sufficient for us including our two walkers (three wheels and four wheels). The view from the club lounge was fantastic. There was a good view of the Singapore river, its surrounds and a joy watching the bum boats go up and down the river. All the staff at the Crystal Club were most helpful and attentive providing a good service. The Happy Hour (which was from 5:30 pm to 7:30 pm daily) was a pleasant break from our shopping. Drinks and nibbles were served in the club lounge to the club members who attended. We enjoyed our second visit and would return again for a third this year.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: GillianJonathan
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Singapore where we had a four night break en route to Thailand. Hotel was welcoming and we were soon given our room on level 4. However It proved a real disappointment because although we were expecting small it was very small and the view from the window was just of another hotel wall! Next morning I asked at reception whether there was a chance of moving to the front with a view over Singapore. They couldn't have been more helpful and said a new room would be ready that afternoon - just pack our bags - and the porter would move them. Returning from our day out we were shown to new room which was also on 4th level but bigger, overlooking the pool and a view over Singapore. Hotel location was good just few minutes walk to river. Also great breakfast and refreshing pool. We enjoyed our stay but would recommend to take a room overlooking pool at front.

Reviews.Title: “happy staff & great service”
Reviews.Author: Dharla f
Reviews.Content: We had a club room, fantastic. It was well worth the money, the club lounge is wonderful with all of the extra's. All of the staff are very friendly and always had a smile for us. The shuttle bus is a great idea and the driver is happy and helpful. They gave us a late check out and we did not even have to ask. We were polite and friendly to them, they in return were doubly so to us. We did not have to wait for anything, everything was instant. Would stay there again for our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Sueel”
Reviews.Author: Sue S
Reviews.Content: One first seeing the hotel it looked great and the reservation staff were really helpful. Sadly after that we had a number of issue - we sat out side on the first evening and ordered drinks, only to be told that we would have to wait 15mins for our drinks. The room although clean was very small and basically you had to put you case on the bed to get any clothes out. I asked about upgrading (on floor 3) and was told that the next type of room to upgrade would be the same floor space, only difference was that it was on a higher floor with better view!!!! Staff in general were good but it would seem that there was a lacked of consistency when asking the same question to different staff - very mixed messages to customers I have stayed in the Pan Pacific in Singapore which was a much better hotel and from my experience I would definatelly not stay at the Park again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanandjohn51
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this holiday for three nights during a stopover on our way to Australia. We found it accessible for Clarke Quay, Robertson Quay and not far from Chinatown. We did not have breakfast there so cannot comment. We found the staff very helpful whenever we had any queries. All-in-all we really enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to stay again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A great location....a fantastic breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: mel51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights,three days, whilst waiting to join a cruise ship. We found the staff extremely helpful and attentive, the rooms, not massive, but more than adequate for our purposes (we only sleep in the rooms as we are out sightseeing all day)and a breakfast to die for. I believe that the people who said that there was little or poor selection, must have stayed in a different hotel from me. I only wish that every hotel that I ever stayed in gave such a beautiful start to the day! The rooms were also spotless and the bathroom was fitted with a choice of two shower heads to give a full range of power or spray pattern. All in all, a first class stay, I could not fault any single service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, looks fantastic, but nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_B18
Reviews.Content: Great for a singleton on a 1 to 2 night business trip but not for couples on an extended stay. Lobby services and the breakfast facilities were woefully inadequate and lacked any polish. Staff were unsmiling and almost robotic. They did not appear to have undergone any customer facing training. The biggest problem however was the rooms, they are so small it required you to live out of your suitcase. With two of us for three nights it was an obstacle course just getting in and out of bed and using the bathroom. Apart from benefitting from a prime location it cannot be compared with UK style chain hotels such as IBIS or Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Prime Location but Gruesome Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mch_winkman
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great service, prime location nearby Clark Quay restaurants, pool, proper rooms ....but the worth breakfast I ever had on my Asia trips. * crowded (not enough places in the morning peak) * almost no Asian dishes (great disaster!) * bad service (hectic, over challenged) * boring (predominantly) continental/American breakfast * gruesome quality (out of coffee, limited fruits, watery juices, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel & good location”
Reviews.Author: Ferry M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is approx. a 25 mins. drive from Changi airport by taxi (+/- SD 20,-) and is very well located near Singapore River; Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay are only minutes away with lots of bars and many restaurants (incl. European food) there are also some shopping malls nearby. The nearest MRT station is 10 mins away (Clarke Quay). Shopping heaven Orchard Road is about 15 mins. walking. The hotel lobby is not very big but the hotel staff is efficient and very nice and helpful. Free wifi is only available on the ground floor and possibly the 2nd floor but certainly not on the 7th floor (where we stayed). There is an ethernet outlet in the room for a wired internet connection but that is not free. The Superiour rooms are rather small (not a lot of space to put away your luggage) but they are very clean and the overall condition is very good, the beds sleep well and the airco is nice and quiet; the bathroom is well equipped and the rainshower is so refreshing! The hotel has a good size outdoors swimming pool with a whirlpool, showers, changeroom and a bar. The restaurant serves good food (we had the seafood buffet) but the coffee was a little disappointing but luckily there is a Starbucks 5 mins. away where you can also have croissants and muffins if you don't like a big breakfast. Conclusion: good hotel, fine location and most important very friendly and helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore”
Reviews.Author: Bigkev53
Reviews.Content: The staff are all extremely pleasant and helpful. The room was a good size and well maintained. There is a tiny lobby/public waiting area but this seems common in Singapore. The location is more Robertson Quay than Clarke Quay but taxis are not expensive. The sightseeing bus stops just over the main road.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jean-in-Spain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Park Hotel Clarke Quay for 2 nights on a trip from the UK to Australia. Singapore was a stop over to break up the journey. I was travelling with my husband and another couple and we all liked the hotel. The staff were very helpful. One of our suitcases had been damaged during the journey and they arranged to get it repaired within 24 hours. They made a charge, of course, but they had to out-source the repair and get it returned within a 2 night stay. They did a good job, it lasted for the next 12 flights! Yes, this was the first hotel on a BIG holiday. The rooms are pleasant, albeit a bit on the small side, but then so many city based hotels do have small rooms these days. They were certainly nice and clean and the beds were comfortable. There is large swimming pool with a nice pool area. We didn't use the pool as we were not there long enough, but it did look inviting. The hotel provided a very good breakfast selection (we had breakfast included) and there was a chef in attendance to make fried eggs, omelettes, etc. The location is very good, just a couple of minutes walk to the river and to bars, shops and restaurants. I can't comment on whether it was good value for money because the hotel was booked in a package with other hotels, flights, transfers etc. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 131Anonymous
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel is a very nice hotel, in a great location. There are shops and restaurants within close proximity, otherwise taxis are available from the lobby, for quite cheap. The buffet breakfast, served daily is definitely worth while paying for, during you're stay. The staff were absolutely lovely and could not be faulted. The rooms are very small, but never the less, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation by the Singapore River”
Reviews.Author: wirraldee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel twice during our recent trip. First time was for one night and we were upgraded to the executive suites floor which was great with complimentary breakfast and free internet access. Second time was for three nights and I couldn't fault the non-executive rooms - very comfortable. Staff are helpful and allowed us to leave our large suitcases between stays so we could travel light to Langkawi. In Singapore, watch out for the local taxes etc which adds quite a bit to the stated room rate. Would stay here again on a future visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jools011
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel but found the receptionists a little cool. Room was peasant enough although not that big. Very clean. Very convenient for Clarke quay and surrounding areas. Very buzzy night life along the river (Sat night) which was really great, like New Years Eve in London. Plenty of places to eat etc. Within walking distance of Marina bay and all the high rise buildings and the three tower hotel, Fullerton hotel etc etc. Just by chance we happened upon a brilliant laser show (must have been 11pm) across the bay from the Fullerton and the must see Lion/Fish emblem statue, We also happened to catch a free concert by the "Durian", went up to the roof top gardens to see the laser show. Great timing and a nice walk after eating near our Hotel. Would stay at this Hotel again. (Another bonus you can leave your bags in reception and go sightseeing etc, they also lend you a room in which to shower, good stuff. Would also recommend the Brewertz for eats and drinks and watching the world go by in the day. (over the road from the Hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Mike W. Review”
Reviews.Author: 584MichaelW584
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I was in town for the Singapore Air Show and stayed 8 nights at this hotel. The staff is wonderful, the Crystal Club Lounge serves a great breatfast and wonderful happy hour. The hotel is within easy walking distance to a variety of restuarants and nightlife in the Ckark Quay section along the Singapore River. It has a very nice pool and outdoor bar for drink and food. This is a first class hotel at very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time experience in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BigAlScotland
Reviews.Content: Very good reception with helpful staff. Room was clean and fine for a 2 night stay but if staying longer we would have wanted a larger one. Bathroom was well fitted out with a very good shower. The staff were all very helpful and any requests were dealt with promptly. We were allowed a delayed check out time which made for a more relaxed last day (morning). All the food we had was of a good quality and breakfast was very good. The hotel is well placed for exploration of Singapore. We would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming place to stay”
Reviews.Author: johnac001
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights so really got to know this relatively new hotel. Yes, the rooms are smallish, but we managed cope. Otherwise, the rooms are very comfortable and modern with all amenities. We chose to stay in a "Crystal Club" room. Well worth the extra cost as the package then includes breakfast and evening cocktails in the top floor lounge as well as free wifi and 2 items of laundry per day. The staff in the lounge, ably led by Evelyn, were helpful at all times. For the business traveller, evening cocktails would suffice for a quick dinner as the hot snacks are plentiful. Alternatively, there are numerous restaurants in the area immediately surrounding the hotel. The hotel location is excellent, only a few minutes from either Orchard Road, the Raffles precinct and the business district. Overall, a great choice for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good rather than exceptional”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoast01traveller
Reviews.Content: Club level room, was clean and smart, but room and bathroom smaller than I would have expected. Breakfast selection good rather than exceptional. Staff very good. Wifi included in package was useful when so many insist on charging exorbitant rates. Closest MRT was a few minutes walk away, as was Clarke Quay dining area. Would I stay again? maybe, but with so many hotels in this price range and level of service in Singapore...

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect much room!”
Reviews.Author: DaveChisholm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated to explore the main delights of Singapore. Jsut two minutes walk from the Singapore river where you can hitch a ride on the famous "Bum Boats" and explore the harbour etc. However, the room we stayed in was a "superior" room, and to describe it as small may well be understaing the truth. On the internet, the pictures of the superior room look to be spacious and airy, but the reality is a polar opposite. With just one small wardrobe and no storage draws in the room it is impossible to unpack your clothes. This results in living out of your suitcases which have to be left out in the room and this removes the last remaining space in there. The staff are all friendly and helpful and that is why we rated it as average, but for that it would have been poor. So if space is not an issue then stay here, but if you like to at least walk around the bed, then perhaps you should consider somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & clean but small rooms....Location good”
Reviews.Author: K L
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Park hotel for couple of nights, passing through Singapore from Male to HK. Hotel was nice but rather bland hotel with smallish rooms. Staff was good and friendy. Price was slightly on the high side but still much cheaper & better value than the hotels near or at Orchard St..... Walking distance to Clark quays, major area for restaurants/ bars in Singapore.. Easy access to MRT so getting around Singapore not a problem.. Did notice the hotel seemed very popular with business community, rather than tourists....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: beachfreaks
Reviews.Content: As per previous reviews. Nothing special but adequate, Great location for Clarke Quay (make sure you have taken out a mortgage for a night out). Breakfast was very good and restaurant nice and airy. We arrived after flight from London @ 9.00am and room not ready until 11.00 there was no offer of letting us have somewhere to shower and chill out so had to wander around for the couple of hours until room was ready. Location was very good for getting to China Town and MRT station close by.

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel. Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mark c
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, a regular neighboring guest said I had a bigger room (corner room) so I'm guessing the others are little compact as well. Club lounge was small and busy but the staff were very good. The walk from the hotel to the Merlion is lovely. Lots of places to eat, drink and relax enroute. Location gets it 4 out of 5. 3 otherwise. As other reviews say, functional not special.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job - good, functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritPopLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Hotel for a three night business trip. It was absolutely fine without being particularly special - but at the price I would happily recommend it. Good points: early check-in (9am after overnight flight from London) and 2pm late check-out arranged with no problems and for no extra charge. Breakfast was fine and fairly priced at S$25. Location excellent if you're travelling by yourself as I was: perfect for an early-morning jog along the Singapore River and endless options of good bars & restaurants on your doorstep for people-watching over dinner. Not so good points: no wi-fi in rooms (although free wi-fi in reception and by pool). Restaurant is quite small and gets crowded during breakfast. Sleep quality distinctly average due to poor noise insulation and low-quality pillows. Service was always cheerful and efficient; in the round, this is a perfectly good option if you want something central and dependable.

Reviews.Title: “Value Added Services”
Reviews.Author: Salman13
Reviews.Content: Never had an impression that this hotel can be that nice, stayed for 5 days , awesome view of clubbing hub Boat Quay, rooms are nice but a little small ( you can't expect more from Singapore) but lounge services, free drinks, free internet, spa was nice, staff friendly , cleanliness say 4 out of 5. A nice hotel. Definitely yes for next trip.......

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel,very well looked after”
Reviews.Author: cuddlesWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in January 2012. The hotel was lovely and clean and very comfortable with some very helpful staff especially Anand .

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, eat breakfast elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: AnSoH
Reviews.Content: Had reserved a non smoking room. Got a room that was not - it smelled awful! The hotel quickly gave us a new room. However, the new room had adjoining doors, so woke up with the neighbour's alarm clock at 5 am. We could hear everyting from the other room. The day after we got our 3rd room - but no excuse or upgrade from the hotel. The breakfast is nothing to pay for - better off eating somewhere outside the hotel. We ended up going outside even if we had paid for our breakfast upfront. The wifi can only be accessed in the lobby and by the pool - not at the room. If you want to access from your room, you need to use a cable and pay extra according to the hotel staff. Do not understand the good reviews this hotel has gotten - would never stay here again! However, location is very good.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great service”
Reviews.Author: twinkletoze
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Park Hotel Clark Quay where we stayed for four nights on our return from New Zealand. We booked a Club room and was given a room on the 10th floor where the Crystal Club is situated. We cannot praise highly enought the service efficiency and attentiveness of the staff or the standard of food we received during our stay and would highly recommend it. The only downside was that we felt the room was a little small and the storage space inadequate if you are staying for longer than a few nights. However, that would not stop us from booking this hotel again. If you are thinking of booking this hotel go for the Club rooms where you get all the benefits that go with the Crystal Club.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning cityscape views and central to attractions”
Reviews.Author: globerunner1
Reviews.Content: After a 17 hour flight delay, we wearily arrived at the Park Hotel Clarke Quay, discovering that it's location was perfect for the eclectic mix of nightlife in Clarke Quay and easy walking distance to China town. We were lucky enough to have a corner room which gave us a full panoramic view of the cityscape.... even the shower had a glass wall so you could appreciate the views (with a screen you could pull down if privacy was required) The hotel is perfect for a couple of nights whilst in transit to other destinations and offers a clean, modern friendly atmosphere. One word of warning though, on returning from a night out we asked to purchase two bottles of water from the bar.... The barman looked at us and smilled whilst delivering the price.... the equivalent to £16!! needless to say we politely declined!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great location”
Reviews.Author: Ju189
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel Clarke Quay for 3 nights mid-January. We were given a room on the 7th floor overlooking the pool and Clarke Quay. As I've experienced before, city hotel rooms are generally smaller than others like beach resorts but it was adequate for our needs with a luxury bathroom and amazing shower, well stocked mini bar (if a little pricey!) The cleanliness of the hotel was amazing, everything polished to within an inch of its life! We only ate there once and that was the breakfast buffet which was pretty average! The location was spot on, we only had to cross the road and we were right in the hub of all the bars in Clarke Quay. The only gripe I have is there was no Wi fi available, you had to pay for Internet use. We went onto to spend a week in Borneo and had Wi fi the entire time we were there so it wouldve been nice to have had it in Singapore too. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “new efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ch B
Reviews.Content: This fairly new hotel is set up as a tours and business hotel that runs efficiently. With the tours in house it can be fairly busy but for business guests the executive floor will be opened during breakfast to facilitate for the guests' breakfast. The view on the Marina Sand Bay is astonishing, as well as other parts of the city. As it is a new hotel the rooms are neat and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel surrounded by everything!”
Reviews.Author: Sang M
Reviews.Content: Park hotel seems to be well known in this area, every time we hopped into a taxi we only ever needed to sat "Park Hotel" and thy would be on their way! Located about 5 minutes walk to the heart of Clark Quay where all the bars and restaurants are and about 10 minutes walk to China Town, same direction as Clark Quay, just gotta keep walking down. (When you leave the hotel, make a left on the road, walk about 30 seconds and it will be a dead end, make a left and walk under the under passskipping that bridge, once you get to the next bridge, cross it and continue walking towards China Town or don't cross it and just keep walking straight for Clark Quay. Room overall was very clean, most bathroom amenities provided but no tooth brush, tooth paste or shaving toiletries. Room as small but big enough to accommodate two adults. Hotel staff at the front were very attentive but I cannot say the same for the ladies working at the front desk. Overall, had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and solid 4 star rating”
Reviews.Author: Quido
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located within minutes of Clarke Quay and its nightlife. Rooms are well fitted and in line with European hotels as to size. Very good facilities including the outdoor pool with the adjoining outside bar. There is a small mall across the street which has a grocery store along with a few reasonably priced food outlets. Would stay here without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but room not big enough for families”
Reviews.Author: colchelle
Reviews.Content: Location is great - central to local restaurants and entertainment in the Clarke Quay area. Taxis are cheap and will take you anywhere you need to be. Note however that this hotel only caters for twin or double rooms (no triples). We booked this hotel through the Singapore Airlines stopover deal via our travel agent. We are a family of three. We paid full price for my 5 year old son, but got a roll-a-way bed, which they then tried to re-chrage me again for. Rooms are very small, so it meant there was no room to walk around and put down suitcases with the extra bed in the room. Room is well furnished, shower head one of the best I've ever tried. Food excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: SueH9
Reviews.Content: Position of hotel is the main benefit. Really good pool area and free wifi if you get room near pool area as public areas are free - 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SYLVIA64
Reviews.Content: We had a marvellous time at this Hotel and the Staff were excellent, so polite and extremely helpful in every way. The Breakfast was very acceptable and the rooms were of a very high cleanliness standard, albeit a little small. The actual location of the Hotel was first class and we found it very easy to get to places. We booked a tour of Singapore with the Hotel and it was wonderful reliving our years in Singapore during our time with the RAF there in 1963 - 1965. If we are lucky enough to return to Singapore, we will certainly stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: ania-dzu
Reviews.Content: Clarke Quay is my lovely place in Singapore, so Park Hotel Clarke Quay is the best 4* hotel in this area. So it's good choice for family - because located in a quite place, and also it's easy to get center of night life for young people, just 7-10 minutes, and for romantic couple here is start of enjoyable promenade along the river. With regard to the hotel - beautiful facade, comfortable rooms, perfect service. Also I like it's outdoor pool - with bar and large recreation area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MilakdM
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying here and it is great value. Perfect location, great service and great staff. We were very happy with the hotel and we will definitely return. Breakfast varied slightly every morning and that was good. Very clean room and serviced immaculately. The rooms were not big but had everything and were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lslou
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at this hotel, it's in a great location, the rooms are modern and clean and the swimming pool area is a real bonus. No negatives from our perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: cjeetb
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Dec 29th morning. We were told by our travel agent that our rooms (2) would be available from 2 p.m. but were informed at the reception that we could move in immediately. That was such a relief, didn't have to sit in the lobby after a long flight. Rooms were a bit small but very clean and cozy. Everyone was polite and very helpful. Good breakfast. Great location. The river is just behind the hotel and the walk along the river to Marina Bay is very pleasant. Lots of places for food on both sides of the river. Over all, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cags1960
Reviews.Content: The room was small but adequate, spotlessly clean. Fabulous location for Robertson Quay and Clarke Quay and getting around. Singapore is fabulous albeit very expensive, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Bricodust
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, we stayed for 3 nights starting New Year's day. Room was very clean and tidy, although a little small, with an excellent bathroom. All the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The breakfast on the first day was somewhat of a zoo, unfortunately due to New Year tour groups and a Wedding, the hotel was absolutely packed and we had to queue for 10 minutes for a table. the following two days were no problem. Be aware that the hotel is very popular for weddings at weekends so the bar/dining room can be very full. Try for a room overlooking the river, great views. The walk from Clarke Quay to Marina Bay is fantastic and Clarke Quay has masses of restaurants of all types albeit a little on the pricey side but this is Singapore after all,one of the most expensive cities in the world. Highly recommended you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: breezey103
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Park Hotel in a Club room. Check in was very easy and we were straight into our room with views across Singapore. The room was quite comfortable. The rooms are compact but there is no need for large rooms in Singapore - we hardly spent any time there at all. The club breakfast and cocktail hour was great. It is always nice to be away from the chaos of the rest of the hotel. It is a smaller area on the 10th floor overlooking the River. The choice for breakfast was always good there were plenty of food options in the evening also. We found it nice to sit and have a drink and a bite to eat and head out to dinner a bit later. The walk to Clarke Quay is super easy. Anyone who complains about this is just being ridiculous. It is no more than a ten minute stroll and you are in the heart of Clarke Quay. Cross over the river and the MTR station is right there. We found this very easy to use and the best way to get around Singapore. There are easy connections to the monorail to Sentosa Island. The pool area at the hotel is quite nice. I don't expect a decent outdoor pool area from a city hotel so was pleasantly surprised when we headed down for a swim. I would definitely recommend this hotel and to anyone that prefers easy access to restaurants and nightlife, this area is far better than staying on Orchid Road. We spent a morning on Orchid Road but found we preferred the Clarke Quay area a great deal more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annietutte
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days on our way to Melbourne. Lovely hotel, helpful staff, good breakfast, great location close to Clarke Quay. We'd stay again and can highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it, go for club!”
Reviews.Author: Taitaijane
Reviews.Content: Club room is of same design n size of normal room but u get personalized check in/out and I'm pleasantly surprised with their delicious afternoon tea spread. Do try their breakfast omelette, full and smooth and served! Room service is good, club floor staff are friendly and attentive. Swimming pool and gym is nice to chill, am sure you will enjoy your stay with park hotel Clark quay. This is my second stay and I hope grand park orchard will be as good!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnneVantaa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Park Hotel for 7 nights and had a wonderful time. The hotel was very new and clean and the river view from our room on the 10th floor was very nice. The Crystal Club with free drinks and snacks was just great! The staff were all very friendly and smiling. Also loved the swimming pool which was big enough to swim in. Would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: pinkdaisypink
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here, booking via their website. My hubby arrived first, then an hour later I came.. And woww, when I entered the room (surpriseee) yeaayy we got the corner room. River view & pool view. Everything are ok but the breakfast not to good (boring hotel's standard menu), better you explore breakfast outside. Oww this is important, MRT Station, not too far but far enough. Around 15 minutes walk, little bit tortured when u arrived from Changi by MRT and bring luggage or tired after walking around Spore.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD STAY”
Reviews.Author: varungupta_18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in park hotel clarke for 2 nights in dec.As we arrived early in the morning after the cruise we were prepared that we would not be given room until the normal checkin time of 2pm.But to our surprise we were checked in the minute we got into the hotel with an amazing room overlooking the river. The reception staff was really helpful and would go out of their way to give suggestions on the tourists places.Its very well located near clarke quay but the walk to the mrt station can be little tiring as its little ahead from the hotel.Nonetheless we had a great time in the hotel and the rooms were really good specially the shower in the bathroom were tooooo goood..

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Beer”
Reviews.Author: Ternan443
Reviews.Content: The accomodation, location and facilities were first class but food and drink were very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: J68
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel from arrival to departure. I arrived early in the morning after a long flight expecting to have to wait for my room. How refreshing to find that my room was ready with no extra charge. No sooner had I checked in and arrived in my room and my bags where delivered. Throughout my entire stay at this hotel everything was of a high standard with exceptionally polite and friendly staff. The location and amenities where great too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Allison
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel Clarke Quay for a 2 night stopover stay in Singapore at the end of our Honeymoon and found it to be a very disappointing end to a fantastic holiday. Upon arrival, Reception Staff could not find our booking, even though we had booked our stay months in advance and presented them with a voucher from Singapore Airlines. Unfortunately rather than explaining this to us, they asked us to sit down in the very busy reception area where they ignored us and kept us waiting for half an hour while they tried to work out what to do. Whilst waiting we witnessed our suitcases go up in the lift with the concierge and when we asked in Reception where they were going, we were told they were going up to our room, even though we hadn't been checked in yet. Unsurprisingly, the bags came back down again and we had to advise the concierge that they were ours. When we asked for the Wi-fi code to access the internet on our phones while we waited, we had to hand our phones over the desk for the receptionist to put the code in. Wi-fi is only available in the Reception area and it was necessary to give the Receptionist your phone everytime as it locks you out when you leave the Reception area. We were offered no apology for our wait or the confusion and also received no welcome or guide to the hotel. We did not expect much from our room as we knew we would be spending most of our time out exploring Singapore. However, we could not help but be disappointed by it's lack of comfort. We had not been given the option to upgrade to the Crystal Club rooms during check-in and had to phone down to Reception enquire about upgrading. We were given the cost but no description of the package or incentive to move. In the end, we decided to stay put and make the most of our time. The room was very small but had everything that we needed for our short stay and was clean. There was no balcony but the wall to wall window gave a lovely view of the beautiful pool. The bathroom was adequate with a brilliant shower. After a long day of travel and another day exploring the city of Singapore, the most important thing for us was to have a place to lay our weary heads and a good night's sleep. Unfortunately this was not possible as the bed was very hard and uncomfortable. Due to bad weather and our short stay we did not get the opportunity to try out the pool area which looked beautiful and well maintained. The hotel has a fantastic location, very close to the buzz of Clarke Quay and has brilliant transport links. The hotel shuttle bus is very useful and out of everyone at the hotel, we found the concierge staff and also the shuttle bus drivers to be the most welcoming and helpful. Our stay was part of our stop over package with Singapore Airlines and we had upgraded to a high band level to stay in comfort for the end of our holiday. Unfortunately we do not feel that this is what we got at Park Hotel Clarke Quay and if we return to Singapore, we definitely won't be staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotel in singapore..!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachit_Goel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located just 5 mins away from the Clarke Quay which has hosts of nightclubs and lounge for ones entertainment during night. More over its located quite conveniently from MRT so its easy to get around Singapore. The hotel itself has small but beautifully decorated rooms which were cosy as well as comfortable. The breakfast buffet was nice with various choices and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Three Star not Four Star”
Reviews.Author: ABRDF
Reviews.Content: LOBBY: Very small and cramped with only seating for 6 persons. Luggage stored next to seating and computer terminals, no secure luggage storage! For Business Hotel there is no free WIFI or even WIFI in the rooms. BREAKFAST: If you like to queue then you will love the 20 to 30 minute waits. Food quality poor, cold and very unappetising, they charge extra for additional beverages the only ones available are from ready made tea urns with a product that is strong and bitter. Juices are not fresh and very watery. They charge for ICE! ROOMS: Very very small even for Singapore! No space to put luggage if you have more than one case then don't stop here. Plumbing very noisy with poor flow to the washbasin and shower. Towels and bedding appear to have been well used and would not look out of place in a hostel. Pillows are synthetic and very uncomfortable. Beds are uncomfortable and squashed between the wall and desk with no room either side. If you don't have a pool view room then be prepared to keep the curtains closed due to the proximity of the office blocks. Only one chair in the room so you have to sit on the bed. STAFF: They leave a lot to be desired they are often rude and do not communicate with each other, give false information and do not return calls. Over charging and mischarging are endemic and you need to watch this carefully. Overall the Park Hotel Clarke Quay is a clean 3* property with very small rooms with rude staff. Please avoid and give you Dollars to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and clean.”
Reviews.Author: bt63
Reviews.Content: Great location as its near Clark Quay. Rooms are small but modern with good ameneties. Price is a bit high for its class but other than that a very pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Roger073
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening and were very tired after a long flight, we were made more than welcome asked to take a seat and were given a welcome drink while the receptionist sorted our room. she returned with the room details and explained our bags would be in our room by now, her attention to detail was just what was ordered. The room though a little small if I am honest was great all the comforts of home and more. With fantastic views over Clarke Quay

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location to the night life of Clarke Quay (5 minute walk) and the Singapore river is only 80-100 metres away where you can go on one of those famous Bumboat rides. The fantastic shopping district of Orchard road is only a short taxi ride away ( approx S$6.00). The Christmas lights on Orchard road would rival any city in the world. They where just fantastic. There was four people in our group with one being a smoker.The Park Hotel offered the smoking floor. We took it thinking there would be a disignated area on that floor for the smokers. We were wrong, every room on that floor could be smoked in. The stench from stale smoke hit you as soon as the elevator door opened. Even my borther who was the smoker said it was very over bearing. We should of asked to be moved to non a smoking floor but we couldn't be bothered as we were only there for one night. During our short stay in Singapore we hired a private guide which was well worth the money. She took us to places you would not even know about and she tested our taste buds with some pretty weird stuff. If you want a guide, google Anna ong. Overall the hotel was in a fantastic position for the night life of restaurants and bars.There would have to be at least 15 different eateries within 200 metres.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice so far”
Reviews.Author: JJB
Reviews.Content: I have been to Singapore numerous times for holidays over the years, and have stayed in a wide range of accommodation from YMCA to top-notch hotels on Orchard. Park Hotel Clarke Quay is by far the best I have ever stayed in. We were there for 2 nights from New Year's eve. I made a booking months ahead so the rate is not high at all for a hotel of this standard (<S$200 per night plus tax) at this time of the year. We arrived from Sri Lanka by a very early morning flight. With the previous evening being Dec 30 and NY's eve upcoming, I honestly did not expect an early check-in. To our surprise, the reception staff was very accommodating (perhaps noting that we looked horrible after only 2-3 hours' sleep on the flight) and let us have an early check at 10am! The room is very clean, modern, adequate (though I agree it's a bit small for 2 people) and is quiet albeit we actually stayed on the 2nd floor next to the pool! We did not eat there so I can't comment. I did swim and the experience is delightful. Free shuttle service is available to Clarke Quay MRT and Orchard. Though infrequent (around once in an hour) it's good enough for connection to main business and tourist spots without hussle. Taxi fare (daytime) costs no more than S$5 to China Town, and around S$20 from airport. I will definitely stay here again unless the rate scars me off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Sazzle_funk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Our room was nice, had a modern feel to it and it was immaculately clean. Great location for Clarke Quay where there is good nightlife, great restaurants, bumboat tours etc. There was no noise at night (we were on the 6th floor). There is an outdoor swimming pool, towels are provided. More then enough loungers and places to sit. We didn't eat at the restaurants here but I had a nose at the food and it looked good. The only downside was that there was a door in our room linking it to the room next door and they had a child in there who woke early and was quite loud and hyper (as kids are) but I would have preferred to wake up when I wanted to, and not be woken. No big deal, but was a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Pookiecat
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice in the Crystal Club rooms (once on business and once for leisure) and each time been extremely satisfied with the room and service. This most recent time we brought our parents too who found the advantages of having access to the club room far outweighed the cost. Highly recommended for: those who prefer a quieter breakfast atmosphere (buffet breakfast in the club lounge is included in the room cost), those who want to escape the slightly small bedroom for a morning coffee, those who like to retreat from the heat for afternoon tea, and of course those who would like to take advantage of a complimentary cocktail before dinner. Staff were extremely helpful, even by turning off the (quite tedious) Christmas Carols that were played in the lounge in the afternoon... Thanks to the staff who also made excellent restaurant recommendation for a 'within walking distance' evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “Let's park! At Park Hotel Clarke Quay...”
Reviews.Author: siobslim
Reviews.Content: Singapore for the second time around.. Spent the holidays here with my relatives, rooms were a bit small compared to the first hotel I checked in before and their bathroom door lock isn't working. The location of the hotel isn't that near to the MRT station but thankfully the hotel offers a free shuttle service to which drop-off point you want to go to just have to follow the schedule of their shuttle service. Plus, if you want to go to bars and night outs this hotel is good for you since Clarke Quay area is known for hang outs at night plus you get to see and view the singapore river at night :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Eilidh P
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel was situated just a 5 minute walk from some lovely bars and clubs! Very expensive but worth it! If you like clubbing go to Zouk! Buy a lonely planet guide too. The hotel was great, amazing views, we did not get breakfast, but across the road there is a starbucks and a deli france. Great for a 3 night stay! We would go back in a flash. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - let down by room size though...”
Reviews.Author: rorycat
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said this hotel is modern, very clean, in a good location and the staff that we encountered were all without exception very helpful and efficient. The rooms are well fitted out with quality linen and towels etc but they really are small - especially if you are not a couple and would like a bit more space. I was surprised that our room did not have free wi fi access although it was available in the lobby area you have to give your laptop to the reception staff to type in the code which seemed a bit strange. Didn't eat here as the food and drink is very expensive (as with a lot of Singapore) however Subway in the mall opposite does a basic breakfast deal for 4 Singapore dollars and there is free tea and coffee in the room. All in all given the prices in general for Singapore we felt we got a fair deal at £60 per room per night. The complimentary shuttle bus is very useful for getting around and saves you a bit of money as will eating out in the many local food stalls and cafes just around the corner or in central Singapore. Would recommend at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Top service and location”
Reviews.Author: 735Cremedelacreme
Reviews.Content: Whilst in Singapore we stayed 4 nights at the Park Hotel Clarke Quay. The staff were in EVERY area of service in the hotel absolutely TOP - polite, efficient and fast in answering any query we may have had. The breakfast room was very efficiently run and the choice of food excellent. The rooms were also top. Super clean bathroom and fresh towels daily. The only thing which bothered us was the size of the room. We were on a business and pleasure trip throughout Asia and therefore found it difficult to find space for our two suitcases plus two board cases. Also the wardrobe was much too small. We agree with minimalizing where possible these days but all hotels should offer enough space for travellers baggage und its contents. We had a problem finding a space to put the suitcases and to find our belongings in that too small a wardrobe. Otherwise everything about the Park Hotel suited us very well. The pool was excellent and towels were to be had in plenty.The location was super. Many restaurants almost just in front of the door and lovely walks along the busy and interesting Quay in the evenings.. Yes, we will definitely stay at The Park Hotel on Clarke Quay in future and can definitely recommend it to friends and business associates both here in Malaysia and in our home town of Hamburg, Germany.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Brendan C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights as part of the return leg to London of our Honeymoon. Took other reviewers suggestion and chose the Crystal Club and couldn't have had a more enjoyable stay. We were upgraded to the corner room which benefits from views both out over the pool and Clarke Quay towards Marina Bay. We certainly took advantage of the free afternoon tea each afternoon after trekking around (well not always as the pool was hard to leave in the mornings!). And the complimentary drinks in the evening made it a very pleasant start to a night out. The staff in the Crystal Club could not have been more helpful and were very friendly - particularly Yati and Angeline who were always on hand to help with a huge smile! Location wise it was a couple of minute walk to the heart of Clarke Quay, but far away that noise was never be an issue. Other than that everything in Singapore is never far away and the cabs still seemed cheap - though other links (bus, MRT) were very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Jodian
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 week stay in de luxe on room only basis. Agree rooms on smallish size - could have done with a tad more cupbpoard space but we coped with no problem. Standards of cleanliness first class and daily change of bedding. Pool good and no problem with sunbeds - only thing is the hotel is favoured for weddings and so at weekends may well find the terrace bar is taken over, but you can still use the pool. All staff extremely courteous and helpful. Ate in restaurant one evening food ok but expensive and with so many restaurants and food markets around then you need to get out. Location excellent and easy to get around by taxi bus or MRT. If you come out of hotel lobby turn left and left again you will come to the river. Turn left and under bridge and you get safely (no road to cross!) to Clarke Quay and beyond to Boat Quay if you want, both very lively and noisy, but hotel far enough away to be quiet. If you turn right and follow the river path and under bridge then on right at end of apartment block you will find an excellent place for breakfast -Kith's. Real bacon and leaf tea not tea bags and favoured by the expat wives! If you are into veggie breakfast and juices thern go up Unity Street to junction with Sultan Mohammed and on left a great little cafe, forgotten the name

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: gwusc
Reviews.Content: we were upgraded to Crystal Club on the tenth floor. Everyone is friendly. Convenient location to Chinatown, Orchard road and many other locations. View is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Arthur M
Reviews.Content: To all the staff at The PArk hotel thanks, especially BAla,Alex and Sam who assisted us with our parents and made our stay great. The food at breakfast was supurb. It is agreat place to stay .Thanks Guys and Gals. The driver of the courtesy bus was very helpful to my aging parents

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel close to Clarke quay (riverside area in Singapore)”
Reviews.Author: Namrata_bh
