Reviews.Content: Great Hotel located close to Clarke quay ( river side area in Singapore). The hotel is 10 mins walking distance to the most hot and happening area of Singapore ( clarke quay) where the party never stops. Food is not a problem at Clarke quay with lot of eating options - Spanish, Turkish, lebanese, Italian, Indian and many other cuisines. At Clarke Quay the mall named Liang Court has Mac donalds and an asian food court. Central Mall close to Clarke Quay has subway and burger king .The area behind the hotel is known as Robertson Quay (peaceful place by the riverside ) with some Italian & Japanese restaurants, Irish cafe and Starbucks . Though rooms at Park Hotel@ clarke quay are little small in size but are good and clean. The shower in the bathroom was great for a relaxing bath. The hotel has an excellent swimming pool and great breakfast. The staff is really courteous and helpful. Park Hotel Clarke Quay though close to clarke quay is located at a quieter area offering a peaceful stay. Only negative things faced during the stay were that the mattresses and pillows are little hard and there are not many t.v. channels to watch . The cabs are easily available from any point in Singapore to the hotel and are not very expensive . Overall the stay at Park Hotel Clarke Quay was good .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth I
Reviews.Content: I have used Park Hotel Clarke Q in Singapore many times now both for business and for leisure and it is a very nice hotel with excellent service. I have a Company account now and use to make the reservation on Crystal Club level which is very nice with separate breakfast for club guests, afternoon tea and a small buffe in the evening. The staff on club level are very friendly and service minded, this hotel has become my second home now.

Reviews.Title: “Crystal Club well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Oz_Kiwi7
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from two weeks in a Crystal Club Superior room. As other reviewers have stated, the room is small (24sqm). I would have struggled for two weeks if I had another person in the room. The rooms were well set out and scrupulously clean as room service comes twice a day. The package was excellent value for money in Singapore. Daily I got breakfast, two items of laundry, unlimited internet, afternoon tea and two hours for drinks and canapés in the evening. The area had lots of restaurant choices and was a ten minute walk to Clark Quay MRT. I took a taxi to Science Park every morning and never had to wait as there are taxis at the front of the hotel. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel... not totally five star but it's not totally a five star price either.”
Reviews.Author: Mark G
Reviews.Content: Hard to fault this hotel. Location is good, very close to Clarke Quay, walking distance, not really walking distance to an MTR though. Fairly new, all rooms and lobby and shiny and new. Lobby and lobby cafe/restaurant is small but efficient enough though you can wait a bit to be seen by the front desk but never too long and breakfast is pretty cramped in the mornings if you go at peak time. Pool seems nice, rooms are nice and decor is good but a little on the small and basic side for the level of hotel. Minibar/TV/Beds all good. Price is generally OK, you get what you pay for, not a bargain but not at the top end either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location - Would Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: simoo69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in September over the grand prix weekend. Describe the service you experienced Service was really good. From the staff on reception to the men at the front of hotel who were always willing to offer assistance. On one morning it was chucking it down and a man from the reception ran out to offer an umbrella! Always accommodating. Also, unlike western cities, no tip was expected, however, if given greatly appreciated. Tell us how you liked the room Room was clean, modern and spacious. We stopped in a superior room which was brilliant. We found that the wi-fi was not free though. This may be free in higher grade rooms? Talk about the location & amenities Clare Quay is a lively location with plenty of restaurants and places to drink. Metro is about a ten minute walk. Top tip - ignore the 'monks' and people calling you a 'lucky man'. We just ignored them and kept walking so I imagine they are harmless - probably just after some money! They normally walk up and down the river. The hotel has a brilliant pool which we enjoyed relaxing by in the heat! Didn't reckon much to the food though. We had a breakfast one morning and for the money it cost it was the only disappointment! We were unable to get free wi-fi so we used the computers at reception. The minimum time you can buy is 30 minutes, however, when we asked if we could have a shorter duration we were given a free 15 minute code! Say what you liked best & least Best bits were the pool and location of the hotel. Sitting by the pool with the Singapore skyline as a backdrop was brilliant. What we liked least was the food which we only tried once. Why stay in the hotel to eat when Singapore has so many nice restaurants to try?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and a good place to be”
Reviews.Author: Chrssi87
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our two nights at the hotel. Everything in Singapore can be reached in short walking distances. The front desk staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lamby1975
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my 2 nights at this hotel. Great location and had a wonderful view. I do agree with some other people that the front desk staff could have been nicer. However, the hotel was very clean and the location was great as it is close walking distance to ChinaTown and the MRT. The bellman was very helpful and they let me store my bags until after 1pm. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what everyone sees in the place.”
Reviews.Author: scotland580
Reviews.Content: After travelling around South East Asia for a few weeks, this hotel was going to be the western-style bit of Singapore luxury to finish off our trip. And it turned out to be one of the poorest hotels we stayed in. Check-in was torturous as an unsmiling rude receptionist assigned us a twin room which we hadn't requested. After calling down to let them know, we had to take all our luggage back to reception where we were given another room. This room then turned out to be a smoking room after we had requested a non-smoking room. By this point, I gave up as I didn't want to experience more rudeness from the reception staff. On check-out day, we had a late check-out until 3pm which I had confirmed with the reception staff the day before. This was ignored and we were locked out of our room after the standard check-out time. Was there any apology or even a hint of a smile after going back to reception to tell them, no, don't be daft. Perhaps we had become too pampered by the excellent levels of service experienced in the previous weeks around vietnam, laos, and cambodia. The doormen and the cleaners were very friendly in the hotel but as your main point of customer contact, I was very surprised and disappointed to find the reception staff so surly. Other reviewers have commented on the small size of the rooms. I had given the hotel the benefit of the doubt as I thought perhaps they were being compared to american-size hotel rooms which tend to be very large. However, even compared to British hotel rooms, the size of the room was tiny. There wasn't enough room to properly store two suitcases and hand luggage let alone open them. Facilities-wise, the room was as you should expect for a 4* - safe, fridge, tv. However, the one glaring negative is that there is NO wifi. This is exceptionally poor for a hotel of this grade in this day and age. Decor-wise, the room was spartan with a rather stained, shabby carpet. The bathroom did have a nice shower, however. Location-wise, the hotel is close to Clarke Quay (lots of bars and restaurants) and Chinatown. The open-top buses run close to the hotel which is very handy. Many other reviewers have obviously had great stays at this hotel but I was exceptionally disappointed with the levels of service and decor in this hotel. Singapore is famous for its high-quality hotels but I wouldn't say this is one of them.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: simon w
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Park Hotel for 4 nights breaking up our return from Australia and taking part in Singapore Marathon.The hotel was high quality but more importantly all of the staff were friendly and seemed to be a very happy team which made the stay just that bit better.Excellent restaurants are within a short distance on the rivers edge and evreything was within a walk of 20 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Gill047
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights en route to Australia, really good idea. Excellent location, very easy to walk around the main sights of Singapore. We enjoyed breakfast at Delifrance across the road. We also found a eat as much as you want Japanese buffet on the top floor of the same building, we appeared to be the only non-locals there the food was excellent and they were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “"Unforgettable Experience"”
Reviews.Author: jgautam
Reviews.Content: " Beautiful , Happening & Interesting" Three words can easily describe the hotel amenities,its Location and its hospitality.Amazing Experience.The most happening place at night.we stayed there for 4 days.we enjoyed our cherishable moments there.The locations nearby hotel are worth seeing specially the clarke quay street at night and specially u can find Any type of cuisines in that street.In Hotel,There is Brizo Restaurant at Ground Floor, where u can find the best Food specially "The Buffet Breakfast". Now,move onto Rooms: Very clean and quiet but you have to do compromise in size because size of room is small.but if u are liking all other things over there i donot think u will hesitate in doing such a small compromise.Overall, GR8 time. "Full of life Location"

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Saltiretraveller
Reviews.Content: wonderful customer service and fantastic views, great breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 910ChrisM
Reviews.Content: Stayed november 2011.Shuttle bus is good also close to undrerground and hop on hop off bus.Room was good overlooking the pool on the 8th floor.Restaurant was good and the staff excellent in all departments.Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location.Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aetos1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice, June and October 2011, the first time in a Club Room and the second time in a Superior Room. The Superior Room was too small with poor view. The location of the hotel is excellent, many restaurants and bars near the Hotel The breakfast is good, but you have to wait , the restaurant space is too small to serve the guests.Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bambi4950
Reviews.Content: Stayed in November for 4 nights. Very pleased with hotel, it was clean and the staff were friendly. Rooms a bit on the small side, but adequate. The only thing I didn't like is that the bathroom had a completely clear glass side, which from the bedroom you could see straight through, cannot think of any reason for this. I am no prude and have been married for nearly 30 years, but still like privacy in the bathroom!! Otherwise excellent hotel. Shuttle bus to sister hotels and Orchard Road. Excellent location. Numerous restaurants across the road and along the river. There is an outdoor pool on the 2nd floor, again very clean and plenty of sunbeds. No ATM at hotel, but that is available in a small mall across the road. Buffet breakfast plentiful and good choice for all tastes.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience but with a few inconveniences....”
Reviews.Author: manirath001
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Park Hotel in Oct'2011 for two nights. The hotel is exactly what you would expect a decent city five star hotel to be....clean rooms, efficient staff and standardization in everything. We chose this hotel especially because we wanted to stay in the Clarke Quay area around the nightlife. While most of our demands were met, we had a few quibbles.... 1) The room size was disappointingly small. 2) The hotel, though across the street is a long walk from the nightlife at Clarke Quay, you have to take a winding road under the bridge to cross the road, which is a good 15 mins walk. 3) The closest MRT station from the hotel is a good 20 mins walk. Considering that is best way to travel in singapore, it was a bit of disappointment to walk that much just to reach the station. But these issues are specific to people who are looking to travel singapore by the public transport system. The hotel pool was really good and big. Definitely worth taking a dip or two. All in all, its a decent hotel with the basics right....it just didn't meet the requirements we had... Would recommend it with reservations and disclaimers!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room With A View Of The River!”
Reviews.Author: WestYorkshireFlossy
Reviews.Content: I Stayed at the Hotel in June. After a twelve hour flight from the UK it was great to be checked in quickly and efficiently, and I was upgraded which basically meant I had A bathrobe and slippers1 Although I was the only occupier of the room I was offered a double bed which was lovely and comfortable. The room was spacious and had a lovely big window where I could see the river if I looked to my left. The bathroom was big with a very powerfull shower, bliss! There were complementary toiletries and at night the curtains were closed and the bed turned down. The Hotel staff were friendly and very helpfull. The location is ideal for bar hopping and restaurants and the wonderfull sights of beautiful Singapore. I would stay there again. ,

Reviews.Title: “My five days of heaven”
Reviews.Author: Eileen P
Reviews.Content: I had no idea of how great my stay at this hotel was going to be. Everything about it was wonderful. The location is super. There is a shuttle from the airport to the hotel which will also take you to Orchard Rd. The staff are a delight. I have never been so spoilt before, and I've been travelling for 50 years. If anyone is planning on going, or passing through Singapore, do yourself a big favour and stay at this hotel. Eileen Parsons Adelaid South Australia

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the Traders hotel”
Reviews.Author: brozlington
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for two nights en route to Australia.Thought the hotel was ok but didn't like the pillows at all.Might sound like a minor gripe but they were hard as concret eand gave me a headache so the second night I asked for a different pillow and was given a cheap foam filled one which was a big improvement. The lobby area is extremely smallwhich is poor for a 4 star hotel . Breakfast below average compared to other hotels in the far east. Stayed at the Traders hotel on the way back for two nights in a completely different location to the Park hotel.This was also 4 star and a similar price however it was in a different league.Excellent choice at breakfast,soft good quality pillows and bedding, nicer toiletries,beautiful lobby and much more. I would choose The Traders over Park hotel on my next visit. I had standard rooms in both hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Stop Over to break up a long flight.”
Reviews.Author: fredhardman
Reviews.Content: I chose the Park as a convenient place to rest up in the middle of a flight from Manchester to Brisbane. The hotel was in my opinion a typical four star hotel and the service and hospitality what I would expect from such. I found the location excellent, the staff friendly and helpful and the room modern and well furnished, with a good range of cable TV stations. Despite the advertised check in being at 2.p.m. the hotel found me a room at 9.a.m.which was very welcome after a long night flight. The hotel has an excellent pool with a poolside bar,cafe which has a good range of snacks. Wi fi is free but only available in the lobby or ground floor restaurant. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice staff...”
Reviews.Author: Thaimae
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The room was really, really small - we had a double twin club room on the 9th floor and for 2 people - there was not a lot of room. I think the pictures of the rooms on the website were deceiving - but other than that, we really enjoyed the hotel. We took the advice of another tripadvisor and booked the club room that comes with access to the lounge. It was worth it and we frequented it often. The staff - with the exception of the bell staff - were overly helpful and couldn't do enough for you. Also, the pool was wonderful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “rate increase”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days, even though we booked a non smoking room the first room they gave us definitely had had a smoker staying in it. Because of my husband's bronchitis we requested another room only to be told there were non available unless we paid more for the room. I asked how much for the stay and was told $220. Imagined our dismay when we came to pay our bill to find it was $220 extra per night and they charged us for 4 nights not 3 as on the original booking. So beware, if you change rooms you lose the 4 for 3 saving and the price quoted is per night not for total stay. I might add the first room had no storage for clothing, it only had two small drawers in the wardrobe and 40cms of hanging space, very little for 2 people, and no storage or room in the tiny bathroom for personal items. We have contacted the hotel but have had no satisfaction so we would not recommend it to anyone unless they have a healthy credit card. We were forced to pay an extra $1035 on top of the original booking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jodie_amanda
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 4 nights in early November 2011. The room was a little small (but this is to be expected in Singapore). We were also disappointed that they did not provide free wi-fi in our room, which I think should be standard in all rooms everywhere. Apart from that we found the hotel to be excellent in every way. The staff were wonderful in booking any trips we wished to take. The room was clean and maintained to a very high standard. The pool was amazing. And in an over-priced city like Singapore the rooms were reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sailaway33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and were very happy with our accommodation. Though the room wasn't very large it was comfortable and the fantastic view more than compensated. The pool was a huge plus - lovely to swim in it at night with the lights and lights of the Singapore skyline beyond. I twice took the free shuttle which runs between the other Park Hotels in the city. The driver was extremely helpful, once when I was the only passenger he went out of his way to drop me off and collect me directly from the Singapore Flyer. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: aussietripper56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an good location close to the Clarke Quay eateries. Check in was smooth and efficient. Good variety of choices at the buffet breakfast. I would recommend this hotel as we had no issues with the room or service.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Seatouner
Reviews.Content: Had no issues with this hotel. Location isn't central but in Singapore you're not that far from everywhere and taxis are cheap. Good service, clean rooms and rate was quite comparable with similar accommodation. Overall, recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location, nice pool, rooms a bit on the smallish size but nicley fitted and OK for up to 5 days”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay G
Reviews.Content: We booked and stayed nt eh crystal club room (levels 9 & 10), was a little surpised at the smallish size of the rooms (even having arived from Hong Kong where they are generaly tiny), butt with that out of the way, I had no other complaints. Club room was very nicley finished, club room faciliteis were nice, service was good and location is hard to beat. Have stayed at the Carlton Hotel in Singapore in the past and whilst this hotel was not as good, it was also cheaper. Get what you pay for gegnerally, would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay + close to night life at Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: BipashaSarkar
Reviews.Content: The rooms & service are both quite pleasant. We had a great view since our room overlooked the lovely pool area. The reception desk will help out with all kinds of info that one might need. Best plus is the proximity to the eateries & bars along the Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “very average city hotel”
Reviews.Author: baresis
Reviews.Content: we have stayed two nights during a stopover in this hotel in Singapur. The hotel is near Clarke Quay with lots of entertainment and restaurants and you can walk easily along the river to the new Marina or to Orchard Road. The rooms are modern, very small (difficult to find space for 2 suitcases) and our room didn´t have a nice view. It is better to have rooms in the upper floors. Poolarea is spacious and nice. Breakfast was very dissapointing. We decided to take our breakfast elsewhere even though we had paid for it. The choice of food was poor as was the quality. Also the breakfast area is quite small for such a big hotel and sometimes you have to wait a while to be seated. The restaurant is basically in the lobby. It is ok for a short stay but I think you will find better hotels in Singapur for that price. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: LebanonUSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Park Hotel Clarke Quay back in January 2011 and the place just set the benchmark I compare other hotels against. The service was impeccable, the location was superb (walking distance from the Clarke Quay nightlife). Like everything in Singapore, the hotel and rooms were super clean. They do lose a couple of points here and there. Compared to hotel rooms I've stayed at in the US, the rooms were small, and you have to pay for wifi. But all in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scotty070
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Hotel in two of their Crystal Rooms. We loved the location but especially the hotel and it's staff. We have been to Singapore twice before but this was the best hotel yet. All the staff were really friendly and pleasant but we must say a big thank you to the girls in the Crystal Lounge who made our stay so memorable. They were really helpful and thoughtful, nothing was too much trouble. The bedrooms were spotless and a decent size. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and if we in Singapore again we will be certainly be staying at the Park.

Reviews.Title: “Location. Location. Location! :)”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter-Saabrin
Reviews.Content: Here's the thing- There's so much to do in Singapore specially when on a 4 day trip you'll hardly be at ur hotel. So while the hotel is not a luxury hotel & has no frills attached - it was good enough for the stay. Avoid the continental breakfast- it's set inside and expensive. Try hopping across the street for a late breakfast by the lake. It's value for money and you get a view! :) Ask for the higher floors- you get a beautiful view of the city. Service levels were good- getting a cab in peak time is difficult but the hotel staff go out of their way to hail you a cab. Loved the room- minimalistic. Interesting bit- Your bath is just divided by a transparent glass & blinds -so if you want to see the view while having a bath- just pull up the blinds and voila! :) Excellent location- few blocks away from the actual Clark Quay party scene. About 45-50 mins from the airport. Nearby street restaurants and a lovely Balinese massage spa a block away adds to the convenience of location. Over all- Loved my stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Would defintely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Lillias
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our two teenagers, stayed in two of the Crystal Club rooms on a stopover, en route to Europe. People have commented the rooms are small but I found them big enough for us and our large suitcases for a couple of nights. (our hotel rooms in Barcelona were much smaller than the Park Hotel ones) The rooms are clean, nicely decorated and have plenty of nice toiletries/slippers/bathrobes. We could use our ipads in the rooms with the included wifi. We took advantage of the hotel free shuttle to Orchard Rd and took a taxi back later in the evening as taxis are relatively cheap. And as we enjoy walking, we walked to Raffles and Chinatown later in the evening when it was cooler and there are plenty of nice restaurants and bars within easy walking distance by anyone's standards. The Crystal Club lounge is worth the extra I believe as there's breakfast, all day soft drinks/ tea/coffee, afternoon tea and pre dinner drinks and snacks for a couple of hours in the evening included. My husband decided that Evelyn was his perfect woman as she topped up his drinks without him having to ask. The staff really do look after you. And although I didn't think I'd use it, the free 2 items of laundry per day came in really handy as it saved riflling through cases on a stopover, with housekeeping even making sure we had our clothes back quickly before we checked out on our last day. I really enjoyed our stay and hope to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Little bit of luxury in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: PorkpieUk
Reviews.Content: After a long flight, it was bliss to check into the Park Hotel. The moment we arrived staff were most helpful, our bags were whisked up to the room, the check in was staffed by 3 people so even though it was quite busy we were seen to quickly. Someone gets the lift for you.... just felt great to be there. The rooms are not the biggest (we were in a superior room, 334) but they have storage and all you need for a short stay, plenty of toiletries and nice quality. We used room service twice, both times food was excellent (club sandwich was so nice my husband had it twice!) and arrived in under 25 minutes. We also used the pool and pool area one morning, despite being by a road its not too noisy. One thing I loved was the the fact that we only had to nip through the underpass (left out of hotel, then left again....can't miss it) and we were straight into Clarke Quay, all the bars and restaurants you need then you can walk on though and be at the Sky park within a hour. We popped up to Raffles for a Singapore Sling, using a taxi as it was very hot and humid. We also used taxi's for the airport and they were pretty cheap. We had a night flight out of Singapore, so needed to store our luggage which they were happy to do for the day. You get a ticket to hand in so no-one can run off with your bags and they do secure them.

Reviews.Title: “Absloutely BRILLIANT!!”
Reviews.Author: Keisha H
Reviews.Content: The staff here are exceptionally friendly and helpful and go more than out of their way to make your stay at the hotel an experience to remember !! The breakfast was beautiful and the location was DEFINITELY central. You're within walking distance of everything and even if you were to take a taxi, it costs near on nothing. The rooms are a little bit small, but hopefully you're not going to Singapore to spend all your time in the room!! I would DEFINITELY stay there again and reccommend it to anyone :o) !!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johntone
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed here for 5 nights with Buffet Breakfast. A good choice as the room had a lovely view of Clarke Quay, and in the night ,was real lovely to stay up late and admire. The pool was very nice and quiet, as was the hotel itself and the staff were very pleasant and also helpful.Only drawback was the walk to the MRT, approx.15Mins and got wet in the rain a couple of times,but no big deal!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: MMackPerth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay this year at the Park Hotel in Clark Quay. Both times we have stayed in the Crystal Club rooms. This includes breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails in the club room restaurant. Evelyn and her staff look after you so well and nothing seems too much trouble. With lovely clean, modern rooms and facilities and an excellent location we really wouldn't stay anywhere else in Singapore and would highly recommend it to anyone planning a visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “best 5star stayed in”
Reviews.Author: aussiman
Reviews.Content: stopover on way to brisbane,realy good reception arrived early but had room available stayed on 9th floor which is crystal club floor (business class) no kids, breakfast,on 10th floor, not in restaraunt ground floor,with rest of guests. also included drinks and nibbles 5.00 to 7.30 as much as you want,on 10th floor,so all in all very good stay, and the outside pool area is what decided us to stay.book crystal club deluxe you will be well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 689AbdulWahab
Reviews.Content: Been to Singapore many times and stayed at various hotels ,but if you want home with very pleasant staff,excellent food ! I recommend you stay at the Park Hotel Clarke Quay Absolutely faultless !

Reviews.Title: “Suffers from Singapore Hotel Syndrome”
Reviews.Author: Back_to_Sandringham
Reviews.Content: The problem with almost all hotels in Singapore is that a significant proportion of their clientele is composed of tourists on short holidays or airline lay-overs. This means that there are high volumes of guests coming and going, and there is no real incentive for the hotels to offer a high level of service. Most of the guests are just on their way through and are unlikely to come back anyway. The Park Hotel tries its best to resist this, but ultimately fails. The experience is just OK. One positive is that there are plenty of restaurants and bars nearby, which is a good thing since the selection in the hotel itself is quite poor. Breakfast was uninspiring. The gym was quite good though.

Reviews.Title: “Great for us oldies”
Reviews.Author: gingermegs52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed their for four nights September 2011. we are 67 &70. Arriving in mid morning after a long flight we were able to go straight up to our room where we crashed...Room was on the small side but very clean. staff were just brilliant and so polite. We never had to push a lift button or open a door....We at at the dinning room and food was great and staff very helpful...breakfast was a smogersboard of wonderful tempting food.

Reviews.Title: “3 excellent nights on Singapore”
Reviews.Author: nick l
Reviews.Content: We found the Park Hotel very comfortable, with extremely helpful staff. The room was well equipped & the swimming pool a dream. We were particularly impressed with the facility of a hotel bedroom in the early evening, which enabled us to freshen up after we'd checked out & before we left for the airport, all for free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: alexsfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed a weekend at this hotel to prepare for a wedding. The staff were friendly, helpful and to say the least, they accommodated us nicely. Our room area is a tad tight, but it is clean and comfortable. The location allows us to party and walk back safely to the hotel and in the room. In the morning, our bride was able to take beautiful shots of the river just a walk away. Value for money. Will return for another girls' chill-out weekend stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Karl L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, very clean and with great staff. The location is great, just next to Clarke Quay and all the restaurants there. They also provide a shuttle bus to other parts of the city, but I never used it as it was just 10 minutes walk to the closest MRT station. The pool and outdoor area was good, and the breakfast was very nice, not simple as somebody else pointed out. The bed could have been a bit more comfy though.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money !”
Reviews.Author: Eva Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times on business trips in 2009. Nice room and great location ! 5 minutes walking to Clarke Quay and Singapore river. Plenty of bars, restaurants and shops around. The concierge are supre friendly and helpful. Nice outdoor pool. Great value for money !

Reviews.Title: “Bugs and poor service”
Reviews.Author: rocketscientist1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights to attend a conference in Singapore. This was my fourth trip here so I have a solid comparison for location, service and value of this hotel and others in a similar price point that advertise as catering to a business clientele. I had requested a room on a high floor, preferably club level but when I checked in was told there was no availability- and I booked 5 months in advance. The bed was like sleeping on the floor, old foam hard pillows. There were bugs in the bathroom and tables by the bed. There is only wireless Internet in the lobby with few chairs to sit- which were always full. The food in the hotel was almost inedible- even the dishes recommended as the favorites of the chef. This hotel appears to be booked primarilynby tour groups catering to retired Australian and b.ritish tourists and is not a business hotel.Compared to hotels within the $250-300 range, this is a very poor value. I will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel during our 4 day Singapore stopover. Only a few minutes walk from the riverside walk, Clarke Quay and hop on-hop off bus services, we were very happy with the location. The room was spacious, cool and comfortable; the staff were very helpful and friendly. Restaurant and room service food was expensive but so is Singapore, so just enjoy! If you don't want to spend to many $$$$ on breakfast, just across the road is a Delifrance which offers a less expensive breakfast menu. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeborahMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We have just had four nights in a Club Floor Room. From the minute we arrived till we left the hotel staff could not do enough to make our stay very enjoyable. The staff in the Club Lounge would have to of been some of the best that we have experienced and we have stayed in many hotels around the world.The Club lounge was very busy every night and they did an excellent job. Nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was also very enjoyable. The room we stayed in was a Superior Club Floor room but its size was very small but very nicely furnished with a very small but nice bathroom. Saying this we would return to this hotel due to the excellent service of the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SHIRLEY F
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 5 minutes from Clarke Quay for good restaurants and bars. Lovely hotel, very clean, staff excellent. We were on the 10th floor which had its own lounge area that overlooked Clarke Quay. We had breakfast in this area plus complimentary drinks between 5.30pm and 7.30pm evening. Well worth paying extra for 9th/10th floor. No hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel For Every Thing.”
Reviews.Author: hillr15
Reviews.Content: Very Very Good Hotel 5/6 min walk to all you wan't in eating at Clarke Quay, Hotel Staff nothing to mutch trouble, very clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SalkenWorld
Reviews.Content: We had booked Park Hotel on the first stop on our Round the World trip and it proved to be a good choice. Very good location between Robertson Quay and Clark Quay. About a 15 minute walk to the nearest MRT in Clark Quay. The hotel had upgraded us to a room with a River View with a complimentary fruit basket. The hotel was very clean with a very helpful reception and a lovely pool area. Breakfast in the restaurant was a little confusing but as we were up and out early each morning we mainly ate on the 'hoof'. I would definitely recommend this hotel for it's position on the river and the fact you weren't far away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: george s
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for the Singapore Grand Prix. Hotel is just along from the River (Quay) lots of restaurants/bars within a 5 to 15 mins walk. Hotel pool is very nice for a central location hotel, but not many sunbeds. Hotel bar is basic, inside the restaurant. Food is very nice and service is very good. Rooms are a touch on the small side but more than adequate for a week in Singapore. Staff very helpfull. Drinks are dear but they are evrywhere in Singapore central. Only 2 PC's in the reception and Wi-FI but no WI-FI provided in the room or anywhere else in the hotel (which is basic stuff these days).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Trudy0279
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way to start our honeymoon in Europe and on our way home. We booked the club room and had a great room, wonderful service and a lovely afternoon tea. When we arrived too early for check in they let us check in early at no extra cost and when my husband told the staff I was sick, they kept on checking on my welfare. Wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience - Bad room service”
Reviews.Author: Shailaja B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in the first week of September for 4 days. We requested for a room with the Quay view and they considered our request and moved us at the next available room. The staff are also very helpful. But one incident marred the stay there, I had ordered for the only vegetarian dish on their menu from the room service around 11 pm (as the restaurant closes by then). Even after 2 hours and 4 phone calls I did not get my dinner. Only after my husband called and asked for the manager did they mumble an apology and get us the dish in 15 mins! Bad experience when you are very hungry and also waiting to hit the bed. But other than this incident, the hotel is good and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Roxby
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel. It is F1 Weekend and prices have gone thru the roof compared to what they should be, but that is expected everyone has to make money when they can. I booked a Crystal Club Room. I am a little surprised how small it is. If i was with my wife with 2 suitcases and the clothes she takes we would have nowhere to put them. Having said that all the staff are extremely helpfull nothing is too much trouble, which makes up for the small room. I felt the pillows were to hard and they changed them for Duck down. The breakfast on the Club Floor is good as is the afternoon tea and evening drinks. The Hotel is great for Clarke Quay and the river and is quite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Dave F
Reviews.Content: Me and my Fiancee stayed here in July as part of our Honeymoon, we stayed here for 6 nights in total, 3nights before a trip to indonesia and 3 nights after. We booked a room on the Crystal club floor for both visits which was fantastic, the girls in the Club lounge are absoluetly brilliant and are a true credit to the hotel, they couldn't do more for you and really looked after us and gave us all the information we needed. We didn't really take advantage of the benefits of the club lounge but the Breakfast was brillant and had something to cater for everyones needs. The rooms are small and cosy but they have everything you need in them and they are extremely clean. Both times we had fantastic views out over the pool and Clarke Quay. The first room we stayed in was a corner room and seemed slighlty bigger than the second room we was in on our second visit which was next door. The hotel is in a fantastic location and is only a 5 to 10 minute walk away from all the action of Clarke Quay and Robinson Quay. All in all we had a brilliant stay here and if and when we visit Singapore again we wouldn't stay at the Park hotel Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “stephen&robyn”
Reviews.Author: srlisc
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Fantastic Service Stayed here for 3 nights this month and found the location great with 5 minuites walk to most requirements Shops, Transport etc. Had a good room on the corner with big windows and fantastic view. Rooms were well serviced and very clean with good facilities. Members of the "Crystal Club" for our stay and was looked after exceptionally well by Yatie and the other ladies.All of the staff did a great job looking after us and were very friendly and helpfull. Would stay there again without any hesitation. Thank you to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: mptopham
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. It is big but the friendliness of the staff make it feel much more intimate. Location is great, 5 minutes walk to shopping, eating and drinking on clarke quay one of the best areas in Singapore. We had a really good corner room with big windows. The room had everything you would expect. The swimming pool is excellent. We will definitely stay here again when we are back in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: astridtz
Reviews.Content: The location is very nice, near the bus stop, by the river, and surrounded by restaurants and cafes. MRT station is quiet far, but it's okay because they have free shuttle every 1 hour to other Park groups in other areas, and very friendly staffs and driver. The room itself is very comfort and nice bathroom. And they clean it twice a day! That's important for me. The only thing i less impressed was one of the receptionist who less friendly than other staffs. But overall, this hotel is very recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Quality stay”
Reviews.Author: stephen p
Reviews.Content: Have been to Singapore many times and stayed in this hotel for the first time in August. While it is close the the night life in Clarke Quay its also far enough away not to hear the considerable noise that is generated by the bars on the `Quay`. Rooms were modern but on the smallish side, but then again how much time do you spend in the things! The pool area is also very nice. Overall a very good hotel, and (in Singapore terms) excellent value for money, I will most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Standard Hotel, Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Travelagent2009MLG
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is a good 4* Hotel with a great Location on Clarke Quay, the hotel is around a 5 Minute walk to Clarke Quay Restaurants and Bars, the walk to Clarke quay is very safe and pedestrianised. The hotel rooms are very well cleaned and enough for a short stay in Singapore, Rooms included Tea & Coffee and also a wide variety of TV Channels. The swimming pool at the hotel is defiantly worth trying after a long day of sightseeing around Singapore. One of the great things about the Park Hotel Chain is that they offer a FREE courtesy Shuttle around the city picking up at the hotels and dropping in central areas, this service runs until the evening. This hotel is a great base for seeing Singapore and having restaurants and bars at your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: monkeyhanger19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way to Malaysia and would deffinately go back. There is free wifi in the lobby of the hotel but you need a password from the desk. The staff are really helpful and have a good knowledge of Singapore. I read that the bedrooms were really small but we found them great, just big enough for what you need and very clean. Lots to do around the area and just a 5-10 minute walk to Clarke Quay where there are loads of bars and restaurants for any type of visitor. Alcohol tends to be very expensive so try one with a happy hour or there is an Australian bar in Clarke Quay that is pretty reasonable. There is a small shopping centre opposite Clarke Quay which is open quite late and they have a Charles and Keith shoe shop, so I was happy! The Park Hotel also has smoking rooms which is good if you smoke and does a decent breakfast, we loved the swimming pool as the city is so hot, humid and busy it was lovely to relax around the pool and have a cooling swim.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Jayne6412
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay, staff were friendly and always greeted you with smile. Service in the Crystal Club Lounge was out of this world. Will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Crystal Club service”
Reviews.Author: jampot46
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 6 nights at this hotel and had a great time. We stayed in a Crystal Club room on the 9th floor. We had access to the Club lounge where the service was excellent. The room was more expensive than lower floors but the 'perks' certainly compensated - quiet place to have breakfast, complimentary afternoon tea and drinks and nibbles in the evening. All the staff in the hotel were friendly yet professional and always very helpful. It was pleasant to look out over the river & Clarks Quay bars and eating places were close by - we walked to China Town & Orchard Road and we are young in spirit but older in body!. Our room was beautiful and very light due to floor to ceiling windows, the room was serviced twice a day and nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. The shuttle bus is a bonus on hot steamy days although it only runs between the other Park Hotels it does take you close to Orchard Road, Raffles area and the metro closest to Clarks Quay. Would we stay there again - most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nolan_73
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located within walking distance of Singapore nightlife. Great location. Staff very friendly. Pleasantly surprised to be upgraded on arrival - which included free use of the Crystal Club each day (a real bonus).Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and walking distance from Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: cdes2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel while on vacation to Singapore. I have mixed reviews on the hotel. Location is excellent and walking distance from Clark Quay and Riverside. Rooms were beautiful with floor to ceiling glass windows and breathtaking room of the riverside. Although the staff is helpful we had to wait very long to check in as the tiny lobby is always crowded with tourist group travelers and there is hardly any seating space in the lobby. The room we got was non smoking but it reeked of cigarette smell and we had to get it changed. The breakfast buffet was one of the best that I have had with a great selection of cold and hot items. We enjoyed sitting in the open outside seating of the coffee shop for our breakfast. Overall it was a nice stay with some minor issues which probably would not be faced by others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, but lacks a decent restaurant/bar/lounge area”
Reviews.Author: JAH1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hotel on business for a week, and in general is was a pleasant stay. The hotel is just a short walk from Clarke Quay on the river, which is a decent spot to be in in Singapore. The pool is lovely and the staff were helpful. The only real negative (in my opinion) was the lack of a lounge or decent-sized bar area to relax or work in. For a hotel of this size (and price range) I just would have expected a bit more space. Breakfast was also always very busy, as the seating area of the restaurant is quite cramped. I would still consider staying again, but only on a special rate, as in my experience there are better value hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover.”
Reviews.Author: steve_sue75
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us as part of a package en route to NZ. We were able to check in early - 11am- and get some much needed sleep after the 13 hour plane journey. The swimming pool was very welcome after hot and humid trips out. Breakfast buffet was amazing they even had porridge - a personal favourite. Minor blip was returning to an unserviced room at 3pm but soon sorted by reception and housekeeping. The staff were lovely couldn't do enough for you and it was good to see the hotel offering work experience to youngsters with special needs. Location was good a short walk from Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay but far enough away to not give noise - over the road from a mall with a supermarket and good coffee shop. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Turn out the lights please! and learn to make a decent coffee.”
Reviews.Author: KennyMacMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Great city view from our 5th floor window, especialy at night - however.... you can't keep the curtains open if you want to sleep. I like natural light, so like to sleep with curtains open - At night it's dark and when I wake it's light. Not too much to expect. Look at the picture of the hotel; see all these bright lights at each window? Well there's one above each window and they are on all night (or at least till very late). The lights were that bright that we had to close the blackout curtains to get to sleep. The test in my patience was the plaque at reception saying the hotel has won awards for its design. This hotel obviously cares more about how it looks than customer comfort. The rest of the experience was OK - it's a city hotel. Small clean rooms with decent service are to be expected, and that's what we got. Good location. Free wifi is restricted to the small reception area, which means people are always hanging around to pick up emails. Coffee in the restaurant downstairs is best to be avoided. Might stay again, might not, I'm sure there are better around.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the "club" package, well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: LadyLenton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 3 night stopover on the way home. It took us ages to decide on which hotel to book and in the end we weren't disappointed! We upgraded to the club package which meant we got brekkie, afternoon tea, and evening drinks and canapés. The drinks n nibbles in the evenings alone made the upgrade worth it. Great service too! Rooms nice, very clean, the only bad thing was the bed - it was very uncomfortable!! Overall a great stay and a good location to explore from!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bumhl
Reviews.Content: I Was found great staff in the world it was in park hotel clarke quay. I was asking him a simple things, but the guy was giveng the answer is was perfect i think the name is Anand from bell Desk he give us good answer. I ask 4 people but they cant tell the correct answer but they guy was correct i and My wife was very happy with this men in white. I will stay with this hotel again because of this men in white

Reviews.Title: “Go Crystal Class - you won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: RichardCP
Reviews.Content: Clarke Quay in Singapore is a very trendy area with a huge number of food outlets and bars with many different cuisines rubbing shoulders. We chose the Park Hotel because of its proximity to these eating and drinking places in the knowledge that the hotel had a well-reviewed restaurant and they also operate a complimentary shuttle to other places of interest and utility like Orchard Road and local metro stations, etc., so it is always easy to get where you want without resorting to taxis. We opted to upgrade to a “Crystal Club Class” room on the 10th floor which has its own private check-in and lounge where a complementary breakfast can be taken in the morning followed by afternoon tea and, later, snacks and drinks, all included in the upgrade price which makes it a very good deal indeed. A modest amount of laundry is also part of the package and is a great help to any traveler. This Club floor has lovely high-ceilinged rooms and our room had a very comfortable queen-size bed. A little more space for luggage would have been appreciated but for a city-centre hotel it was well thought out and our 3-night stay was very enjoyable. It is little touches like being able to switch the bathroom light on and off from either side of the bed without waking one’s spouse that show how much thought has gone into the room design. We only took dinner in the hotel on one evening because there was so much else to see and do but we chose two typical dishes to share (a Hainanese Chicken & Rice and a Laksa) which were beautifully flavoured and impeccably served. This was preceded by the hotel’s own version of the Raffles-inspired “Singapore Sling” and I am happy to say it compared very favorably with the ‘real thing’ which we also tasted in Raffles the following day. Food and drink is not cheap in Singapore but the portions were ample and the cost reasonable in context. The public areas in the hotel are very light and spacious, with an efficiently manned reception desk and concierge service. The bell captain and front door staff were super-smart in both appearance and service – every need was anticipated with great aplomb. There is also a good sized open-air swimming pool on the second floor with spa facilities and pool-side bar that seemed very popular. No review of the Park Hotel Crystal Club floor would be complete without praising Evelyn, who makes every guest feel special and who makes it her mission to keep everybody happy. She is the perfect hostess and a highly proficient concierge, with masses of ideas for things to do and see in Singapore and environs – quite simply, Evelyn is the icing on the cake, and a very good cake it is too. I would not hesitate to stay again at the Park Hotel in Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jackmorrisNewZealand
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a good location and is good value for money .Rooms are small but well equipped . Very clean . The pool is great with a wonderful view over that part of the city . Staff are really helpful and caring . Breakfast is first class . Would definietly stay in this hotel again . Jack Morris

Reviews.Title: “Superb Position”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights as stopover en route to Australia. Hotel is spotlessly clean and very comfortable. Small room but adequate. Bathroom drainage system a bit noisy - can hear when other people in their shower, irritating when early in the morning or very late at night. Had lovely view overlooking the water and the Hotel is within easy walking distance of Clarke Quay and the metro system which makes getting around Singapore very quick and easy. Hotel has free wi-fi in the lobby and they will print things for you if required. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful - nothing too much trouble if you need advice. Would definitely stay here again if visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: GazPerth
Reviews.Content: I found the Park Hotel to be a mixture of good and bad points that makes it difficult to rate. The hotel is located in an interesting part of Singapore. Its part of an apartment "jungle" but also backs onto the Singapore river and many streets that resemble old Singapore but have been thoughtfully refurbished. Its also relatively quiet without a lot of traffic (on weekdays). Its over the road from Roberston Walk which has more bars, restaurants and cafe's than you can count. They are all very stylish but also very relaxed and include a range of local, Asian and Western food. Also over the road is a modern but small Mall that has a couple of sandwich places, Starbucks and a well stocked supermarket and pharmacy. But there isnt any shopping to speak of, outside of the Liang Court which is a casual 10 minute stroll away. This is a nice shopping centre which has a number of local cafes and stalls, but there isnt a lot inside. The hotel is a about a 15/20 minute hot and sticky walk from the MRT, so taxi's are required to get around. But for those who know Singapore also know that taxi's are cheap, clean and plentiful (when its not raining that is). I stayed in deluxe room which had a modern decore, still looked new and was very well presented. But the room was small even for just one person. It also had many frustrations like no draws for clothes, very limited hanging space, no iron/ironing board, very small work space and not even a small table for room service food. Like most Singapore hotels there was also no top sheet. Just a dooner which in this climate is just plain silly. Breakfast in the restaurant was OK, but with no real service on offer. It's designed to get you in and out quickly with everything basically being self service. But still adequate. So for me, I think this is an interesting choice for the tourist who doesnt want to be in the centre of Singapore action, but wants to be a 5/10 minute taxi ride away. It will also suit a tourist who wants lots of eating/drinking options in typical Singapore outdoor style, but is happy not to have shopping at the front door. But for the Business traveller I think this hotel lacks many of the basic facilities that makes the difference between a good stay and a frustrating stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great service”
Reviews.Author: Aassddffgg
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with the Park Hotel. The staff were fantastic and the rooms- although smallish were clean and just what we were looking for for a stop over on the way home!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: chad b
Reviews.Content: For a 4 star hotel you wouldnt know it. Service is unbelievable. Try the room service. it great.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: isperanza58
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the staff was always willing to help with all our needs,e.g. advise on the best way of getting to our destinations, places to eat, things to see. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Location was excellent, close to great eating places and entertainment. Taxi's are continuously at the hotel entrance to take you to all parts of Singapore at cheap rates. We would recommend the Park Hotel Clarke Quay as the place to stay, that's were we'll be staying when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but quite far from MRT station”
Reviews.Author: thea_imutz
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel.. Located near Singapore River and Clarke Quay night-life.. My room and the bathroom were nice and clean.. Free internet access. Tea and coffee set were available on the room. The breakfast was tasty for my taste, I love it. But, the location quite far from MRT station, for me it took almost 20 mins. If you don't mind to pay more, take a taxi would be more comfortable..

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING WILL USE IT AGAIN FOR SURE”
Reviews.Author: Margot M
Reviews.Content: My entire experience of the Park Hotel from stepping out of the taxi to very smart, helpful,polite young men, to all the staff of the most welcoming Crystal Club was a most wonderful experience. The hotel provided a shuttle bus service to essential parts of Singapore The pool was lovely and relaxing with plenty towels and comfortable loungers

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a short term stopover”
Reviews.Author: expressaris_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights en route from UK to Bali. Arrived mid afternoon following an overnight flight. Check in was OK, although seemed to take 4 separate members of staff. There seemed to be massive amounts of staff! Location is ideal, 5 minutes walk to the bars and restaurants of Clarke Quay with the riverside path leading to Boat Quay, CBD and the Merlion. Rooms were small but adequate for a 2 night stay and clean and modern. Breakfast was really good, usual buffet mix of east meets west. Omelettes were particularly good. The swimming pool was great and fairly quiet - a great place to cool off from the heat and find some shade.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Good location”
Reviews.Author: southoz69
Reviews.Content: We arrived 6am after long flight from Europe with two tired children, our rooms were not ready but staff went out of their way to ensure we had alternative rooms to sleep in . Swimming pool area family friendly and location is close to many restaurants. Overall a very nice hotel and would definetly stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiStevechch
Reviews.Content: The Park is in the perfect location for either a stop over or a extended holiday. We stayed there for one night on the way to Malaysia. Located in Clarke Quay overlooking the water and the many restaurants etc along the waterway. The room was immaculate along with the service. We had a room on the 9th floor from which gave us a great view of the new hotel with the ship like structure perched on on top. Unfortunately our stay was short so we only got to visit the restaurants along the waterway where we had dinner and also a bar for a relaxing drink. Beware though drinks are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: edinburghguy1
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in a good location. Rooms were well equipped, stylish and comfortable though quite small. There is a nice pool with pool bar. The public areas on the ground floor are limited and the bar area small. All in all it was a good pick at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Bliss!”
Reviews.Author: AntoinetteKerrie
Reviews.Content: Overall a wonderful stay. We upgraded and paid the extra so that we could use the Business Lounge for breakfast, afternoon snack (although not actually that great), and evening drinks. The room was a little small, but it was nicely furnished, clean and the bathroom was nice and modern - a real must for me. Unfortunately, our floor appeared to be full and doors started banging shut from the early hours of the morning, so sleepwise it wasn't great. Room service was good, the food was fresh and hot and the drinks chilled. As we were busy sightseeing, we only reached the pool in the evenings, but it was blissfully quiet and so nice to relax outside in the warmth. Breakfast was okay, but no pancakes on offer - not a problem, but always nice to have on holiday. Service in the business lounge was attentive. My only complaint would be the girls on reception - quite obviously laughing at my husband and I when we checked in and when we checked out. This is something they need to address with their staff - it's really rude!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in city centre”
Reviews.Author: Graham A
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family for a 4 day stay at the end of our holiday having spent time in Kuala Lumpur and Langkawi. Efficient and courteous check-in. We arrived early and rooms were not available but location of hotel meant we only had to walk five minutes to Clarke Quay and Singapore River to the pass time. Rooms a bit small for all family luggage but we got interconnecting rooms that we requested. Rooms nice and fresh. Hotel location is excellent for all sightseeing activities. Fantastic pool area on 2nd floor although did not use it. Free Shuttle Bus to Orchard Road shopping malls. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gokiwi
Reviews.Content: Good room, compact, clean all that was needed for 2 night stop over. Staff helpful courteous

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Food, Great Executive Lounge”
Reviews.Author: HOTELINSPECTORABZ
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with the Park Hotel hotel where I conducted training session in the Hotel. It was worth paying the extra money for the 10th floor if on a business trip, as this gives you access to the Exec Lounge, complimentary breakfast, afternoon Tea, evening drinks and snacks.and 2 Pieces of complimentary laundry each day .Evelyn who manages the lounge is truly one exceptional lady who could write a book on how service should be delivered. Flawless.... , service par excellance! Evelyn and her team can not do enough to make your stay as comfortable as possible. You will not be disapponted. Matthew who attended to us at the Training rooms was equally as attentive and nothing was too much trouble. The Management held a cocktail party whilst we were there and again they are truly focused on Customer Service. As business woman travelling alone it was great to be able to go and explore Singapore at night! I did the tourist thing and went to Raffles and had a Singapore Sling , Not that good and completely over the top prices! My advise go look at the Hotel , wonder round , the courtyard and shops , ( NIce Mall over the road also) then take a cab S$ 6-8go to the Mariina Sands Hotel , take a lift to the 57 floor and have a cocktail up there. If you just go on visit only to the 57 floor it will cost you S$20 anyway to see the view , say you are going up for drink/meal and its complimentary. I also ate at the Ku De Ta restaurant which was fabulous . . Clarke Quay is on your doorstep , fabulous atmosphere and plenty of great restaurants , I ate at the Quayside Seafood restaurant which was very good. Singapore is everything and more , its Safe , its clean , its got a great ambiance , great food ( unfortunately I did not make the Haker stalls which are fab) great shopping! Never seen so many shops ....unfortunately I did not have enought time to really shop , so cannot give a a comment on prices etc. My only comment would be that the rooms was not very big.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with a great service”
Reviews.Author: Abilyas
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a superb service and has a courteous staff ... During the July 2011 trip, I had to stay at two hotels, both around Clarke Quay, and I found this one to be better in terms of value for money and amenities provided.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel clarke quay”
Reviews.Author: MosgielGolfer
Reviews.Content: Great stay, this hotel is in a really good area on Clarke Quay. its a short walk to orchard road and 5 mins from the MRT station. Some reviews we read said the rooms we small. we stayed 5 nights and found the room very good not large but if you go to singapore to spend a lot of time in your hotel room why bother going. the pool area was great with plenty of loungers and a nice bar great for a dip before you go out again for the night. dining in this area is great with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great position”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie_RSA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 days on my business trip. From the word go, I was made to feel at home. They flatly refused my insistence to take my own luggage up to my room; ground staff are always available to assist with anything. Rooms are right size for a business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “A good spot to relax and unwind”
Reviews.Author: mrjPerth
Reviews.Content: After a very busy holiday through Paris, Scotland and London we needed somewhere to rest and unwind. We booked into one of the Crystal Club rooms and this was certainly value for money. For a little extra on the normal room rate we were entitled to use the Crystal Club Lounge where refreshments are provided during the day, afternoon tea and then cocktails in the early evening were available at no extra cost. Breakfast is also served in the club lounge. The lounge has a relaxing atmosphere and you don't need to 'dress up' to use these facilities. We also had a 2pm checkout and were still able to access the club lounge until we left after 5pm. Our room was comfortable and the bathroom was very good. The swimming pool is in good condition too.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy but nice”
Reviews.Author: g_beresford
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the club Lounge in the Hotel. To be honest I have to say that you cannot always revisit the same place & have as good a time as before.Different people you meet , staff might have changed, I think it was more expensive than before & that can have an effect on how we enjoy the whole experience. However, in saying that it is very central to most things & easy to get around. The overall visit was nice & the Staff are lovely, as always. Enjoy Graham

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and hotel a must visit!”
Reviews.Author: DnBzzzzz
Reviews.Content: A great hotel and location for every thing, right opposite the Robinson quarter. We nearly missed this as thought it was residential area. Fantastic places to eat there too! Every person we met was so helpful. Sentosa is well worth a visit. Shopping to die for!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Timmy023
Reviews.Content: The Park is in a perfect location, not too busy and not noisy. There are many places to eat at night around the hotel if you don't want to stay and eat at the restaurant, and for a short stroll along and over the river you are in a top night spot with many famous restaurants. The breakfast at the park is worth getting up for each day I especially loved having my omelette cooked to my liking each day. The beds were hard to leave though very comfy. We loved the swimming pool and for a cool down at the end of the day very refreshing and a good chance to have a chat to fellow travellers. Service to rooms very good and staff all very pleasant and made our stay very enjoyable. We will return

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cristoff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of an independent tour of Malaysia and having flown with Singapore Airlines were able to stay in a Club floor room witrh access to a special lounge, all day free soft drinks and a happy hour with free cocktails and hors d'oeuvres - so far so good. Booked a room with river views and unhelpfully were shown to one facing the opposite direction; this was eventually changed. Room was remarkably small - space only for one suitcase so mine had to be laid out on the floor, very little clothes drawers or hanging rails. Room looked old-fashioned and was in need of renovation. Not a flat screen TV and the hotel tv channels were dreadful. Location was OK, a fairly short walk to the bright lights of Clarke Quay but to cross Clemenceau Avenue one had to take a rather circuitous route via an underpass. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast was only average with a slightly limited choice. Overall the small size of the room would put me off considering staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “modern, good location, but a little cramped”
Reviews.Author: joetidd
Reviews.Content: This is a good-looking, modern hotel, located close to the popular Clarke Quay restaurant area. The hotel looks smart from the outside, and inside the rooms are modern and clean. However, the rooms and public spaces are not spacious. The lobby restaurant/bar is pretty small given the size of the hotel. About 10 mins walk to Clarke Quay restaurant area, 15-20 mins to the MRT subway station, although the hotel does offer a free bus shuttle which loops between the hotel, MRT, Raffles Place & Orchard road, about once an hour. Clarke Quay was a little too theme-park like for me, with lots of 'European' style restaurants and branded franchises. I preferred Boat Quay, an extra 10 mins walk along the river, which has more Singaporean fare and better views across the river, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Excellent service. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Voyager6154
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel Clarke Quay was probably one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. The service was very good. Very attentive staff. Location is great because it's right on the river close to lots of restaurants, China Town and the Clarke Quay subway station. The hotel is located in a very quiet residential area.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and professional at the same time!”
Reviews.Author: DurLak
Reviews.Content: Though the rooms were on the smaller side, they are well kept. The hotel offers a great location by being very close to Riverside and Clark Quay. We were happy to see the amount we saved by booking early (almost 50% of our booking cost!!) and we also got an upgrade, (which hardly meant anything other than complimentary drinking water). I have to mention the great house keeping ..the lady did a good job and also the bell department. They were very helpful and approachable, always with a genuine smile. I dont have great things to say about the reception staff, but hardly matters.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ryder67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the robertson quai and the city center of singapore. Very good is the service and the stuff in the lobby. The rooms are nice and very clean. In the crystalclub floor is a lounge with an outstanding service and a great and helpful team. The roomservice is good and friendly. Internet and minibar is in the room also a cable tv with international channels. The poolside is nice and clean. The hotel is a four star hotel and deservers these four stars. The breakfast is rich and fresh. A lot of bars and restaurants are located around in walking distance. A small shoppingmall is on the other side of the street. Taxis are availeble 24 hours and can be ordered in front of the lobby. Special thanks to the team of the crystalclub. I recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Well located”
Reviews.Author: PB57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on the 10th floor. Rooms were clean and functional with great views from the floor to ceiling windows. Some previous writers have commented that the rooms were small. This was not a worry for us. We do not travel to spend time sitting around in hotel rooms. The hotel is located a few minutes walk from the restaurant and bar area of Clarke Quay. Staff were very friendly and efficient. Six of us caught a minibus from the airport to the hotel. It's cost SGD50. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good”
Reviews.Author: HansenDenmark8586
Reviews.Content: Near to the quay. Good views. I had 2 rooms, one was a twin and the other was a queen bed. my room was overlooking the city and my children's room was overlooking the pool and quay. pretty indeed.so had a pretty good idea on what views they had. restaurant was superb.staff was friendly. the receptionists was excellent!!! love their services.very knowledgeable and quick response. dont know why other guest rate poorly, bad day i guess. all of them with a smile. a thank you to all who made our stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: kels45
Reviews.Content: The Location of Park Hotel was excellent just walking distance to the river area where there are lots of places to eat. the courtesy bus runs all day the different areas and the hotel staff could not do enough for you. The rooms were very clean and tidy and the swimming pool lovely with towels provided. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in fun area of town”
Reviews.Author: pp61Switzerland
Reviews.Content: I am visiting this hotel since it opened 2 years ago. The quality stayed constantly high and the staff is very willing to help you. Problems in the rooms that did occur during my +5 visits were solved very quickly. Rooms have maybe not the US size but very normal in Singapore. The area is very nice in the evening although food will be cheaper outside the Clarke Quay district.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and thank you”
Reviews.Author: MillpNZ
Reviews.Content: Book thru our holiday planner and hesitated. What a surprised, it's beyond our expectation . Good service and warmth welcome from the man in white. Check-in fast and though room small, the view was nice. Design modern and sleek . Hope to be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AsiaSpecialistNL
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located along the river a short walk from the nightlife area of Clarke Quey. Great swimming pool & excellent restaurant. Rooms are nice but a little on the small side. Receptionists are arrogant and generally unfriendely and Internet computers in the lobby are not secure! All my accounts were hijacked after using these computers. Restaurant staff are VERY friendely and nothing is too much touble!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: krudyard
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect having read mixed reviews but we found it quite good. The lobby is somewhat cramped and they could do with some more seating. The internet "booths" are sqashed into a corner of the lobby with no privacy and the noise from the lobby was horrendous. Good view from our room, clean, and good location. The rooms are small but adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: florida_filly_61
Reviews.Content: Lovely to look at but a cold, impersonal, souless hotel. Selection at breakfast good served in the small bar/lobby area (not very appealing). Very small bedroom. If you suffer from vertigo don't stop here as one whole wall of bedroom is ceiling to floor glass window. Nice modern bathroom with opaque sliding door. No complimentary bottled water. Large pool/area which requires more loungers. Noticeable traffic noise at pool area. Lovely paved walkway on the riverside to Clarke Quay. Walkable to Chinatown. Great central location. Hotel probably OK for businessmen but not for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good location THATS ABOUT IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: anz54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights when i Arrived at the hotel staff at front counter were rude didn't even seem remotely interested i booked a deluxe queen room an when i arrive i was down graded to a superior twin an was not offered a refund for down grading the room. The room we stayed in was small you can hear people in the next room an doors slamming half the night.The bathroom is tiny not enough room to move.Towels where hard an when we used things like soap shampoo/conditioner they where not replaced. Restaurant is expensive cheaper to eat out Clarke Quay is a short walk from the hotel grate location with lots of restaurants bars Overall the hotel's in a good location good shuttle bus service which is free and the bell boys are nice an very helpfull nice pool, very clean,

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: shutterbugtei
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, walking distance from the bus stops, eating places. Nice hotel room, clean, not too small just right.

Reviews.Title: “Right choice”
Reviews.Author: zqing
Reviews.Content: Made the right choice staying in this hotel. Overall experience has been fantastic. The few must-mention is the excellent hotel staff service and the club lounge facilities which have been thoroughly enjoyable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: JTS-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and as I was travelling alone then the size of the room didn't matter too much, however i can see how couples could get under each others feet after a few days.
