The hotel is still reasonably new and i had a room on the 8th floor. Very clean and a nice bathroom with a good shower, didn't eat at the hotel however there are many options locally and you will be spoilt for choice. Didn't seem to have complimentary water so across the street in the mall there is a supermarket where you can stock up on essentials. Short walk to Clarke Quay and if you go the other way some nice bars and restaurants close by. Comfortable bed and laundry service was good value. JTS-7

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: HiHi_0404
Reviews.Content: Went Singapore with my hubby to celebrate our first year wedding anniversary. Had chosen this hotel based on the good comments on tripadvisor :) I stayed in a deluxe room for the first night and paid for an upgrade to Club Floor for the rest of the 2 nights. The Superior room is just --standard. Nothing special to write about, with all the standard flat screen TV, good broadband cable internet and a very comfy bed. Staff was efficient and helpful as I arrrived past midnight, the checkin process was smooth. The staff on the 10th floor club were exceptional. Very polite, knowledgeable, extremely helpful and friendly. Even though there were no different in term of room size for Deluxe and club room, but the teas, drinks, snacks, breakfast and evening cocktail served in the Club were beyond expectation. The Hotel's location is excellent in the heart of Singapore; very close to the river & walking distance from Clarke Quay a lively spot to have dinner in one of the many restaurants & bars. I would like to say thank you to the lovely club team and kitchen team (provide excellent food)... You guys make my stay memorable. Would definitely stay there again, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “God Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfielanger
Reviews.Content: Close to all of the action at Clarke Quay and Okay for a few days stopover. The rooms are small but adequate, the pool area is really good for cooling off. Breakfast is as previousley mentioed a bit of a scrum to get a table, there is not enough space for all the guests to sit so get in early and don't leave your table unattended or someone else will be sitting at it when you get back!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lionel3877
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The room is a bit small though..might not be suitable for family.

Reviews.Title: “A contributor to a nice stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: mr_boronas
Reviews.Content: Out of chance, from a list of hotels my company gave me, I selected this one for my 2 week stay. Hotel looks very elegant and clean and rooms were comfortable. A few things that were disappointing were, my room (726) did not have a universal adapter in it, whereas a colleague of mine was staying in room 820 and it did have one. When I went to the reception to ask for one, first I was told I would find it in my room when I returned in the evening - that did not happen. It took 2 more conversations and an escalation to the Sales Manager to find out they did not have one and the hotel did not offer to go out and buy one (probably a $5-$10 investment) so that is my only bad note for my visit. Overall the service was great, breakfast was OK and the concierge was always very helpful. Bellhops were also very helpful too. Proximity to Clarke Quay was nice as we had many restaurant choices there. If I were to return to Singapore, I would probably look to stay elsewhere only because I would like to be able to compare, but if I had to stay in this same hotel, I am sure I would enjoy it too. One thing that did strike me as odd was that in my 2 weeks there, I think I saw different staff serving breakfast every day except for 1 or 2 (out of about 5). Not sure why, but being there so long, this did not really allow for any familiarity to build between me and the staff. Note I am a very "people person" so the personal links are important for me, but overall service was OK. One kind of felt like in a training environment every day though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: recca83
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend stay with my partner and totally enjoy the hotel facilities. Very close to clarke quay and nice pool. Service excellent. Will book again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: plasyndre
Reviews.Content: Experienced other Clarke Quay hotels, this is superior but do upgrade to the Crystal Club floors. ALL rooms are small but perfectly formed. The staff in the club lounge are amazing, nothing is too much trouble. Breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails were great. Staff elsewhere in the hotel are very attentive. There is a great shuttle service to the MRT and sister hotels eg on Orchard Road. Pool area is lovely. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “the best of the best !”
Reviews.Author: green070
Reviews.Content: i was staying at the hotel for 5 nights. great hotel. great location, and most of all - great service !!!. i was enjoying the business lounge and will definitely get back to the hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels....”
Reviews.Author: LLJay1612
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night on the club floor, room is smaller compared to other four/five star hotel. No bathtub. It is located opposite a shopping mall called UE Square. U can get ur groceries at cold storage or have ur meal at delifrance or o'brien. No food centres sadly, hard to find a cheap decent meal. Hotel has a pretty pool, quiet but can be noisy if there guests are walking outside ur room as the walkway is rather narrow. Didn't try the breakfast though, u can have it at $25++ for each person. Overall, average hotel, I have better hotels in mind if given a choice

Reviews.Title: “4-star Lobby, 2-star Room”
Reviews.Author: pigchung
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, grand lobby, BUT DON'T BE DECEIVED. This is definitely NOT a 4-star hotel. Room is small, dirty, and poorly maintained. Carpet is disgusting, bathroom toilet and sink leak. Some of the electric outlets in the room don't work. Acoustics is poor and we were awoke in the morning by alarm clock from the next room. Staff is super-friendly on the surface, but were just going through the motions. When we requested a room change due to poor facing (noisy road and machinery outside), they immediate accomodated us, but gave us a room with the same facing and 1 floor below (which is even worse). This seems to be a hotel built to impress visitors on the surface (and with just enough amenities to get the 4-star rating), but lacks any substance. It might pass as a 2-star hotel, but definitely NOT 4-star and NOT worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MalkieM
Reviews.Content: We were offered and accepted the Crystal Club package and were given a lovely room on the 9th floor. Room may be a bit small but not so much that you feel cramped. The hotel is obviously relatively new so the fittings etc were quite up market and functional. No bath but we only shower anyway. The staff in the club room on the 10th Floor were quite exceptional. very polite, knowledgeable and extreemly helpful. The teas, drinks, snacks and breakfast served in the Club were beyond expectation. Location wise, not bad, easy walk to all the fun at Clarke Quay as well as Boat Quay and the free shuttle service to the city came in very handy.We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “HMMMM...Not too sure about this one”
Reviews.Author: Sandsmouse
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel ,Very centrally located and within travelling distance of all the major shopping areas and attraction s.Good transport links and taxi service is amazingly cheap !! Just a few dollars to go anywhere . Rooms are small and not much storage space and staff though helpful are quite formal and this was quite different to other hotels we had stayed in ,in other countries .Very efficient ...but almost too efficient . Was also impossible to get a free upgrade- even though the hotel was clearly not full .Some upgrades on services available but again not free .There is a shower room you can use before your flight - booked at 20 min intervals in advance...but this is very useful if you have a late flight and have been out all day in the very hot humid sun !! AND this is free . Just a few little niggles really that would have made it that bit more special and persuade you to go back ....there is a lot of choice of very good hotels .... but generally could not complain .You get what you pay for but dont expect anything extra for nothing

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great Management”
Reviews.Author: marcBL
Reviews.Content: It is obvious right from the start that the staff at this hotel are very well trained. Each one of them went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The hotel is quite new and well maintained. The pool area is very comfortable and I enjoyed the exercise area. We had a business meeting for several days and the banquet staff was fantastic. I highly recommend the Executive Floor. The staff is extra professional, the beverages and snacks wonderful and the amenities worth the upcharge. I also enjoyed the fact that the hotel is just off the Riverwalk and great for jogging at any time of the day or night since it is well lit and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, quality service.”
Reviews.Author: kevdeb5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hotel Clarke Quay for 6 nights. We booked a Crystal Club package which included breakfast, afternoon tea, cocktails, internet, free drinks and some laundry. Great value if you use most of them. They also have a complimenary bus service wich takes you to Orchard Rd and other city points. The staff were friendly and helpful in all areas. The swimming pool and outside deck area is fantastic. Breakfast is as good as anything you will get in Asia -you could place a special order apart from what was already on offer. The rooms were not large but very clean, comfortable, quiet and well appointed. The bathroom consisted of a fantastic, large, separate shower and all other extras you may require. Location was great - a short riverside walk to Clarke Quay with all it's eating and entertainment areas. The MRT (train station) is also in this area which linked you to Chinatown, Little India, Orchard Rd and all other tourist areas. Next door to the hotel in the oppostie direction is Robertson Walk with its huge eating area with a variety of food outlets. There is also a bus service on the road outside the hotel. A supermarket is in the shopping centre across the road for those bits and pieces you always need.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted in a Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Blossom010
Reviews.Content: the porters where very helpfull and the Hotel is handy to China town , little India and Orchard road just a short taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “location,location”
Reviews.Author: relax56
Reviews.Content: The park hotel clarke quay,left us with some wonderful memories,Staff were so attentive and professional,they made you feel right at home.We enjoyed our,complimentary breakfast,afternoon teas,and our happy hours,all inclusive with our room,which was on the 9th floor,small in size,but big on view of the city and the river.We absolutely loved the pool area,my husband enjoyed it,as he was able to do lengths,which in a lot of hotel,motel pools you are unable to do .So to all of you travelling,i highly recommend this place for your next stay in singapore

Reviews.Title: “Cute & Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: RihamR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Park Hotel Clarke Quay two nights starting off my honeymoon trip. The whole stay experience was extremely enjoyable & nice. The Hotel's location is excellent in the heart of Singapore; very close to the river & walking distance from Clarke Quay a lively spot to have dinner in one of the many restaurants & bars, several of them overlooking the river; you could also grab a cup of cuppocino or coffee at lovely places there. Really enjoyed the food at Hot Stones in Clarke Quay exciting experience. The hotel makes it easy access to the Universal Studios at Sentosa. It is also half an hour walking distance from the Singapore flyer; a very nice walk with fresh sights. The Hotel is very clean & Trendy in a cute tiny way. The Service is good. The Reception is sort of relaxing. The room location was very nice sort of secluded in its privacy. The room itself was a cute tiny cubicle despite its smallness it was very lovely & very clean & decently furnished with elegant light modern. Well the bathroom was very small but again still very cute. The room overlooked the pool & over to singapore streets, very nice. The breakfast was served in an area near the reception otherside, a small but cozy, clean & cool place. The food was tastey with good variety. Had a lovely time at Singapore & the hotel was great for its value. Again its location is unmatchable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachelmelody14
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel due to long weekend hotel. The first impression was clean, cozy and comfortable feel though the lobby was small. The reception staff upon check-in was attentive and courteous.. plus point for Spore hotel.. the room though small.. clean, well maintained and simple designed.. The weekend seafood buffet at the lobby restaurant was worth to try. The spread was limited but the food quality and freshness of the seafood from oysters, cold crabs and mussels are yummy.. Service and attentive of staff was good. The swimming pool is just stunning, though the weather did not permit us to stay longer. The hotel is located within walking distance to the happening clarke quay...

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: tar-rob19
Reviews.Content: Although the room we stayed in was small, we still enjoyed ourselves as the hotel had a lot to offer and was in a great location! Plus the staff were extremely helpful, with taxi's being right outside the hotel and the staff helping you get into the taxi as well as a free shuttle bus offered right outside the hotel. Staff were always very attentive to our every need, including ice cubes which we requested quite a few times! Only negative was the cost of some things including the 10% service fee for most of our requests....although I'd have to rate our experience a 10/10. Would definitely stay at this hotel again! Thank you Park Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location but rooms so tiny, a real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: PerthLaura
Reviews.Content: There would be 1 metre at the most between the end of the bed and the wall with TV protruding so 2 people cannot pass each other and by the time you put your luggage in there is less than 1 square metre of carpet where you can walk. They have literally used every inch to its fullest. Space is luxury and this place does not have any space, so unless you get a really good deal, I would rather pay an extra $30 and stay somewhere else. The service was good, the room clean, the breakfast good if you like runny omelettes. The pool does not have easy access for the elderly. It advertises that it is disable friendly but besides having an elevator the rest is not disable friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, rooms are so small”
Reviews.Author: barrymz2
Reviews.Content: lovely new hotel with very friendly staff, however, the rooms are so small. The hotel is clean and every aspect was done effectively and professionally. The staff are friendly and attentive to detail however did i mention that the rooms are small The pool is nice and location well Singapore everything is about $SNG 5 away. Breakfast was good and the club lounge was a great retreat outside breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktail hour. Business room was ideal for my daughter to study.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: love_indulgence
Reviews.Content: Booked a superior room with a complimentary upgrade to deluxe room. Upon arrival, was given a crystal club superior room, impressed. Room was comfy enough even though its a bit small. Was disrupted while watching tv as changes were being made to the cable channels and it can be seen on the screen. 3G reception isnt very good in the room. Overall, good stay and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not paradise, but pleasant enough ..”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissTraveller1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are regular visitors to Singapore and have stayed in various hotels. On this particular occasion, we stayed here at the Park Hotel for 3 1/2 weeks, which is a pretty long time to stay in a hotel. The staff are friendly, apart from one sullen barman in the restaurant. Rooms are clean and comfortable albeit a little on the small side. Pool is fine and service is good. The men on the carkpark are particularly nice. The one major downside to this hotel is the reception/restaurant area .. they side right next to each other on the ground floor, meaning that breakfast esp is particularly manic. If you sit outside to have breakfast, you're also right next to the carpark/coach area, meaning you get vehicle fumes right next to your table. Not ideal and the atmosphere itself is pretty chaotic what with guests trying to check-in/out, tour groups coming and going etc - not the most relaxing way to begin your day. That said, we did really enjoy our stay. By the end of the 3 1/2 weeks, the staff knew us by name and we almost felt a little sad to leave. We would stay here again, but perhaps only as a second choice - there are lots of hotels in Singapore to discover and we're not overly attached to this one just yet. An enjoyable stay but we're excited to see what else Singapore has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevinwine69
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic trip to Singapore and Bali and stayed here at the Park hotel.Found this to be a great choice for a few days,10 mins walk to Clark quay and very handy for other transport around.Not a great sized hotel but rather more personal and quiet,had a room on the club floor and have to say that the rooms while very small are very clean and functional . Would also like to thank Evelyn,Aries and Debra for all their help in the Crystal room,they were fantastic. would stay here again for good value accommodation and would definitely reccommend the club floor.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore 2011”
Reviews.Author: rayking102
Reviews.Content: Just spent 18 nights at the above hotel, service could not be faulted, breakfast was of a constant high quality and a mixed range of Asian and Western food, as for location it was not to bad once you got your bearings, a bus stop on one side of the road outside the hotel would take you into Chinatown and beyond, the other side would take you to Orchard road and all that entails. Clarke Quay M.R.T. station was about a 10/15 minute walk away. Lots of food outlets along the river at both Clarke Quay & Boat Quay, and there is a Kopitiam in Liang court centre about 6 min walk. As for the hotel room very small for a new hotel and very little storage space no hooks to hang anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel until there's a problem”
Reviews.Author: labs222
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, small hotel, modern, nice pool, very clean, super tiny rooms. Came in around 11:30pm from grueling hot/sticky day of sight seeing, so we were hot and exhausted. We took a quick dip in their lovely pool and came up to shower and hit the hay. We had adjoining rooms with our 2 teens, and neither shower worked. We tried 8 times to call housekeeping, front desk, and service manager to no avail. No one answered. We just came from the pool, my husband soaking wet in robe had to go down to the front desk to find the girl who worked the front desk in the back chatting it up with her friend. She apologized, called engineering and they fixed one shower, but weren't able to fix the other, so the four of us had to share one shower. As we were checking out, we mentioned it to the front desk, they apologized, but basically didn't care. When we asked to speak to the manager regarding this, they weren't available, but gave us his email. This hotel was an American Express recommended hotel, so I guess I expected better customer service. There are so many other hotels in the vicinity, I'm sure there is another comparable hotel with better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service....BUT”
Reviews.Author: JDwalkabout
Reviews.Content: The staff at Park certainly try their best to assist you with any request. The front door staff (The men in white) and the club room staff were a joy to interact with. Raj at the pool was also cheerful and helpful despite being out in the heat all day, and trying to sell $13 beers and $8 soft drinks. The downside....the rooms. If you order a twin room...beware the large piece of glass on the table next to your bed...you WILL find it in the middle of the night with your face, as the glass extends far beyond the table's edge right next to your pillow. The queen rooms are the same size, which is too small for an extended stay. Regardless of what room you order, you wont get enough room to swing a cat, your luggage will be on the floor as there is nowhere to put it, and your room will also be showing signs of age and poor build quality even though the hotel is less than 3 years old. (look at the ceiling cornices and edges) Also, beware of glossy reviews, as the hotel staff unashamedly prompt you to write a review for them, with their assistance of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & great service but don't expect heaps of leg room”
Reviews.Author: BVN2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Hotel Clarke Quay for 4 nights in April on a short break away from Melbourne, Australia. Positives - great location in Singapore - excellent service and friendly staff - great swimming pool and easy gym access - very clean and tidy rooms - complimentary 'shower room' after check-out before flying home, which was very useful as we had a late night flight. - free shuttle from Hotel to Orchard road shopping and also the sister park hotels in singapore Negatives - Quite small rooms. We booked the Standard Room, and on arrival were advised that as they were heavily booked, we had been upgraded to a delux standard room on Level 6 of the hotel. The hotel has 10 levels. Although the room was nice and had all the amenities we expected, it was compact and meant that we didn't feel as comfortable hanging out in our room as we normally would have on a leisure trip. - very firm mattress - small dinning room for the buffet breakfast, however as we opted not to include breakfast in our package we found other local cafe alternatives worked quite well. Overall, this was a very nice hotel with many positive qualities and the hotel had a great friendly feel to it, particularly the staff who were most helpful with our queries and bookings in Singapore. We would definitely recommend it for value and quality service.

Reviews.Title: “quite despite of being at the center...”
Reviews.Author: Capt_Umut
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular traveller to Singapore due to business. Previously I was staying at Park Hotel City Hall but in last two stay I choose Clarke Quay. Stayed in Club Room and have the benefits of Crystal Club. All clean, rooms are brand new and service is wonderful. People are always smiling and doing the best for the customers. As the hotel is very close to Clarke Quay, it's very nice to have walks near the river.

Reviews.Title: “All mod cons in a great location”
Reviews.Author: IanPEngland
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to the generally favourable opinion. Great location on the Singapore River - close enough to Clarke Quay without the noise and traffic. Modern room at a reasonable price with a view down the river. Only drawback was a very small wardrobe, but we weren't staying long. Efficient, friendly, helpful staff. We didn't eat in but used the supermarket, cafes and Italian restauarant in the mall across the road. The hop-on sightseeing bus stopped just round the corner. Altogether a lucky choice.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, newly renovated rooms; amazing pool”
Reviews.Author: MariaNayden
Reviews.Content: The room we had was very nice - high ceilings and new contemporary furnishings (it was on level 2). The bathroom was also very spacious and the shower was very good. Maybe only the wardrobe would not be quite adequate for someone staying longer. The other downside is that you have to pay for the internet even if you need to check your e-mail for only 10 mins. On the upside - the pool is great with amazing views. The pool-lounges are usually in short supply but with a little patience I always got one within 20 mins. The location is very handy for Clarke Quay, Chinatown, The Padang and Fort Canning park. Recommend the evening walk along the river - not only around Clarke Quay , but also towards Robertson Quay and beyound. There is a shopping mall across the road with a very handy supermarket.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for exploring Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JDavidJLiverpool
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was well up to the standard expected from a modern hotel. (We arrived as part of a group booking from a cruise ship, so the hotel was chosen for us.) Check in was very efficient - no surprises. Although we arrived well before normal check in time, we got into the room immediately. Later arrivals had to wait while rooms were prepped, but all seemed to be in well before 14:00. Room was excellent - large shower, but no bath. Large comfortable bed, large TV, desk with wireless or wired internet. We had a corner room looking over a park, the Singapore River, and in the distance the Sands Hotel. A reasonable sized pool, clean and well maintained (shallow enough for un-confident swimmers), had a jacuzzi built into one end. There were massage tables nearby, but we didn't use the heath spa facilities. The gym was well equipped, and the machines looked very new, but I didn't use them. The dining room was a bit crowded at peak breakfast times, but there was plenty of room outside. Choice was wide, food was fresh, tables were cleared quickly. We didn't have dinner in the dining room, but the BBcue by the pool was fine, with our food cooked specially, as we were late and the service was winding down. The Singapore river, with its hundreds of eateries, is right by the hotel, so any sort of dining can be quickly found. The MRT (subway) is about 400yds away, though of course a taxi can be called in seconds. All in all an excellent base for exploring Singapore City.

Reviews.Title: “excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: jumbov
Reviews.Content: great view from the room,facilities were clean and well presented.Food was well presented and tasty.A double bed would have been better!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kalais308
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must stay, 5min walk to Clarke Quay, We stayed there for 7 nights & enjoyed every night, The staff were very friendly & helpful, Buffet breakfast was OK with a decent selection of foods to choose from, Our room #633 was pretty good it had views of the city & pool & clarke quay at night looks good all lit up, room had new & modern furnishings a little on the small side but hey its only a place to crash out & recharge, The pool is hugh but needs more day beds around it, There's a supermarket right across the road if you need some cheap beer & snacks. The only bad thing was the pillows in our room & our friends were hard as a rock.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard and location”
Reviews.Author: bill186298
Reviews.Content: This was an efficient hotel, my bags being whisked away, and at my room when I completed the check in. The room was spotless and of a reasonable size, but slightly let down by a lack of drawers and poor illumination from the room lights at night. The pillows were also on the hard side. Breakfast buffet was ok, but the evening a la carte menu in the restaurant was somewhat limited, even though reasonably priced for the area. A good point was the free shuttle bus at regular intervals to the subway station and Suntec shopping mall. They do offer a shower and change facility for late flight ex guests, but it would have been helpful to have mentioned this in their directory

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Spurskim107
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well situated. We had a room on a high floor with excellent views. The hotel staff were very attentive to detail and pleased to serve. Other reviewers have criticised the room size but we had no issues on this although our travel agent had requested an upgrade. Excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Let down at the last minute by a small point?”
Reviews.Author: Sankey1951
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and location, ideal last stop for a "round the world" holiday that had been great fun (despite earthquakes in New Zealand!). But having asked about a room to have a shower before a late departure (8.00pm) to the airport confusion reigned! We were told that the room was only available after 5.00pm and strictly on a "first come first served" basis. But when asking for this facility at 4.50pm we were told that it was already in use and it was available from 4.00pm! Sounds a pretty small gripe but in a 30 degree climate a shower was a must and at least one couple missed the chance. A shame could have been avoided with better communication!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant end to a holiday in Australia”
Reviews.Author: Alan_S_391
Reviews.Content: After 2 1/2 frantic weeks in Australia a stopover on the way home to UK in Singapore was much needed, and coinciding with our wedding anniversary even better. We stayed on the club floor which provides a lounge on the 10th floor with stunning city views, breakfast ,afternoon tea, beverages all day and in the evening alcholic drinks, superb ! Well worth the very reasonable extra supplement. In addition Club lounge staff lead by Evelyn just couldn't do enough, excellent service at all times.Another plus we had a late departure to the UK but the provision of a shower room and refreshments before we left made it all very easy...we both wished we'd stayed longer despite ticking the tourist boxes there was still plenty to do.

Reviews.Title: “a total waste of money”
Reviews.Author: luffy87
Reviews.Content: To make this review fair, I will first like to state that I didnt book the room thru the internet, and hence had to incur the full published rate of $360++ for a deluxe room, instead of $290++. Nonetheless I felt that it was a total waste of my money even if I had paid the cheaper internet rate. First of all, the deluxe room was not big. I couldnt say it was small either. It was okay but the term 'deluxe' was rather misleading. I thought it would be bigger than 'superior' room. There was no bathtub in the toilet, simple a monsoon-style shower. Worse of all, it doesnt come with free internet access or breakfast!! Gosh.. I felt totally scammed but it was partly my fault for not enquiring properly beforehand. But given that it was a 4-star hotel, i would have expected much more. There was no service to speak of as well. For most of the time, I felt like a piece of glass. The staff at the reception and entrance totally ignore my presence when I walked in and out of the hotel. They gave me this feeling that they treated other foreign guests nicer.. Perhaps I was dressed rather sloppily in tee, shorts and slippers. But I wore pretty much the same to Fullerton but was given a total kind of treatment. In short, I will never stay at this place again. This time round was a spur-of-the-moment mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Omacarla
Reviews.Content: The hotel is reasonably new and furniture and decor is quality and pleasant. The staff are fantastic, helpful, friendly and courtious.The swimming pool is beautiful.Great for people who like to do their morning walk with pathways along Robinson Walk, Clarke Quay and North Quay. Plenty of quality and varied dining in the area but no cheap foodhalls. Extremely pleasant area..On the negative side, the rooms are small with only a wardrobe and no drawer spaces. There is really nowhere to leave cases and we had to use one of our chairs.There were only 2 computers , in the reception area and not cheap at over $6.00 for 30 mins.The breakfast area becomes far too small for those who get up late. There was sometimes a long queue.Breakfast reasonable but not varied. When I recommend this hotel, I do so for short and overnight stays, not long stays.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service in the Brizo”
Reviews.Author: Freetraveler38
Reviews.Content: This is my only regret for my trip to Singapore in Jan11. This hotel room was nice but we got the worst service in the world. We took a buffet breakfast in the Brizo Restaurant & Bar. My son, a 6 years old being a responsible young man, tried to grab his own bowl of coco pop with milk and walked slowly back to his seat. A black-suit waiter, called Lun (or Fun I can't remember), blocked the way and my son stopped at his back without any choice. This guy stepped back suddenly and knocked off my son's bowl causing my son got completely wet with chocolate milk. You would expect a sincere apology? Never from this guy! What even worse was he kept saying not to blame him because he could not see his back and my son was too short, and it was not his fault, bla bla bla. I saw him even talked behind our back with other guests expressing how innocent he was. What a jerk was that? I am very disappointed with this guy if he is representing the hotel. Don't consider this hotel unless you don't mind to be treated rudely by this guy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - close to Clarke Quay restaurant and night life area”
Reviews.Author: PAC6917
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, booked four nights via Qantas Holidays from 18/11/10. Apparently refurbished 12 months ago - staff only too pleased to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Pool”
Reviews.Author: MrPeters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in January 2011 for three nights. The location is very good as it is only a short walk to Clarke Quay. The best part about the hotel would have to be the pool. It is a decent size with sunbeds located around the pool. There is a good view of the Singapore River and CBD from the deck. Our room was quite small, but it had all the basics. The hotel has free wireless internet, however this is only available in the lobby and there is a tedious sign in process. The gym has all the latest equipment. Overall this is a nice hotel, however it does not represent good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,attentive staff but decor looking tired.”
Reviews.Author: cloudy60
Reviews.Content: * Later checkout in clubclass * Some of the decor looks very tired and needs updating some areas need TLC * Fresh local flowers in the club class lounge should be standard * Table cloths on the tables at breakfast time would improve the ambiance * Soap is so thin it falls through the bars in the shower shelf ..... I think all the toiletries could be improved upon. We have struggled with one piece of soap in the shower for two days! I hope this is helpful. We have enjoyed our stay mainly due to Evelyn and her teams attention.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, staff, like most singaporeans, so naturally friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Akira1981
Reviews.Content: Room clean, supposed to have a superior room. But it was small. Pool lovely, staff very nice, bus service the hotel provides around Singapore really useful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: debmac1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 2 night stopover on the way home from Vietnam. My friend at first was disappointed in the hotel: No grand lobby area, very small rooms, no balcony (she's a smoker) and miles away from Orchard Rd! However, she was smitten by the end. It was clean, we asked for an ironing board and got it, our booking included breakfast which was really good (though you sometimes had to queue). Pool area is lovely but we had neither the weather nor the time to appreciate it. But the location is great - loads and loads of bars and restaurants in walking distance and only a short taxi ride anywhere else. In our short stay we managed a meal at the Indochine (Clarke Quay); coffee at Bella's Pizza (Clarke Quay); a morning shopping in Orchard Road; coffee at the Hyatt alfresco coffee on the corner of Orchard and Scott St (good spot); a singapore sling at the Raffles, a wander around China Town and great lunch at a market, a 1 hr river boat tour (Clarke Quary) and a night at the Ku De Ta bar on the 57th floor of the Marina Bay Sands monstrosity. Ku De Ta super expensive - $60 for 2 glasses of sauvignon blanc - but the view is to die for - well worth the investment. It was my first trip to Singapore and a great choice for a stop over - clean, safe and plenty to do. The only drawback is that it is so.... expensive to eat and drink...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: sara_doidge
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore to continue the 2nd leg of our honeymoon after staying in paradise in Koh Samui. This hotel was a great base for our 3 day sight seeing, it was extremely clean and you were provided with everything you needed. We were kept waiting at reception to check in, and the room was extremely small with a view of a side street. I have had bigger rooms and nicer views from a travellodge in Yorkshire. Having said those things it was still a lovely hotel and a great base as were not in the room much apart from to sleep. The breakfasts were good & the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place !”
Reviews.Author: MateO-RachoU
Reviews.Content: A really well located hotel. I've tried a couples of rooms and all of them were nice. If you can, ask for a room with a view on the pool or on Clark-Key.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: KandATravels
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location on the Quays, nice pool area for relaxing after a busy day!

Reviews.Title: “Very good breakfasts..”
Reviews.Author: beecon
Reviews.Content: We thought that the Park was a really good hotel. The breakfasts were particularly good! The location is execellent and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Plenty of places to eat locally and the walk by the river quite beautiful. Beecon

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: Andi_and_Thao
Reviews.Content: Imagine paying 230 S$ (which is about 140€) for a room per night. Now imagine this room is as small as a standard 2 star hotel room. Now imagine there is no breakfast, no Internet access, no bathtub, no alarm clock, not even a hairdryer included. Then again you don't need an alarm clock since you get woken up by the noise of the service crew ringing on doorbells along the hall and the sound of flushing water running through the sewage pipes of the rooms above and around you. Don't dare touching the water basin, you will hear the sewage water running below your feet, which I find unacceptable for a 4 star hotel. The first morning, an overzealous staff member rang our doorbell twice while we were just waking up, and then just opened our door while we were laying half-naked in our beds. Yes, this hotel looks fancy from the outside and gets praised on the internet, but what you get is not what you pay for. It's ridiculous at best (quite as the whole of Singapore in my opinion), overpriced with big fancy names, while absolutely no content and low quality. Never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS FAR TOO SMALL FOR STAYS OF OVER 2 NIGHTS|”
Reviews.Author: rex_hemmings
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was booked for us through our agent in the UK, Premier Travel. They booked us in from 24th Dec to 2nd January 2010 - 9 nights. When we arrived, the room whilst being beautifully decorated, was the smallest Hotel room I have every stayed in. The wardrobe was 2ft 6 inches wide and would only accommodate a suit, pair of trousers and a shirt. Bearing in mind the two of us were there for 9 nights, the room was totally inadequate. Complaints to the management fell on deaf ears. They insisted that all rooms were the same size. We had to live out of our suitcases for 9 nights and there was nowhere to put our two large cases apart from storing them vertically on top of oneanother. A nice Hotel for 2 nights but totally inadequate for 9 nights stay. Its a 'stop-over' Hotel only.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Nopinion
Reviews.Content: travelled with my family 1,3,10 year old. Had 2 connected rooms. Babycot just made the room smaller. We had 2 in 1 room to keep the kids together. In-room internet broadband not great if you only have your Ipad available. I think it is time for the hotel to go full wireless! No kids pool. Overall a nice hotel but not for families with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient hotel at Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Chris_1018
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be rather new and is conviniently located opposite of UE Square very near to Clarke Quay, Singapore's nightlife hotspot. The rooms are clean and functional but a bit small though. If you travel with much luggage it can become difficult to find enough space for it. The choice of food at the breakfast buffet is is good, same for the taste. Pool is rather big and at the time we were there only sparesly populated.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mcleana
Reviews.Content: We loved our time in this hotel. We stayed on the Crystal Club floor and were very impressed with the caring and attentive staff. Our room was small, but had nothing missing - it was clean, fashionable and yet cosy. The ceiling were very high with floor to ceiling windows making for great views. The hotel is very close to the river and lots of nightlife at Clarke Quay. We would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location but a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Nim-Chi
Reviews.Content: Getaway in Singapore for a few days at the end of November. Staying in Park Hotel Clarke Quay, right in the middle of the city. Great location, room is comfy & clean, good service. I pretty enjoyed my stay there. To be improved: room is bit overpriced, USD180 a night (just a superior room). Breakfast variety.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL IN GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: PaulSomewhere
Reviews.Content: A Very clean and friendly hotel located right next to the river at Clarke Quay. We stayed 4 nights and staff and service were excellent. Clarke Quay is perfect for a night out as ther are a multitude of restaurants and bars with everyy possible type of food. Overall a very lively scene. Breakfast at the hotel is served in the lobby bar and can get a bit crowded but the food is more than acceptable.The tourist bus is located about 5 minutes walk away. This is ideal for getting around the main attractions. Overall a good medium priced hotel that I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: YvonneEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Hotel for 2 nights on our way to New Zealand and we weren't dissapointed. The rooms were on the small side so much so that we had to leave the suitcases in front of the window as there was nowhere to put them, having said that we were only there for 2 nights so we didn't mind too much but can see it would be a big problem if you were staying longer. The hotel is in a really good location for Clarke Quay and all it as to offer. We had breakfast included in our package and it was downstairs in the restaurant. All the food was really good and the service by the staff was first class. We ate both nights in the restaurant as after eating there on our first night it was so delicious we just had to go back for more. The staff on reception were very helpful and friendly and everything was so organized. The swimming pool was excellent with sun lounges and umbrellas and plenty of thick towels. If we should pass this way again we will want to stay at The Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Four star shoe box!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aitch69
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a cosy room then I guess this is the hotel for you!! Be very wary of the hotel's website and Agents like TravelBag who continue to recommend this hotel. The rooms are described as cosy, which is misleading in the extreme. They are extremely small measuring about 11ft wide x 9ft deep; if you were to swing the proverbial cat it would hit every wall. They are extremely claustrophobic and when we attempted to complain that we had been misled it fell on deaf ears from both the hotel staff and TravelBag. Be wary particularly as TravelBag maintain they will continue to recommend this hotel to guests but will make no mention of precisely how small the rooms really are. The acoustics also suck; we were woken each morning by next door's alarm call!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this nasty hotel at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: bklynbubba
Reviews.Content: When I checked in I was told that the room I had reserved was not available (...which reminded me of a line from a favorite tv show...You know how to take the reservation, you just don' t know how to HOLD the reservation) Instead of a room overlooking the pool and the skyline of Singapore I was given a tiny room overlooking someone else's living room. While checking in I inquired about breakfast and was curtly told by the same creep that 'your reservation doesn't come with breakfast. If you want breakfast you can buy it in there' as he pointed to the coffee shop which also doubled as a restaurant. I took breakfast in the mall across the street. I do not know what this guy's problem was but reception is not where he should be working. Onto my little cave a a room, which was tiny, and so close to the building across the street that it was best to keep the curtains closed, even though the glass appeared to be tinted from the outside. The hotel does have a lovely and huge pool. That is it's only saving grace. There is a pool bar, but if you are on the wrong side of the pool you can forget about anyone serving you. When I asked about using the business centre I was told internet access was SING$6.00 per half hour. Needless to say you know what I told them they could do with their business centre. For what I was paying for my room, which I might add was quite high, free internet should have been included. Breakfast should have been included as well come to think of it. The hotel has 'club floors' and these all get the 'amenities' mentioned above. I can just imagine what they have to pay. The only friendly people at this place were the doormen, who were always there to help with bags and give a friendly greeting. The reception was the rudest I have ever experienced in my life, and I have been traveling for over 30 years. I travel only for pleasure, never for business, so I guess this hotel caters to business people. If you are in Singapore on business and your company pays your travel expenses, then I guess it's fine for you and you can stay on one of the 'club' floors. If you are in Singapore for a vacation, avoid this horror show.

Reviews.Title: “Pay more for a club room - it's fantastic. Also excellent swimming pool.”
Reviews.Author: vjt2010
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We paid extra for a club room and our room was really clean, modern and very quiet - we slept so well. The club lounge is great. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, there is free, high speed internet and there are free generous alcoholic drinks and substantial snacks for two hours every evening in the lounge. The included club buffet breakfast is good. Throughout the day the staff will bring you unlimited non-alcoholic drinks in the lounge and there are also smaller snacks and afternoon tea included in the club room rate too. You even have the benefit of 2 free items of laundry per day. The staff were really helpful in giving us advice on how best to get to places. They also let us have a late check out on our final day which was just brilliant. The hotel offers a free bus shuttle service to and from the main sights of Singapore which is brilliant - make sure you ask for a timetable when you check in. The swimming pool is the best hotel pool I've ever seen - it's huge! There are loungers all around it (there could be a few more for the size of hotel but that would be my only complaint) and some jacuzzi jets at one end. You can definitely swim lengths in this pool. We would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “It is an awesome Hotel and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: businesskigali
Reviews.Content: The services are fast and the Hotel workers are very kind and understanding. When a service is requested, one does not wait for a long time to be served. KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and so close to Clarke Quay entertainment area”
Reviews.Author: Frank255060
Reviews.Content: The service was very professional and kind. The room size was just right with a very modern layout. The room looked out towards the pool and at night with the lights on it was a very nice lookout. The breakfast that was included catered for all types and was replemished very often. The best thing of all was that the shower in my room had a massive shower head which I could actually stand up straight under it (as I'm 6'3) and enjoyed this the most!

Reviews.Title: “Covenient and cozy”
Reviews.Author: radvani
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hotel for a couple of nights on a quick trip to Singapore. I booked the room online at the last minute (morning before I left). I had no issues at check-in, it was extremely smooth considering I landed at an ungodly hour. The room I got was great, overlooking the pool & a great city view. My only grouse was that I was given a room on a smoking floor, without being asked my preference (I do not smoke). The room is small but functional - targetted at the business traveller, so do not expect too many amenities and closet space. The rooom comes with an electronic safe, minibar (reasonably priced) and a flatscreen TV with international channels. There is no drinking water provided in the room, so you either have to drink tap water (safe in Singapore) or reach for the minibar. I did not try the hotel restaurant, but it looked fairly decent. I would suggest that you explore the restaurants around Robertson Quay/Clarke Quay/MOhammed Sultan, the hotel is perfectly located to walk to all three. For the location and price, I will definitely return. The hotel is not 5 star, but for the same price as the Ibis on Bencoolen or Novotel at Clarke Quay, you get much better quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hotel, Clarke Quay, Singapore fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireChez_43
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on a stopover to Australia. Lovely hotel no complaints. Clarke Quay is a great place to see and walk round. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It can hardly be called 5-star”
Reviews.Author: Cymia
Reviews.Content: Dont be mislead by some hotel booking website - it's absolutely not a 5-star hotel. The staff service is to be improved: they first offered me a room with poor view, but actually i've booked a deluxe room via travel agent (and of coz paid more); I called the front desk and soon found out this was their 'mistake' and they offered me a room with city view, which was much nicer. Generally the room is quite small, breakfast.....emmm simply edible. I would have brought my own towel if i know the bathroom towel is of such a bad quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel amenities”
Reviews.Author: oakwoodclock
Reviews.Content: From the time you are greeted by the bell boy you feel that this is going to be a good experience. The check in was quick and efficient and we were accompanied to our room by a beel boy carying the luggage. The room was smaller than expected but adequate for our needs. The windows are full height and overlooked the Singapore river and hotel swimming pool. The shower room had one glass wall onto the bedroom but there was a curtain to pull down. The bed was harder than normally used to but hard beds seem to be the norm in Asia. Breakfast offered plenty of choice but could improve on the bread and cooked meat selection. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful in every department and to hear one of the waitresses say to another hotel guest that she loved her job explains the attitude of the staff throughout the hotel. Nothing seems to be too much trouble. The hotel is surroundeed by bars and restaurants. But be warned drinks are expensive in Singapore and with some bars the prices increase as the night progresses and at the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Club Lounge worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: BenRo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good spot for Clarke & Boat Quays and for the metro system. Having a pool is very handy too. The rooms are on the small side, but the club access is worth paying a bit extra for, purely for the inclusive drinks and canapes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, in the heart of Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: AashishSharma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hotel Clarke Quay during F1 week this year. The location is fantastic - just a 2 minute walk from all of Clarke Quay's major attractions. The hotel staff is well-behaved and courteous (thought the reception had some less-experienced junior staff with a permanently confused look). The rooms are fairly cluttered and compact (guess that's what to expect for the price). The bathrooms are also bereft of much space. The laundry service was very efficient. The coffee shop/dining area is ample, though crowded during breakfast hours. Breakfast selection is very good - continental, asian as well as fresh fruits and eggs made-to-order. Free wi-fi is available in the lobby area. The gym is spacious and well equipped. I would recommend this hotel, mainly for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Useful base for short Singapore stopover”
Reviews.Author: Papabob
Reviews.Content: We used the hotel as a stopover for three nights on a trip out to Australia and for one night on our return. On the outward journey we had a standard room and were disappointed with the overall quality. A double bed was positioned tightly into a corner of the room , requiring one person to clamber over the bed to get out in the morning or during the night and the bathroom door catch did not secure properly with the door sliding open all the time . Loosening the catch solved the problem which could permanently be remedied by planting an additional plate on top of the existing one. Seems the catch position in the glass door was wrongly constructed at the build stage. Additionally, a broken lamp was held together with a plastic strap which seemed very poor for a hotel of this quality. On our return journey we had a De Luxe room which was a much better proposition with views over the river and pool. Slightly larger than the standard room it proved to be adequate with space each side of the bed this time, but ....the bathroom door catch did not operate again. The absence of a lounge in the hotel , other than a few seats in the reception area, can be annoying as there is nowhere to sit and relax. Also, if you have a delayed flight and need to spend an hour or two waiting around there are only a few seats available. This is a busy hotel and the reception area can often be crowded with guests checking in and out. Having said that the hotel is well located for access to the river and there are numerous restaurants and Singapore's bustling waterside within reasonable walking distance. Breakfast was very good with a choice of typically English ingredients supplemented with some alternative local cuisine. A stay at the Shangri La a few years ago was a much better option in terms of room quality . amenities and restaurant quality, although at a higher cost. Would use again but would also check out alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: junior-twit
Reviews.Content: Great location five minutes walk along the river to Clarke Quay Unexpectedly good meal in the hotel itself Nice clean room

Reviews.Title: “we are very much enjoying our stay”
Reviews.Author: welcomepamela
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in the Club Rooms for the past three nights and have found it to our satisfaction. Evelyn who is in charge of the area at the time we commenced our stay has been extremely helpful. We would recommend friends who are staying at the Park Hotel to pay the extra fees involved and enjoy the club facilities provided. Rooms are small by European standards but well appointed and adequate for our needs. Although my husband would normally prefer a much larger room, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is pretty special”
Reviews.Author: Ludmax
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of a 6 week overseas trip, so we splashed out more than we usually would, but felt we got value for money ($SGD198). The room was large, beautiful bathroom, all amenities you could want. Free internet a bonus, beautiful pool. Added taxes and charges added a further $SGD30 to the account.

Reviews.Title: “It was beyond imagination”
Reviews.Author: Vishnukul
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very neat and clean.Reception staff were very cooperative.Room was comfortable but bathroom was small but wisely designed.Lobby staff were informative and very kind to senior citizens.Only one thing was not good,room service was very poor and not upto mark. Our overall stay was comfortable.One more thing I want to write,Location was excellent for us and also good enough for tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and hospitable staff make Park Hotel a winner”
Reviews.Author: Duncan_and_Marion
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights en route to Thailand. Arrived at 6 am and were immediately allowed an early check in. The attention of the staff was amazing. The room although a little on the small side was modern, well equipped and immaculately serviced. We enjoyed wholesome breakfasts with a wide choice. Easy walking distance to restaurants and bus stops and there was always a taxi available at the front entrance when we needed one. If we are fortunate enough to vivit this beautiful city again we wil be hapy to stayy at Park Hotel Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a very good location in lovely Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ALAN551993
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Park Hotel. Rooms very good and spacious. Breakfast was included which was very good but the restaurant was quite small and very busy at peak times. Very modern hotel in an excellent location on Clarke Quay which a very good swimming pool and friendly staff. Some nice points which you sometimes only find in more expensive hotels like very smart and efficient front of house staff and very good and very well equipped gym

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable 10 day stay”
Reviews.Author: Justo070
Reviews.Content: A 10 day stay that was made enjoyable by the Manager of the Crystal Club. All staff were courtious and helpful at all times and nothing presented a problem. The breakfast and nibbles, with drinks, in the evening were tasty and the service could not be bettered The view over Clarke Quay to the new resort was great and got better at night when the lights came on and the sun went down. I did not use the gym or massage service but had a long relaxing swim in the pool at night in water that was the right temperature. It is well placed being a 5 minute walk to Clarke Quay restaurants and MRT station, another 10 mintues to Boat Quay or 20 minutes to China Town. There is a free shuttle service that can drop you off at the MRT if you do not want the walk.

Reviews.Title: “One of the city's best”
Reviews.Author: boatie68
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Singapore many times and this is our favourite hotel. Only open about a year, it's a great position at Clarke Quay. There's a covered walkway from the hotel which brings you to the river and all the nightlife of Clarke Quay -including a great sate restaurant. The first time we stayed at the hotel we were given a non-smoking room which smelled so overpoweringly of smoke we couldn't stay in it. The staff were incredibly polite and helpful and gave us a far superior room with their apologies. The second time we arrived at the hotel at 6am after a long flight from Europe, and the staff accommodatingly found us a room by 8am. The hotel has a glorious swimming pool and serves great snacks and drinks from the pool bar. The rooms on both occasions were clean and with really comfortable beds - although the pillows were a bit hard- and a lovely shower with the biggest shower rose we have ever seen. You might pay a bit more to stay here, but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A safe choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: FoodEnthused
Reviews.Content: Our room and bathroom were both rather small but clean and functional. We found the room a bit dark, and leaving the curtains open meant the opposite building could look right into our room. We only wished that there could have been complimentary WiFi offered in the rooms, with it being squarely a business hotel. There is only free WiFi at the lobby, and that didn't provide us with much privacy. The location of this hotel is excellent, being a few minutes walk to hotspot Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FredToddMalone
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the club floor with access to the club lounge, however the quality of service was no different anywhere within the hotel. Club lounge is well appointed and has great views toward the CBD and Clarke Quay. Location is great for wandering around in a spare moment if you're staying on business with Clarke quay and chinatown also handy but cabs are relatively inexpensive in Singapore anyway plus the MRT is nearby so getting around is no problem. Great pool. Only slight negative is the room size but on balance it's not a real problem given the rest of the facilities on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: qwert_1
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be quite new, is clean and in very good condition. It is in a perfect location nearby restaurants , bars and so forth. The hotel is quipped with a big swimming pool and a nice spa area. The rooms are quite small. Even I was upgraded to the so called "Crystal Club", the rooms seem to be same size than a normal rooms, however the upgrade offered private check in/out, free internet access, free soft drinks and small snacks throughout the day. Anyway, this hotel is just perfect for a short stay or a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “The doormen are so very helpful - they'll help you get all your shopping out of the taxi ..”
Reviews.Author: Maree_Auckland_1051
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. Our room was very attractive although a little on the small side. The view from our room was pretty impressive. The bathroom was lovely - beautifully appointed. We enjoyed the pool and gym facilities of this hotel and we treated ourselves to a foot massage by the pool - very relaxing indeed. I'm not sure how good the location was because we used taxis to get around as they were pretty cheap. The staff were very friendly and efficient. The doormen were the big stand-outs though - they were super friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with pool”
Reviews.Author: lindsand
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here- nice room and bathrroom. The pool was much appreciated after a long flight. Clarke Quay is way over-priced but there seemed to be better lunch options along the river in the opposite direction (River Walk) or just go to Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Pony_Up
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hotel for three nights on a recent business trip with colleagues. This was my first visit to Singapore and I was completely impressed with the country. The Park Hotel fully met and exceeded many of my expectations. Located in Clarke Quay, it is easy walking distance to many new restaurants and shopping venues. The staff was friendly and welcoming. I was fortunate enough to have booked a room on the upper two floors (Club Level). This allowed me access to the 10th floor lounge for morning breakfast and evening cocktails / hors d'oeuvres. The only negative during my stay was the first morning when I tried using the lobby restaurant for breakfast (included in room rate). The atmosphere and clientele were complete chaos. After waiting to be seated by the hostess, I had to be reseated three different times because everytime I got up to get something from the buffet, another "guest" took my seat. It was extremely crowded and the staff tried to help keep my table, but I guess that the social norms of other patrons is different than I am used to. After that experience, I used the Club Lounge on the 10th floor and was able to have a leisurely and civil breakfast (also included in room rate). The evening happy hours were also very relaxing and welcome at the end of the day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore, especially on business. It is not a resort, but a very new, clean and capable facility in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore is at your finger tips from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: worksopwench
Reviews.Content: very nice clean hotel, nice pool/gym/bar, along side of river,good for getting anywhere in the city. plenty of bars restaurants and shops 360' from hotel. don't take room on floor 4 if your not a smoker try brussel sprout bar turn right along river ..... dozens of beers to choose from hic'

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice but overpriced, no service and TINY rooms”
Reviews.Author: kbisok
Reviews.Content: Hi, the hotel looks great from the outside, since it's failry new. But the rooms are tiny, really tiy, no place for a suitcase! Not even in the closet, we had 2 suitcase and ended up moving all the furniture in a corner and putting the suitcases on the ground but we then could bearly move around the room. Room itselve was well appointed but small. Service wasn't what i suspected since this was the priciest hotel we had on our 3 week trip. No friendly smile, no nothing. No help, no service at all. Breakfast was a joke, they didn't have enough room to seat people, you had to stand in line each and every day. Once inside you had to say a prayer to be able to get a glass for some juice because these were not availabl each and every day. When clean glasses were brought in people ran to juice machine and most wouldn't have a chance at getting a clean glass. Service was once again rude. Asking for directions didn't work you were just shuvved in a taxi altough it was only a 10 minute walk. We walked to the main shopping road (the one with 30 malls !!!) every day in about 10 to 15 minutes. If you want to be in the middle of things, this is a bit out of the way. Would i recommand this hotel, not for the price, service and rooms we got ! No free internet btw.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good all round value.”
Reviews.Author: robbyroo
Reviews.Content: Arrived 7am expecting to have to wait until the afternoon for our room but by 8.30am we were in and settled. Nice clean room with good views over the pool although a little small but hey you are only sleeping in it. Easy walk to Clarke Quay and the MRT and in fact short walk to most places. Poolside bar service was a little slow if not non exsistant some days but small detail. Restaurant looked nice but with so many places in Sing to eat (and cheaper) we did not use it. Great 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exelent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: oistein_dahlslett
Reviews.Content: I have been using Park hotel at CQ since April 2010, total number of nigh is about 78 nights. The location of the hotel is excellent whether you are in Singapore for work or holiday.i have been staying on the club floor on 9th and 10th floor, the 10th floor is the best. either way, Evelyn and her staff on the club floors are doing their out most to make your stay a memorable one, and I cannot praise them enough. There is always a smile and a friendly, " good morning" or a "how are you today" and it is truly appreciated. I hope that Evelyn, the club floor manager, and her staff enjoys the moon cake that I gave them as an appreciation for their service when I left Singapore in the month of the hungry ghost. VBRGDS Oistein and Nina - of Norway

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but so-so restaurant service”
Reviews.Author: lalachoa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new and had been open only since 2009 so the rooms still look fine though look a little small. But it's alright since I was traveling alone and won't meet up with my sisters until the last day. The hotel was 10 floors high and the reception people were accommodating in giving me a 7th floor room with a view. It turns out the hotel is a 10 min walk to the nearest MRT station. Luckily, the hotel offers a shuttle with certain stops including the nearest station. The shuttle driver was friendly and almost always smiling. The only restaurant serving breakfast the next morning was overflowing by 930am. It also meant that another person was seated at my table. Irene from Australia was lovely though I was looking forward to a quiet morning meal. The restaurant has three people laying down placemats/utensils as well as doubling as bussing tables. Another one was assigning the tables. There are another two or three "managers" who stand around and not much help. They don't even know cream for coffee. Glasses for the juices evaporate faster than water in the desert. Empty food trays at the buffet line is not refilled even after 15 mins. Considering the limited variety i expected better. With full occupancy, the hotel should have more resources assigned instead of allowing guests to make do with whatever they serve. Internet connection in the rooms were extra charge. It was a little expensive. What is objectionable is the slow speed. I mean the internet speed at home is faster and the fees I pay per day is what I pay for in a month!

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy hotel away from the hustle and bustle of the city limits”
Reviews.Author: Daylen1083
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel Clarke Quay is nicely located away from the busy city limits, coupled with the fantastic view from the Crystal Lounge, its a wonderful way to spend the weekends. It is within walking distance to some of the water drinking holes in clarke quay as well. Team has been very attentive to all needs in all parts of the hotel, warm serviceis being given be it to a local or to internationial guests. Highly recommended to peopole from around the world to give it a try, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Really well looked after”
Reviews.Author: Ilovewarthogs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant location just a short and very pleasant walk along the river bank to the many bars and restaurants in Clarke Quay. We were so pleased that we decided to stay here and not where we were originally considering on Orchard road as it is quite chaoic. Clarke Quay is d back with a fantastic atmosphere. The hotel matches the standards of the rest of Singapore- immaculate! Although the rooms are small with a regular sized double bed, they are very nicely furnished with a great shower and nice views over either river or pool! We decided to upgrade to a club room at an extra cost because of recommendations from other reviews and it was well worth it. The club room staff provide an excellent service and are so friendly and helpful. I would recommend anybody to upgrade if you can and enjoy the food and drink in the relaxed atmosphere of the club room. The pool area is lovely and a nice place to escape the heat late afternoon. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and although the rates are quite expensive, we felt it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “great start to our european holiday”
Reviews.Author: jamaleSingapore
Reviews.Content: we really loved the hotel the staff made it so enjoyable everyone from the cleaner to the concierge. We greatly appreciated being allowed to use facilities after we had officially booked out. As our flight was very late it was wonderful to be able to use hotel facilities until our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location-tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: JohnsiesonHol
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights as we were in Singapore for the Youth Olympics. The room was very clean and had a nice view over the pool area and part of Clarke Quay. Although it is called Park Hotel Clarke Quay, it is not truly in Clarke Quay so be prepared to walk, pay for cabs etc. The room was very small. Although there were only two of us, we couldn't spend time in the room unless sleeping/laying on the bed. The pool is lovely, and really worthwhile after a sticky day exploring. The staff were efficient and friendly, howver when family members rang from Australia to speak to us, they had entered our names incorrectly on the data base and staff refused to put family through because they had the wrong name! All in all it was a good, clean base, however we would have liked a bit more room, considering we were paying full rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mmckmwb
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel jan 2010 on our way to phuket. great location next to clarke quay no need for taxis just a 5 min stroll to all the restaurants at the quay. The room we had was on the small side but did us just fine.Breakfast had lots of choice. great location

Reviews.Title: “Location...and that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: nickel_travels
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very convenient - 5 min walk to Clarke Quay, lots of quality restaurants just outside the front door and a handful of shops just around the corner. But that is where the five stars end. The staff and service was pretty good, but I wouldn't necessarily give them a 5 star rating. They did immediately switch my room because I had asked for a view of the river and that is not what I was assigned at first. There was also a gentleman who worked the lobby downstairs a couple of nights who was extremely curteous and helpful, but that didn't extend to everyone on staff - most of their niceties seemed a little forced. Also a part of our package was daily laundry service - that was a bonus. The rooms and bathrooms were tiny (no bathtub!) and the bed was uncomfortable. I didn't spend a lot of time in my room - but this was NOT the definition of luxury...and certainly not the luxury price I was paying. There was no electrical outlet in the bathroom so I had to dry my hair with a non-ergonomic hair dryer out at the desk with an extremely short cord. There is no iron/board in the room, so you have to call down for one. There is only broadband internet, so you also have to plug your computer in to connect to the internet. The closet is also tiny and my 15" laptop would not fit into the room safe. We even had club access but it still didn't make up for some of the shortcomings. All in all, it was not a totally bad experience. I will admit that I am in fact completely biased because last year I had such a fabulous stay at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore. Nothing could have really lived up to the Mandarin Oriental - so I would recommend staying there if you can. But if you are just looking for an [expensive] crash pad, the Park Hotel Clarke Quay will suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Room, shame about the Internet ..”
Reviews.Author: jlburong
Reviews.Content: Travelling with 10 year old son. Pool view room was excellent and the frosted bathroom door wasn't a shock after our KL hotel !! The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. We didn't order food or drinks in the hotel but stocked up from the Cold Storage opposite the hotel. (Remember if travelling from Malaysia to Singapore you can't buy duty free - inter country agreement). The pool was great - all one depth - and the spa had very nice strong jets. Lobby is rather small and cluttered with left luggage and an "internet lounge"- 2 desktops in a corner. Disappointment was the wifi access which was limited to the lobby (it worked in our 3rd floor room as well as long as we didn't power down before returning to room). Wifi was only accessible if a staff member typed in a password. Bit of an archaic method and could do with improving. Would love to stay here again. Walking distance to Clarke Quay MRT is 5 minutes although quite pricey to eat and drink there. Try Boat Quay - the restaurants are competing with each other and will offer discounts and free drinks. Don't be afraid to walk away. (For Wifi access in Macdonalds around Singapore etc apparently you have to register at Changi airport - I had difficulty doing this with * Australia * 3 mobile network but my Optus Sim automatically picked up Singtel and received a password.)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, modern and clean. Wonderful, friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Ambie7
Reviews.Content: We totally loved the rooms! They're tastefully furnished in modern/contemporary style. Plus, the hotel is practically new so everything really looks and feels clean. Since we were travelling with our 3-yr old, we were very particular about cleanliness and the hotel really delivers on that. Very helpful and friendly staff as well. Cons would be 1) room is pretty small so the luggages take up most of the floor leaving a very tight line for you to walk . But then again, we were just so happy about the beauty of the interiors that we didn't really care! 2) more than a 5-minute walk to the MRT, although the bus station is just right around the corner. This really is a gorgeous hotel and our only reservations for staying here again would be the location. But if you don't mind the walk (it's a scenic route anyway from Clarke Quay), then this hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel i Would Recommend to All”
Reviews.Author: watto16
Reviews.Content: My partner and i first arrived at the hotel at around 6am in the morning with a club room booked. due to the whole hotel being booked for that night they were unable to give us a room for a couple of hours until ours was ready. the staff were very helpful and stated that our room would be ready around 9 and to wait in the lobby. Once we obtained our room it was unbelievable with modern fixtures in a good sized room. Then the club lounge with the extra perks which you get with the club room including buffet breakfast, afternoon tea and also evening drinks which were very good. the staff in this lounge were always helpful and prompt with offering service. The pool area is great, also having a day spa at the hotel was also helpful and have great massages which come at a discounted rate when you stay in a club room. overall the location is great just a short stroll to the nightlife of clark quay and also a short taxi ride to Orchard road and also china town and many more places. the only negatives i have with the hotel was the shower would just change in heat now and then and would almost burn you and also the food didnt have much variety everyday which would have been nice but overall the staff and the hotel are great and i recomend it to any traveler who is visiting singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Ashley1969
