Reviews.Content: First impression was good being a fairly new hotel. Not a lot of space in reception, which was the same for the rooms. Quite small compared to many other hotels, (perhaps its the same with all others in Singapore?). No facility for ice in fridge & strange frosted glass door to bathroom. Poor view if you are on the 'other side' of the hotel compared to the photos on their website. Try to ask for a pool side room. Most annoying was the glass top on the study table, which jutts out next to the bed & you have to be very careful not to injure yourself (found out the hard way!) Hotel staff helpful & friendly. Convenient shutte to city and Orchard Rd areas. Five min walk next to the river to Clarke Quay for many restaurants to choose from. Hotel a bit pricy for the room size, but otherwise very good. Go to Singapore Tourism Centre before booking any tours, we found the "Hop on, Hop off" one to be the best value for a complete city sights tour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service and Hotel Travel Facilities to get around Singapore”
Reviews.Author: debpaul1
Reviews.Content: The customer sevrice level from all staff is of a very high standard and all staff were accomodating to our needs. There is a free shuttle service to the main parts of town which is great.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Guenniderliebe
Reviews.Content: brand new Hotel in Singapore.in the middle of the city , very convinient to reach everything by walking distance. room are comfortable , in the right size ( not as big as usually in asia , but fair ). very clean and ( of course ) all brand new ! reception friendly and efficient. smoking floor avaiable ( outstanding in SIN !!!! ) location really in the middle of everything, walking distance to tons of restaurants and pubs. central , but quiet. even to business areas max ( by Taxi ) SIN $ 5,00 rates are relativly low and including breakfast - and thats the only point. get ready for waiting time , in case you want to have the breakfast , the restaurant is not made for the number of guests and the service needs still some education. over all , a very good alternative to the exsisting big hotels in this city

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sdludlow
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here on a stopover from Europe. We arrived after a long flight and were delighted to be given an upgrade. The staff were fabulous, so friendly and helpful and polite. The room was on the 10th floor and very nice. Really comfy bed although the pillows were too thick and hard but we got used to that. The decor was beautiful and the bathroom lovely with an excellent shower. We had a great view over Clarke Quay. The room was very quiet and cozy. We also had free wifi in our room. I'm not sure if they all do, or if it's just he rooms on the 10th floor that get that, but they have free wifi in the lobby as well. The location was great, we were able to walk everywhere we needed to and it's close to the metro for longer distances. The breakfast was excellent. the pool was gorgeous and I also had a poolside spa treatment which was very relaxing and not too badly priced for a hotel based spa. Overall we had a great stay and strongly recommend this hotel to others. It's only 1 year old and is lovely, clean and modern. The staff were the friendliest of all the hotels we stayed in for our 2 month holiday, I can't speak highly enough of them. I have noticed other reviews have mentioned rude staff, so maybe they have been told to pick up their act, but we really were impressed with the staff's professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: HeinB4
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at Park Hotel twice and my experience was the same on both occassions. Poor Service. The hotel is a relatively new development in a great location. Rooms are small but well appointed. It appears that the hotel caters for large tour groups and is not really interested in small business groups or individual travellers. I would not recommend this hotel unless you are part of a tour group and can live with mediocre service

Reviews.Title: “Good Location..Service needs improvement...”
Reviews.Author: inspectors001
Reviews.Content: The second part of our honeymoon we arrived in Singapore, we chose to stay at the Park Hotel near which has been recommended by our travel agent back home, the hotel is centerally located, a quick 5 minutes walk to Clark Quay...convenient especially for nightlife and restaurants, we suggest that you try local food courts for lunch instead of Clarke Quay which are frequented by locals, great inter-action experience and are value for money. Near 2 MRT Stations. We were collected from the airport by luxury car, arranged with the hotel. When we arrived after 2pm (normal check-in time), we waited for our room, Our hotel voucher confirmed that we had booked a Superior River facing room with King bed, however when we arrived the hotel only had Superior City facing room available and all the River Facing rooms which were available had two single beds, something you definately dont want on honeymoon. So we opted for the City View to have a King Size bed. Reception informed us that a River Facing King room would be available the following day if we so wished to room swap. This was disappointing since we had pre-booked the room in advance with our specifications requested and not fulfilled as we expected started our experience off to a poor start. We were escorted by Patrick the doorman, friendly staff member and worth recognition. Our Room key flashed red several times, coming from the hotel industry this either means that the key had not been programmed correctly or the key lock would have malfunctioned, the poor doorman had to go back and forth to reception to change the key, after a few minutes of frustration and two employees attending to the problem later the key had finally worked and the green light appearred, hooraaahh. Walking down a little corridor and an immediate glass sliding door *entrance to the small bathroom* we found our double bed (not king as requested) which over-looked the city, grey office buildings and roofs to municipal city buildings was a definate change from a view on a tropical island which was our first leg of our honeymoon. The room was small and cramped, Was this in fact a Superior King Room which we had requested? At this point we headed off to experience the nightlife of Singapore and decided to deal with Reception in the morning and swop rooms. The following morning we headed out for breakfast and requested that our luggage be transfered to the next room. When we arrived back from our bustling day shopping in Singapore, we collected our keys and entered a bigger and brighter room now this was more like it. Our room had a beautiful view of the pool and Riverside Shopping Complex. Much better and closer to that which we had requested in the first place. The room is comfortable, good quality beds and linens, quality amenities. Mini-bar is a bit steep, worth considering when there are 24 hour 7 eleven stores at Clark Quay, Would recommend that a blind be installed to hide-off the lavatory thus making it more convenient when more than one occupies the room. We missed our first wake-up call when requested from a lady at Reception the night before. Thus missing a tour we had scheduled that morning causing us to rearrange our planned activities. After bringing this matter to the attention of Reception, followed after were personalised wake-up calls and delivery of daily newspaper. This added a nice touch to the rest of our stay. We would highly recommend the Room service, good food quality and prompt service. Good selection of evening meals available. The pool area was well maintained, pool bar was under renovations, would have been nice to experience that. The day before our departure we were let down by a hotel tour group, over-took the entire lobby area making it difficult for other guests to access lifts and breakfast area, groups should be allocated a seperate dining venue not to scare off couples and business travellers when wanted to have a quiet breakfast area. We had checked out at an awkward time 2am in the morning to be exact, we had arranged with the hotel to store our luggage and shop until our transfer collected us from the airport, we planned to arrive at the airport at 22h30, originally our transfer was requested for 22h30 so we liaised with front desk to shift our transfer to 22h00 30 minutes earlier, the gentleman at Reception somehow confused 10 & 8 o'clock and booked the transfer for 8pm. We arrived back from Orchard Road at 10pm road to a dissapointed taxi driver and an overcharge to our hotel account for delaying the driver, even despite our efforts to mention that we had booked it for 10 and not 8 reception refused to waiver the fee. We paid it later on and because we had already been late thought we would lay all our complaints and compliments when getting back home. Has potential to be an all rounded hotel with enough rooms to accommodate all kinds of travellers from leisure to corporates to groups, operations needs to be fine tuned here but achievable. Great location again and will recommend the hotel on this merit despite certain unfortunate experiences at the Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Kiwidreamer
Reviews.Content: As a stopover option, this hotel suited us just fine. It is a bit of a walk to some of the attractions but there are a myriad of dining options very close by and the SIA hop on hop off city bus stops a short 2 minute walk away plus the hotel shuttle bus is useful for some destinations. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful and we were even given access to a room for a shower in the evening of our last day before heading to the airport as they weren't able to give us late check out due to being fully booked - half an hour, no charge. We were delighted with this and it really sealed for us how good this hotel was. The pool was a godsend as it was very hot and muggy there in May - note there is a spa pool tucked away in a corner of the pool area that we didn't discover until our last day. Our room was rather different with a glass wall separating the bed and bathroom - yes you could watch your beloved on the toilet or in the shower if you so desired. A novelty feature that we were able to live with for 2 nights but not sure how a week of it would have gone down. It did make the room feel more spacious and had a great view over the pool to make up for it. The room we were given for the shower did not have a glass wall so clearly you could request one of these if you wanted to. Highly recommend the Japanese BBQ restaurant across the road where you cook your own meat on an individual BBQ at your table - delicious. Many other dining options in the area at both Robertson Quay just behind the hotel and Clarke Quay just across the bridge from the hotel. Both these areas were buzzing at night, very atmospheric by the river.

Reviews.Title: “strange bathroom”
Reviews.Author: shorad
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights as you can imagine all very clean, We were in room 641 which on entering you walk round a corner with the bathroom on the left. This had a frosted door. you then continue into the bedroom and when you turn back you see that the wall to the bathroom is made of CLEAR GLASS. You can see everything. Had a fantastic shower room then beyond that the toilet and then the sink area but you saw it all, very strange. Maybe not for couples just starting a relationship. Great views from the window of the pool and beyond. If your into shopping or food then this is the place for you. The malls don't get going until mid afternoon and evenings. Like China Town that does not get going until the evening. The food from the stalls in Food Street are cheap and if you find the small shopping centre at one end do go upstairs into the food hall which the locals use. Again great food and cheap. Thought we would go to Raffles for lunch got dressed up but when we arrived people were walking round in shorts and flip flops. I guess you would be allowed in some of the restaurants dressed like that. We decide to go to the long bar where you can sit and eat peanuts throwing the shells on the floor. We had a Coke and a Beer which cost around 30 Singapore Dollars ouch. The pool was really lovely and is the same depth in all parts. Plenty of towels and comfortable beds. A word of advise you cannot flag down a taxi before 10pm you need to find a taxi rank or hotel to get one. We tried for ages not realising.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, clean, nice view over Clarke Quay, good pool”
Reviews.Author: overseaslara
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for 3 nights in May 2010. We had a very comfortable stay and really couldn't fault anything about the hotel for the price and great location. The location was absolutely fantastic - a short flat stroll into Clarke Quay (5 mins) for meals or to the MRT. We even walked into Chinatown on 2 nights which took about 20 minutes. The check-in process was smooth and quick. Rooms fresh and clean, not enormous but not what I would call small either. We were on the fourth floor overlooking the pool area - the view out our window to the river and towards Clarke Quay was very nice. The hotel was quiet, good housekeeping and toiletries, elevators fast and good cold air-conditioning which is essential in Singapore. We had a flat-screen TV and plenty of power outlets to charge our phones, camera etc. We didn't eat in the hotel because we were basically just sleeping there (our main aim was to be out and about seeing the sights as much as possible) but the restaurant on the ground floor had a very modern fit-out. Didn't use the gym but it had very modern machines. We swam in the pool on a few occasions and the atmosphere around the pool was relaxed and the service for drinks around the pool very prompt. Our favourite part of our room was the shower head which was an enormous "rain shower" head that was fantastic after an 8 hour flight to Singapore. There was a restaurant on the river just 50 metres as you step out the front door. The concierge service was very helpful in helping us find a taxi that would accommodate a surfboard bag. I can't fault this hotel at all and will stay there again next time I go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel and good location, but rooms are a little small.”
Reviews.Author: BostonHoopsfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and service was adequate, but the rooms are a little small. The location is good, since it's only a short walk to the restaurants and bars in Clarke Quay along the river.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Tahmu1
Reviews.Content: My family and I arrived on 31 May and were impressed by the exterior looks of the hotel. However, looks can be deceiving. The main lobby reeked of perfume/cologne. I thought it was a passing thing (some people like to wear excessive smelly stuff), however, it seems they (hotel) continued to pump this rank and awful odor through the lobby to either mask the smell of its guest or they (hotel) thought it might be a pleasing scent to its clientele. Anyone allergic to perfumes should stay away from this hotel. My sister and I checked into the room which I think was on the 7th floor. It was small. There was no place to put your luggage (except on the floor against the windows) and I was not happy. There were two single beds which pretty much took up the entire room. Clean room, but oh so small. Claustrophobia comes to mind. We then upgraded to a suite on the 10th floor for a surcharge of a 188SGD plus the relevant room service charge of 10% and GST of 7%. The suites were decent with two attached rooms. One queen bed (may have been king) in one room, pull out bed in the other room. However, there was no alarm clock in either of the rooms nor were there electrical outlets in either of the bathrooms. I could not believe it. Basic amenities missing. I had to hook up my electrical razor and hair dryer in my room, not in the bathroom the way it should be. There was no gift shop and the restaurant/bar were small and located right next to the main lobby, with the rank odor of the cologne/perfume permeating the area. The ladies on the 10th floor taking care of the clientele staying in the suites were exceptionally helpful and afternoon "happy hour" and breakfast were pleasant. The hotel is in an ideal location but a headache for cab drivers and other transportation. Taxi drvers must pull in, turn around and face the way they come in. There is no through thoroughfare. In summation, the regular rooms are extremely small and the foul smell in the lobby was a total turnoff to me. I would never consider staying at this this hotel again and nor could I recommend this place. I found it to be an odd hotel with a strange layout and I am positive that there are many other hotels in the area that are probably a much better value and provide a more "guest" friendly experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: leeson28
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Singapore many times and this is possibly the worst hotel we have ever stayed in, we booked a room on the club floors, normally these rooms are a bit better than the rest, this is not so, the room was nasty, small, badly furnished, the bathroom you could hardly move in and the bedding looked dirty. I spoke to the girls on the check in for the club floors and frankly they did not give a dam, eventually the club room Manager was called and I explained that I was not happy with the room, and would prefer not to stay there for the four nights we had booked and we were going back to one of the other hotels that we had used before, she then upgraded us to a suite which was magnificent but can you imagine the cost of it. The breakfast in the club floor dining area was average to say the least, and don't bother with the afternoon tea on the club floor, it was awful. The level of service at the hotel was not up to standard, and the concierge and people at the front desk were unhelpful and rude. I would not even consider staying at this hotel again, instead try to go a little higher in price and stay at the Pan Pacific or the Marina Mandarin, they are lovely hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend greataway”
Reviews.Author: Sockie_SGP
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a weekend getaway with my hubby and we have a very pleasant experience. The hotel is about 1 year old and I wasn't even aware of the existence of this hotel until I received a joint promotion leaflet from a local telco to stay at this hotel at a bargain price of $189 nett. It was all worth it. We stayed in a superior room. The room and bathroom are very clean. The rooms are slightly small and probably that is why this hotel does not have King bed for its Deluxe and Superior rooms. However, we are happy with the very comfortable Queen bed and pillows. There is also a large flat screen TV mounted to the wall. The hotel is not exactly near to Clarke Quay MRT station but it is within walking distance of about 10 minutes. A shuttle bus brings you to Clarke Quay MRT station and also right into the heart of Orchard road (drop off point at Paragon shopping centre). The hotel is located at a stone throw away from Singapore's most vibrant nightlife strip, Clarke Quay. The hotel has a spa, small gym and a large swimming pool. The swimming pool has an adjoining jaccuzi pool. Buffet breakfast was good and you have a large variety to choose from. The website of the states that charges would apply for late check out. So do remember to ask for complimentary late check out to avoid charges.

Reviews.Title: “Its how much you pay for, totally worthed!”
Reviews.Author: sumiko1485
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore for a 3 night vacation to meet up with my friends. i got the reviews from tripadvisor too.. as soon as i entered the room.. first impression: 1. clean 2. new 3. urban style.. i have to say the room is a bit small for two people but other wise, the place is great! the furnitures are new, the interior are chic and modern, the bathroom layout is good. and the bed is comfortable. i have recommended my friends to stay there, and they enjoyed it too. the staff were friendly and warm... i would definitely go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: MCsquared777
Reviews.Content: The service I received was prompt & efficient. The room is a tad bit on the small side (so don't bring along a big suitcase as the space in the cupboard is insufficient) otherwise it is perfect, another description, COZY. The rooms are clean. I would suggest the Club Room to make use of the Club facilities and DO ASK for a non-smoking room if you are a non-smoker. The location is perfect : 5-10min to Clark Quay and MRT and there is a complimentary shuttle service to various other amenities. I will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wibisono
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in this hotel in Mid May 2010 for 3 nights. I Stayed in Superior Double room and I Felt so comfortable in this hotel. I ordered the room in No Smoking Floor. The hotel so clean n service from the receptionist was good enough… (sadly with no smile in their face…. ) The bed and the shower was so good. The room internet access is chargeable Taxi order was so easy and the front man always ready to get us a cab. We can reach this hotel from the nearest MRT Station (Clarke Quay) for approximately 15 minutes by foot. And we can enjoy the river view along our way to the hotel. To get a breakfast in the morning you can walk across the street to the UE Mall and you can find delifrance coffeshop in there. The’re already open in 7AM. I will be back to this hotel someday. but, please give the guest your smile... :p

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good hotel for short city break”
Reviews.Author: Mr. MJB
Reviews.Content: This is a well positioned hotel although it is not actually in Clarke Quay and requires a short walk of just less than 10 minutes to get to the very pleasant nightlife and restaurants at the Quay . This is not necessarily a bad thing as it means that it is in a quieter location at night but the down side is that taxi drivers still do not know where this hotel is - one we had to guide there ourselves, two took us first to The Novatel, which is in Clarke Quay, for us to direct them further and one succeeded first attempt! The hotel itself is a fairly anonymous but pleasant experience. Would appear to have been designed for short stay or business guests as the rooms are fairly small and have limited storage space (imagine Holiday Inn Express in UK but better service) Staff efficient and the rooms well kept. Shuttle bus facility to down town (Orchard Road area) is free and efficient although actual stop off points are a little inconvenient due to the need to find an off road place to park but a small issue. Taxis are cheap in Singapore. Recommend a morning in Botanical Gardens and afternoon tea in Raffles ( not the ulrta posh and expensive but the tea rooms on the corner at street level). Also recommend having dinner in Raffles in the Tiffin Room - service superb with Chinese/Indian influenced buffet. Warning beware of the price of drinks - Singapore Sling equiv £15 and bottle of Pellegrino water equiv £6!

Reviews.Title: “"A pity"”
Reviews.Author: jlarc
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel has a lot of potential as a 4 star hotel in a good location. Being new, the hotel is clean and many of the facilties (pool, hallway, elevators and entrance) are still in pristine condition. The location is good as it is near to Clarke Quay and the subway (or MRT) is about 15 min away (walk along the river bank for a scenic route). WE did not have a bed and breakfast option but we found a really nice cafe (Venus Cafe) in the mall opposite the hotel where they serve really fresh local dishes for breakfast and lunch (their nasi lemak is great for lunch and breakfast of gaya toast and fried Bee Hoon (noodles) is delicious!) The owners, Venus and her family are really friendly and we alawys look forward to our meals there. The hotel just started a shuttle service which leaves almost every hour for Clarke Quay MRT, Grand Park hotel City Hall, Orchard Road and a few other locations. The looped service is really helpful when you don't feel like walking in the heat. The pool is also nice as it is not crowded and opens till 11pm at night. Go for a swim at 9pm and you will probaly have the pool to yourselves. This is where the positives end. Even with all the good features, we would not return to this hotel for the price we paid. The reason is simple. Rooms are very tiny and as a couple, we could hardly find room to store our luggage. In fact, my wife felt so claustrophobic one night that she had to get out of the room for a walk. For the price we paid (Cdn $140 per night -we stayed 10 nights), we probably could find a much better hotel in the city. The room had no Iron or even an alarm clock. The lobby was also very small and you would be lucky if you can find a seat in the "lounge" which has about 4 or 5 chairs. Overall, a smart hotel but it feels cramped - Ok if you are on a one day buisness trip but not the hotel you want if you are staying longer on a vacation - a pity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to the nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: DeniseSwales
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the earlie hours as we had flown over night from the Maldives but the hotel were very accommodating in finding us a room although on the smoking floor (we do not partake in smoking) but it was very welcome to recover from the long flight. The hotel was ideally located with plenty of restaurants and bars close by not only on Clark Quay but Robertsons Quay also. The taxis are very cheap to use but Orchard Road was a 30 minute walk away taking it slowly. Everything was spotless in the hotel and the cleaners were always out in force. One little quirky thing was our bathroom was glass walled so while sitting watching TV or just reading on your bed you could see the loo and showering going on.. !! very strange. Very nice breakfast but a bit of a free for all and there were never enough tables people had to wait or sit outside. We got a special rate from the hotel when booking two nights the third night was 50% off but when we came to settle the bill we were charged the full rate for all three nights so check your bill and keep a copy of your confirmation e-mail with the rate on it to hand it took a lot of explaining to the receptionist. All in all a very nice stay for a total of £232.00 B&B for the three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Tikkamama
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is OK. Service bad & need improvement. We asked for aroom with bathtub 3 weeks beforedeparture & still not got one upon arrival. Seems our request not being handled well. We've got a room changed the other day but in the smoking floor. Hv they considered we travelled with kids & need a SMOKING room???. They should at least ask us whether we accept changing room to a smoking floor???!! No one seems to work professionally! Location is OK by 10mins walk to Clarke Quay. Swimming Pool is very good & big.

Reviews.Title: “The staff over shadows the other positives”
Reviews.Author: Sabby_delhi
Reviews.Content: The service offered by the reception staff at the first go makes u feel unwelcome in the hotel. though it was a pre-arranged booking so i had no option but to stay. Travelling with my wife and a 2 yr old kid, i was offered a queen size bed which was definitely not comfortable for both us adults. Other services offered at the restaurant and other staff was pretty okay...something akin to the traditions of a good deluxe hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location for nite life”
Reviews.Author: maleekataher
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean,modern and a good size for a few nite's break. Pool is large and very clean. Unlike some review's we had no problem with noise. Good choice of food at breakfast. Situated in the lively Clarke Quay area close to bar's,restaurants and nite club's.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Interior hotel”
Reviews.Author: hellohihowareyou
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Park Hotel Clark Quay on the eve of new year 2010 with my family to relax and rejuvenate..Its a perfect location, near to S'pore River and the Singapore Clark Quay Bungy G-Max.. Some of the room is quite small but its super clean and comfortable to stay in..The room has a stylish design and well kept..they have a nice pool and jacuzzi as well..It has a good view at night..Good experience.. : )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! The Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gemstar39
Reviews.Content: Our five night stay was spot on. Smiling friendly staff from arrivung to leaving, a comfy bed in a stylish, quiet room, good, varied breakfast dishes, the lady chef who cooked the eggs is the best, lunch and evening dinner is better than some of the local restaurants, the pool with its spa facility is the ideal place to relax after sightseeing. Positioned ideally to walk around Singapore, 15mins walk and China town with its markets and shops and 3 dollar lunches, try the portugese egg tarts, delicious. Walk out of the hotel turn left and a short stroll by the river leads to the nightlife. and a multitude of restaurants.The down side are the Brits who want to wear beach shorts and vests in the restaurant when the hotel requests smart casual clothes..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ROLLTRIPER
Reviews.Content: Ideal location in the middle of the animated quay, boat trip, not far from museum and raffles. Bar service very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to be "bumped"”
Reviews.Author: alamoScotland
Reviews.Content: On our way to New Zealand on Sunday 21st February, we stopped overnight at the Park Hotel, Clarke Quay. This booking along with another booking for Monday 8th March had been made in the UK in June 2009. The first night ( Sunday 21st February ) was absolutely perfect, and we took the short stroll to Clarke Quay for a meal. We were anticipating doing the same thing on our return on Monday 8th March. However when we returned to the hotel on Monday 8th March at about 19.00, the duty manager approached me with some story about the hotel being full and that there wasn’t a room for us (despite it having been booked since June 2009 ). He arranged transport for us to take us to the Rendezvous Hotel, and arranged a complimentary breakfast for us the following morning. By the time we got to the Rendezvous and settled in, it was about 21.00. We were exhausted after a long journey from New Zealand and as we had to leave the next morning at 9.20, and also because it was now too late for us to stroll to Clarke Quay, ( because of the distance involved ) we would have had to get a taxi ( which we would have probably had to pay for ourselves) .. So thank you ,Park Hotel , for ruining our last few hours in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JonQ
Reviews.Content: What an excellent place to stay, all the staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms well appointed and clean, my room had an excellent view over the river to Clarke Quay. Free internet which is something hotels in the UK should take note of. Only a couple of very small points; the TV picture was quite bad which bearing mind that each room has a wonderful big flat screen in seems daft, and breakfast is a little bit manic in the sense that there doesn't appear to be enough tables particularly at busy times. The hotel is within walking distance of the very vibrant Clarke Quay which is on the river and has a large amount of restaurants and bars. If you can stand the walk in the heat only about a mile and a bit from the Singapore Flyer which is worth a go. I went running in the evening along both sides which is very pleasant and makes a very nice walk. The Botanic Gardens are also worth a wander around. Both the gym and the pool are good and relatively quiet although that may have been as I was using them after the end of the day. There is a bar service at the pool if you can catch a waiter. I'd certainly stay again for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Ashuj
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior room and stayed on fourth floor which is a smoking floor. We got this room even after asking for non-smoking room as non-smoking rooms were occupied when we checked in at evening. However, the room was smoke free while the smell of smoke was prominent in the passage. There is no bath tub in the room and no free drinking water. The room is modern and we loved our stay in this hotel. This hotel is 5 mins walk from Clarke Quay which has many dining options and popular night spot in Singapore. Please ask Hotel reception for short cut to this place. Swimming pool is gorgeous. Overall, I recommend this hotel for singles or couples and it offers good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ringy67
Reviews.Content: The staff were all very helpful, couteous and friendly. The prices for non-icluded serices and drinks were very expensive

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay. Service was excellant in all areas, very friendly staff and very curtious.”
Reviews.Author: Shorty0
Reviews.Content: We Love Singapore and the friendly people who make our stay that much more enjoyable is a credit to the hotel and its very friendly and curtious people. The staff on the 10th floor where we stayed were excellant including the cleaners and rom service staff Thanks for a lovely holiday and we hope to see you again soon Peter and Helen Long Perth Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: VonStiffy
Reviews.Content: Amazing, absolutely amazing! The staff fall over themselves to please you and they really take pride in making you feel special, the food is great and the rooms are adequately sized with smart furnishings. The pool & massage area is a must on a hot day. I highly recommend this hotel for singles or couples. Greatt location too!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: toga1k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park hotel on New Year's Eve 2009. They had prepared the two connecting rooms as requested prior to arrival. Overall check-in process was prompt and efficient. The rooms we got (706 and 707 connecting), while not large, were functional, clean and had all the necessities anyone would need. Beds were super comfy, TV has all the right channels for international guests (CNN, NHK, CTV, etc.). The room service was prompt when I called to have the connecting doors unlocked. The hotel location is second to none, 5 min casual walk to Clark Quay. In fact that was the original reason that I booked this hotel in the first place. The logic being that there must be some New Year celebrations and parties around Clarke Quay that night, and that we do not need to worry about transportation back to the hotel after the celebration. In general, both hardware products and software services, in my opinion, were very competent. I am sure there are other areas that can improve, but I did get a sense the staff is putting extra efforts to make guests' stay an enjoyable one. Overall, I feel the “value” or price/performance ratio of the Park hotel Clarke Quay is excellent in a city like Singapore. I would stay here again next time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: merciless
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Hotel from Feb 1 to 13. When I arrived at 8:30am the room was not ready but was offered breakfast by the Reception Manager - Evelyn. When I went to my room it was small but was ugpraded to a Club room which was much more spacious. Evelyn was very helpful and accomodating and could not ask for better service. Evelyn arranged a trip to Indonesia, golf game, restuarant reservations, etc ..... Her team was also very service oriented and remembered what ate and did not need to ask .. it was served without asking. it was an enjoyable experience. The room was very clean, spacious, had all the amenities (kettle, iron, bathrobe, slippers, etc) and the bed was very comfortable to sleep in . The airconditoner was easy to control so the room was just right for sleeping and working. The breakfast in the main dining area was crowded and the food selection was average; however, in the Club Lounge it was not crowded and food selection was better. The fitness centre was just right and with enough equipment to have a good all round exercise session. Location was excellent since it was close to many restuarants and a large supermarket was just across the road. The singapore river and the river walk were good remedies to relax after a hard day's work. Check in and check out was fast and no problems were encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeloverKent
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean hotel with full amenities and excellent location for a stay in Singapore. First class

Reviews.Title: “A well located new hotel with excellent service in the business rooms”
Reviews.Author: steve110
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel is a well located new hotel close to Clarke Quay. The rooms are relatively small but comfortable and the service in the business rooms was exceptionable with lots of free 'add ons' - laundry, evening drinks and snacks, internet etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Scotsmaninmalaysia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than 1 year old and as such, it still looks and feels new. Good sized well appointed bedrooms and nice bathroom with big rainshower type shower head. My deal was room only so didn't use the dining area which did look very busy in the morning. In Singapore, its nicer to head along the river for a $15 brekkie. Come out hotel, go to river, turn right and walk 0.5km and you'll start to hit lots of little breakfast cafes. Swimming pool is nice and good size but not too many sun loungers so you might want to do your pool time early. Its positioned so it gets the sun virtually all day. The check/in reception area is small and can get pretty crowded when a coach is arriving or departing. Check out can be slow when some numpty ahead of you is micro checking each room bill item by item and demanding that miscellaneous charge A be moved to room B invoice for expense claim purposes yada yada. Drinks by the pool are expensive; go to the 7/11 shop and buy your own juice or beer. I'd stay here no problem

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: JustRelaxM
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Singapore . Our room was facing the singaore river, beautiful view. Location of the hotel is excellent, Clark Quay has a buzzing night life. Hotel staff is very polite and helpful, and the rooms are cleaned , sheets changed every day.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: wojtiLondon
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel in good location close to clark quay.rooms very small but clean nice pool.one minus when I tried to check in at around 14:00 I was asking to wait one hour because my room was not ready.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, good price for a new hotel !”
Reviews.Author: BScorpio
Reviews.Content: It has been 4 yrs since I last visited SIN on business. I used to stay in hotels on Orchard Road but this time I was recommended a new hotel, Park Hotel Clarke Quay, it is so near to all the restaurants and bars, perfect location. My experience had been hassle free from the moment I checked in to the time I left. Althought I didn't spend much time in the hotel to enjoy the facilities due to my busy schedule, I must say I was really happy with the service and my bed was really comfortable... I will come back in my next trip !

Reviews.Title: “best area in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: brianpolo
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel situated in the best area, in my opionion, in Singapore. It is in Clarke quay beside Robertson quay. The rooms are spotless and the bathroom and mini-bar well stocked. The staff are extremely courteous and friendly. Compared to other hotels which I researced this hotel was one of the best in relation to reviews and price. We never used the restaurant or the pool as we were too busy sight-seeing and as most of the restaurants in Clark quay and indeed Singapore are overpriced we tended to eat at the hawker centres etc....They are inexpensive and the service is quick. Mostly everything is cooked as you stand. Do buy duty free once landing at the airport as alcohol is a rip-off. Cost of a pepsi is aprox £5 at a pub and this does not include any alcohol. Beer is around £7 for a glass (not pint). The GRT is only a 15 min walk away and is necessary to get around. It is easy to use and inexpensive.Certainly if you want a very clean hotel at a good price (for Singpore) stay at PARK HOTEL CLARK QUAY. Go to the Fairmont Hotel for the best view from the highest hotel in Singapore. The new Asia bar. Happy hours until 9pm . So much better than Raffles.

Reviews.Title: “not sure i would call this a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tmc2003
Reviews.Content: Ok. so when you walk into the hotel, it was beautiful. everything everyone said it would be. the restaurant was nice, the pool was absolutely stunning, i even found that the rooms were adequate...I went with my partner and my family and our room and my parents room was adequate, the kids rooms (with the two single beds) was slightly smaller and less roomy. aside from the bathroom being rather small, it was still adequate. However, there was one problem that, for me dropped this hotel right down. The service. breakfast was the worst. we stayed 5 days. 3 of those days we had to wait almost half an hour for a table at breakfast. and we had young children with us and only a limited time to see all of singapore so this was highly inconvenient. after people would leave, it took the staff a considerably long time to clean the tables and more often than not we had to eat at the table with dirty dishes. on one particular occasion, we had to ask 3 times for more cutlery. almost every breakfast time, they would run out of plates and glasses and you had to wait for more. on the last breakfast I asked twice for a coffee. I am still waiting for it. also a few times we asked for clean towels and we didn't get them. The hotel itself was definately a 5 star hotel, but for me, sevice is the most paramount thing that a hotel can offer and this hotel fell very short of offering it. because of this i wouldn't recomend this hotel. however, if sevice is not on your list of most sought out amenities, then i would highly recomend this hotel. on another note. singapore itself was amazing and I would definately go back there again

Reviews.Title: “A happy experience!”
Reviews.Author: Gabriel11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. We had late checkout pre-arranged. Breakfast food was well presented and tasted great! I enjoyed the buffet. I was disappointed by the range of fruits offered, just watermelon. Room service was excellent. Delivery of food was prompt and it arrived hot. There was no extra charge added to the bill, which was unusual in my experience. The location was convenient to metro and taxi access was easily arranged when we left the hotel for high tea at the Raffles. We had a short walk to the Quays and the many restaurants there. The pool area was beautiful. We went swimming each day. The only drawback to this hotel was they do not seem to have smoking free floors. We were changed from our first room as it smelled of cigarette smoke. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were given complimentary internet access. For the price, this was an outstanding hotel and i would go there, again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel on Robertson Quay”
Reviews.Author: Davidfan
Reviews.Content: Sparkling new hotel on Robertson Quay. Didn't eat at the hotel as good cheap food just a short walk away around Clarke Quay and in the basement of the shopping centre across the river. Also ate well and very cheaply in Little India, and less cheaply (but worth every cent! ) for a celebration meal in the Tiffin Room at the Raffles. As previous correspondents have commented the rooms are rather small, but well appointed. We found the air con rather cold and were unable to raise the temperature. As soon as we turned the temperature up it defaulted to freezing cold again. Fortunately I had brought a jumper from UK which I needed in the room. Beautiful swimmimg pool which we thoroughly enjoyed. Overall a good stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Style, location and a great value”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelGuy9
Reviews.Content: While researching Singaproe hotels I stumbled upon this gem. Situated on the river in Clarke Quay, it is an easy walk to many of the sites (15/20 minutes to Chinatown/Raffles Hotel). Park Hotel sparkles and shines as it is quite new. Many of the reviews on tripadvisor mention that the rooms are small, but I didn't find them overly small. I would not call them spacious, but space comes at a premium when you are on a small island. The swimming pool was very nice and I thought the breakfast buffett was quite good. I did not book directly with the hotel, but through a third party (1.800.Hotels) as the hotel website's prices were quite a bit higher than what other vendors were offering. If I return to Singapore I would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overated for Asian hotel standards”
Reviews.Author: cuddles08
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights for a short break in Singapore. Like the many other reviews, I agree that the room is too small, even for one person, there is hardly room to move about. In addition, the bathroom is a see through glass partition, which is totally transparent. There are no curtains. this could be part of the design to make the room appear bigger. Am not sure though whether this is the feature for all the rooms, or just for singles. But really, won't be able to use the bathroom with ease, should there be any other persons in the room! Location-wise, the nearest MRT station is really not that near. One would have to walk alongside Clarke Quay, cross the bridge and walk somemore. There are no shuttle bus services to bring one to nearest attractions, or the shopping street of Orchard, unlike other hotels. There is, however, a shuttle bus service to Suntec City Mall, but of which is operated by Suntec, and not from the hotel. Information such as these are not easily available, and one has to specifically ask the receptionist. I find it disappointing also that there is no information file in the room, to inform of available services in the hotel. Coffee at breakfast was also the weakest coffee ever tasted; I even thought it was accidentally mixed with tea, and asked to change but alas, `coffee' of the same weak watery taste was given back to me! I wouldnt come back again to this hotel. In Singapore there are many other better hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel service”
Reviews.Author: corvinaSingapore
Reviews.Content: it was a wonderful stay at the hotel for the two nights we stayed - a very courteous hotel with staff with good manners .keep it up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Bobblenose
Reviews.Content: Smart new hotel, good location, reasonable price. I agree with other reviewers about lack of storage space in bedrooms, but if you're only staying a couple of nights you don't unpack much, do you? But what makes the Park really stand out is the staff - the charming Manager told us he always chooses staff "who are nicer than me" (!) On the morning of our departure, smiling chef James, having got up early to cook us omelettes at 5-30am, then helped two older ladies from our group to carry their cases out to the waiting coach. Can't see that happening in London! We'd return to the Park for the service alone!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints -- except maybe the view ; )”
Reviews.Author: acurrie
Reviews.Content: I should explain my title -- I booked a deluxe river-view room at The PHCQ and found myself face-to-face with the dumpy Robertson Quay hotel where I had stayed some seven years prior. Really can't anything bad about this property. I booked a club-level room so I got to eat my included buffet breakfast on an exclusive club-level floor -- a good thing since the lobby restaurant seemed like a bit of a zoo. The club floor also offered complimentary happy hour cocktails but I wasn't around for that. The room was very modern if a bit small, and while the wired Internet connection worked like a charm it seemed that the flat-screen television was getting it's signal over the air from an antenna -- no matter, I didn't come to Singapore to watch TV! If I may offer one piece of advice it would be to look beyond the hotel to get your laundry done -- the PHCQ would have charged me over $100 for a week's worth of clothes but there's a laundromat called I-CLEAN a block away (in the same complex as the Singapore Repertory Theatre) that'll do an entire load for $13. While my stay at the PHCQ was a bit expensive they do have cheaper rates available, and I remember them being in line with other local properties. If you can afford it, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: SandNUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our way to New Zealand and on our way back. This hotel is great, the pool is amazing, the gym brand new. The location is very good: it is actually in Robinson Quay rather than in Clarke Quay but it wasn't a problem as we soon discover that you can easily walk to Chinatown or Orchard road in 20 minutes (it is warm outside so you don't want to walk too fast). There is free wireless internet access across the road, outside the small shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, cool view and a nice pool!”
Reviews.Author: nicolas13
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel Clarke Quay is a really nice place to stay in Singapore. It's within walking distance of Orchard Road (shopping), Clarke Quay (restaurants and... more shopping) and Chinatown (for shopping? sure!). In half an hour or so, you can reach the famous Merlion or Raffles Place. We rarely use taxis, but one can be stopped all day long. The MRT station can be reached in 5 minutes. The purple line will bring you to Harbour front in a blink of an eye (Sentosa & Vivocity awaits you). If you wish to stay in the close vicinity, you may walk on Robertson Quay or get something to eat/drink at the supermarket (or 7 Eleven) on the other side of Clemenceau Rd. Mc Donald's is also there. The hotel is fine, the hall is not "grandiose" but looks nice. We arrived really early (around 9 am) and got our room with no need to wait. Good point! Room itself is a bit small (it's hard to hide luggages). Still, the view - from the 18th floor - is great and the decoration is nice. The bathroom is perfectly clean, amenities are good. May I add: no free wifi (too bad) and a limited choice of Tv channels. We used the pool and it was a really nice experience. It's located on level 2, so you don't have to fear to cross a hall in swimwear (I lived that in Canada). Temperature was good, refreshing. And the jacuzzi was a real plus, after a long day of walking. Towels are always available. We did not try the hotel breakfast. It looked okay, but the restaurant was a bit cold. Nice pastries can be found elsewhere. Otherwise Starbucks are everywere (but c'mon, try something else!).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MozzerUk
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights in the Park Hotel. found the service and the furnishings were first rate all staff very helpful. the rooms cleaned every day and full toiletries replenished every day. bathrobe and slippers provided, the room was a good size plenty of space to put clothes good view. even had bathroom with a view (all corner rooms have glass wall in bathroom) TV, internet, tea/coffee making, mini bar, torch and safe. Breakfast plenty to choose from bacon, noodles, cheese, fruit, rolls, toast, potatoes, salmon, sausages, freshly cooked eggs, fruit juices and tea/ coffee and much more. when hotel had big party from cruise ship for 2 nights breakfast was also served on second floor by pool so no waiting for breakfast. MRT easy to get to 10 mins walk and easy to use. underpass next to hotel to get to Clark Quay and MRT so no need to cross busy road. all in all our stay at this Hotel and Singapore was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: somersetbill
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 4am after a delayed flight - and the staff couldn't have been more helpful - we were shown to our room quickly and all the staff continued to be attentive and helpful throughout our stay. The room was a wee bit small - but adequate. We had a room on the second floor overlooking the pool. If you do stay here avoid room 219 as it is next to a gents toilet (not a problem in itself) but the flush is noisy and, of course, the toilet can be used at any time of the day or night. The room has free tea/coffee and the usual minibar and an internet connection (charged for). It lacks a welcome pack outlining the hotel's services and amenities - you have to ask the concierge or at reception if you want information. The views from the rooms at the front of the hotel are great - but the views from the side of the hotel are very different. It's well worth the while making sure that you do have a good view. The breakfasts are great (you may have to queue to get your eggs cooked) and there is a good choice to suit most tastes. The basics are the same each day - but there is always something different each day (I've never had curried chickpeas for breakfast before - but they were well worth trying)!!! The location of the hotel is great - just a few minutes walk from a large choice of restaurants and bars (exit the hotel and turn left then walk along the river with the river on your right). Many sights, attractions and shopping malls are within walking distance (although taxis are a cheap alternative). We had a great five days here and we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Shiney and New”
Reviews.Author: gavve60
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights late October as a stopover. Check in easy and staff attentive. Room was corner overlooking the pool and very modern. Looking out at night you could see the kites flying over the river. The room maybe a little small for 2 people but travelling solo it was very cosy. Comfortable bed, fluffly towels with all the amenities. Only hotel I stayed in Asia where bottled water wasnt provided( a must if you are contemplating doing any walking). 10-15 min walk to the quay which is full of restaurants and bars. A few restaurants nearby. Ate in hotel restaurant x 1, food was delicious. Lobby with internet site (note you pay around $5 per half hour for use) Pool was beautiful but no service, it would be good to have a wait person for drinks or snacks. Also no guest book in room only room service/spa/TV channels menu. I found this odd as you then had to ask about other services. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: KellyandAdam
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing value and a real treat to stay in, due to it being a new hotel everything felt new and soft. We had an end room so not only did we have one window overlooking the pool, we also had another window to the left overlooking Clarke Quay and city buildings. Room: Wonderfully clean, bed big and comfy, bathroom was awesome with a big shower. As stated by others, there is a glass see through wall so your room sharer will witness everything you use the bathroom for! Location excellent, bus stop on main road 2 min walk, clarke quay 5 min walk and MRT about 15mins below the mall opposite the Quay restaurants. Taxi from airport was reasonable and easier than MRT. China Town was a 15-20 min walk from hotel, turn right at the main road. Hotel pool - was very big and jacuzzi was great. Clarke Quay was our favourite spot for restaurants and bars, really trendy and a fun atmosphere. Note: If you buy anything over $100.00 singapore dollars, you can claim the tax back at the airport. Only 6% but good if you spend alot.

Reviews.Title: “New good but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Grant13
Reviews.Content: The Park Hotel is a very new and well appointed hotel. We found that the service and the furnishings were first rate, however the room sizes were just a little too small - they bring back memories of an IBIS hotel - there was nowhere to unpack your clothes that did not go on hangers and everything just felt a little cramped. The location of the hotel is good without being great - it is a bit of a walk to the nearest station and the centre of Clarke Quay is still about a 10 to 15 minute walk. In saying this it was not a great problem and it was certainly the best hotel in its price range this close to Clarke Quay. The breakfast was great and the pool facilities were also good All up a good middle range hotel which still has that newe feeling

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway Deal”
Reviews.Author: sengkang
Reviews.Content: Booked their weekend package in October. Location: In between Clarke Quay and Mohd Sultan. Wonderful location to enjoy both clubbing/ dining in the neighbourhood and also a quiet and cosy retreat. Hotel: New Hotel, everything is neat and clean. We like the fact that they do not have that many rooms so it's not crowded and rowdy, that makes us feels so relax. Spacious swimming pool Room: Decent size with bathtub and full toiletries amenities. They have wide variety of cable channels, including soccer! We find the blanket & bathroom slippers very fluffy and comfy. Our room has unobstructed view of the Singapore River and Clarke Quay. Overall, we love it a lot. The weekend package comes with breakfast, 50% off buffet dinner, and free riverboat ride! Great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Negative experience, dirty hotel with cockroach”
Reviews.Author: pandorpandora
Reviews.Content: Dead bodies of cockroach were found next to the toilet bowl. The manager did not offer to change the room for us at once. After complaining, we could change to another room only for next 2 nights. The location is not very convenient, long walk (over 20 minutes) to Clarke Quey MRT station, need to access by taxi most of the time, though the taxi fare is less than SGD 10 to many tourist spots. The only positive thing - pool is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for location & value. Amenities can improve”
Reviews.Author: pol2vega
Reviews.Content: I just spent a weekend stay over the weekend with my wife. One thing that probably stood out during our stay was the service. We were initially upgraded to a deluxe on a higher floor. Due to our request to be able to see the river, we were given a pleasant and relaxing pool view - our thanks to Xin Yuan for her help in this. While hotel staff were generally friendly, the breakfast staff appeared to be the only ones that wore frowns on their faces, perhaps due to the high volume of traffic. Location-wise, there's no question that the hotel is ideally placed to Clarke Quay and the Singapore River. It's just minutes from Orchard Road by cab. Nuff said. Regarding the amenities, the hotel is really new. The lobby is cozy flanked with 2 internet terminals at the corner and the restaurant on the other side. The lifts are spanking new and I overheard some guests marvel at its interior. The swimming pool was like the hotel's centrepiece, with a jacuzzi on one side and huge stone slabs on the other for people to cross. One minus is there's no sauna or shower facilities on the pool level. Also, it seems the hotel didn't really put much thought into the parking spaces. There was space for about 25 cars with some lots taken by the restaurants filling some lots with their trays/dishes. Strangely enough, guests can't even enter directly into the lobby. It didn't really give a first good impression but thank goodness the rest of hotel experience made up for this. Room-wise, it was rather small but equipped with the necessary fridge, coffee/tea, LCD TV, desk and table. Having visited a few other hotels of equal or admittedly better calibre in Singapore, I'm surprised that quite a few things are amiss. 1. Bathtub - no explanation needed. 2. Good placement of TV ports - you could only plug to the TV itself. Other hotels provide a dedicated panel of display and audio jacks that is conveniently placed for users to plug in. This is all the more surprising considering it is one of the newest hotels in Singapore. 3. Complimentary water - I would think this is a default. Apparently not. To be fair, it was a nice cozy room with a good view and we spent lots of time looking out and enjoying the relaxing view. And yes, the room amenities are very new. Value-wise, the package for locals is great in that it provides tickets for a River Taxi return trip to One Fullerton, an extended checkout time of 3pm, breakfast and complimentary internet. Park Hotel should really keep this promo.

Reviews.Title: “new and sparkling”
Reviews.Author: mustafaetkarim
Reviews.Content: a new and luxurious hotel frienldy and professional staff close to bus station

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Underrated”
Reviews.Author: darrypars
Reviews.Content: Depended on tripadvisor to search for an appropriate hotel which was close to the fun locations in singapore yet quiet enough to enjoy the stay... the park hotel was a revelation. just three months old at the time of our stay, it lacked nothing and provided every thing. since it was the first outing for my baby (aged 7 months) we were very apprehensive. The location firstly was brilliant. 5 mins walk to clarke quay and 5 minutes to robertson quay took care of our night life. being confirmed foodies, the array of moderately priced restaurants in both quays took care of the palate. the hotel staff was very accomodating with quality information and help. the service in the restaurant was very very good and added to the experience. the breakfast was very elaborate and nicely arranged. The rooms though small were very clean and well mantained. Overall the hotel provided a homely living experience. Thank to them and to tripadvisor for the same

Reviews.Title: “Elegant small hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisshan168
Reviews.Content: Very small, but new. The rate is OK. Easy access to Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience! Beautiful hotel! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Karina_Gav
Reviews.Content: What more could you want? Beautiful hotel, very helpful staff and a amazing poolside! This new hotel was a pleasure to stay in and was very convenient to local shops and the main area of Clarke Quay as you could walk to these desinations with ease. Not a single problem with this hotel and the staff here throughout the whole hotel were great especially the housekeeping staff who were very helpful and kind. This pleasant experience has had us already planning our next trip to Singapore at this same hotel in February 2010 so cant wait to be back there again. Thank you so much Park Hotel Clarke Quay for a wonderful and exciting experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely new hotel right on the river!”
Reviews.Author: Cruzey
Reviews.Content: Superb location with loads of good restaurants and interesting sights within walking distance - 15 minute walk to Orchard Road or catch a taxi for less than $5 (Sing)! Friendly staff to whom nothing was too much trouble! Absolute bargain at the moment, as this new hotel makes itself known - superb breakfast thrown in (you must have one of the omelets cooked to order!) and free wifi (huge plus - they would be well-advised to keep this as part of the package!). Gorgeous pool with an in-built spa and well-appointed fitness centre! The room was very small but superbly furnished with huge windows which looked out across the river - the blackout curtains are essential with the lights right outside each window. Lovely bathroom! Could not have asked for better - we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Value in Money exclusive construction was best”
Reviews.Author: StevenTSUI
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really new, construction is needed to maintain the property quality and certain level of service but the job should be done after 10:00hrs as you could hear drilling / hammering from "09:30hrs". Room facilities, pool, gym are great in value. You can walked from Central shopping mall throught the flyover and driveway to hotel in ten minutes time. Taxi from Clarke Quay to hotel around SGN 10.00. Daily newspaper will not be provided to departure guest, it seems ridiculous. Even it was under part of operation cost but from the point of paying guest, I should get one even departure in morning / noon. For green environment, management can decide to reduce the classified or advertising column order area from the post as people stay there for leisure or business, they are not looking for job there at Singapore. "Should be more customers oriented to upgrade the service standard to FOUR STARS category in future. No wifi internet signal in room / lobby but hotel provided complimentary computer terminals at lobby area. No complimentary bottle of water set up in room. Don't try to walk from back side of the property to hotel, the security staff was fiercely much. No matter what kind of dress code you wore, for me I wore pair of shorts, round neck T-shirt with a pair of rover shoes plus a shopping bag and back pack around 23:00hrs (19 August 2009), he walked out from his office at the side-way, to scan me until I back to the hotel lobby, it was really impolite, unfriendly and unqualified staff there to ruin the whole image of the hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: MTL72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this brand new hotel for 2 nights and were lucky enough to arrive on the day of their 'official opening' and attend the 'opening night cocktail party'. Fantastic location for Orchard Road, Clarke Quay and Boat Quay, all within walking distance. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definately return to this hotel in the future. Great weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Shimmering & Spanking New!”
Reviews.Author: michellevoyager
Reviews.Content: I don't usually stay at places i have never heard off so i was expecting the worse. I arrived at around 2pm tired, hungry and grumpy. The taxi turned into the entrance, on the side came the bell boy running - 1 to open the door and 1 to get my bags. Good signs already. The marble lobby was polished, and the smell was new. The check in was fast, all my details down pact right down to my request not to be put in a room with odd numbers. I had ready some previous posts about the construction work - There was none. It looks like everything was done already. The next thing that happened really stood out in my memory - The lift was gold. Like all gold..! Haha I got to my room, which was not large but a comfortable size. Everything was spanking new. The carpet - the beds, the large TV screen. Really nice touches like beakfast till 4pm on Sunday all made for an excellent stay. I won't say anymore except that i am truely impressed and will be back. Stay here while it is new and undiscovered!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, still very new and not many guests”
Reviews.Author: Jason77
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel whilst researching and got a great opening deal to stay there. Stayed in a club level room - top floor. The rooms were well fitted and comfortable, although definitely not large, we had our 4yr old with us and with luggage the room was not very big. The room had a large LCD tv on the wall and good reception and the bed was comfortable. The staff I thought were great and made all efforts to help you. We ate breakfast in both the club lounge and the main restaurant and both were good without being exceptional. The location was good, right next to Clarke Quay river and not far to get anywhere. The pool and gym facilities were good, the pool was quite large in size. I would recommend this hotel to anyone in particular any business travelers, it was well suited and designed for them

Reviews.Title: “6 STAR AMENITIES - 4 STAR PRICE!!”
Reviews.Author: Doby218
Reviews.Content: Park hotel has certainly raised the bar. i was SHOCKED to say the least - especially for the price i paid, expected a really crummy hotel (like similarly priced hotels around the area) but instead, got fantastic value for money and plush fittings! Everything was spanking brand new and totally designer luxe. The location is a 2 min walk from the ultra chic nite life hot spot of clark quay and of course minutes away from Orchard road - so convenient!! plus all the SPAs around in walking distance! and my fav part - we could have breakfast till 4pm!! (this was included in the room rate at the time for me) - its the little things like this that make me love a hotel and want to keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Spanking new...watch this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissRobinson
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here...the whole place just has that brand new feeling. From the rooms, restaraunts, gym - even the lifts. Everything is glowing. We were expecting noise as some of the hotel was still under construction - but there was no noise and we had a great nights rest. The locaton is ideal as it is a Clark Quay, Orchard Rd & Raffles place at it's doorstep. If you're looking for a brand new city hotel in Singapore to stay in, i would highly reccomend this one!

HotelInfo.Name: Park Hotel Clarke Quay
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Unity Street, Singapore 237983, Singapore
